Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sarah191076
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel my husband and I stay here for a long week end. Within walking distance from metro. lovely breakfast and nice and clean rooms would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and Clean”
Reviews.Author: elbee52
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona in late March 2012. We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. When we checked in the man at the front desk was a bit aloof but since we stayed there for two nights and asked him for recommendations in the area for dinner he warmed up to us and gave us 2 great suggestions which we enjoyed immensely. They had a computer in the lobby with a printer which was just what we needed to print 2 pages out. We really appreciated that convenience. The rooms were very modernly furnished and it was a very comfortable stay. We would highly recommend it and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: LiseP
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. It has nice clean rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. It is 10 min walk from La Rambla and Sagrada Familia. The hop on - hop off bus passes 5 blocks away. We were given a room with 2 beds that could be separated, which was what we asked for so check on that one. The only minus was that we were given a room with a 'wall view', it must be said that we also did get a very good price, so understandable if the rooms with a view were given to higher paying guests. When we arrived we asked for a place to have lunch and were recommended 'Ravell' a block away, it was excellent food. We took the tapas which was quite a mouthful for lunch, 5 entries, 5 main courses and 3 deserts, after that we were both so full that we only had fruit for dinner (and a bottle of white :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mamejo
Reviews.Content: I love my stay in Barcelona and the hotel was nice and clean. The location off the hotel was fine, and the best restaurant La Rita was just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “EuroPark equals Euphoria”
Reviews.Author: CraigHolland_PaUSA
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived on Tuesday morning April 17th, I knew I made the right choice of hotels for my week long trip to Barcelona to spend some time with my son, who is studying abroad here. My room was ready for me when I arrived at 11:00 AM along with some chocolates and the friendliest staff I've ever experienced (and I travel quite a bit). Te rooms are extremely comfortable, great bed and bathroom and I was in a superior room with a balcony facing Arago on the 6th floor. Everyti e I needed directions for a restaurant or the best way to navigate the metro or a, 'How do I get here' question, I not only received easy directions with a smile but a map with a highlighted path drawn on it. I never got lost. When I purchased some French cheese at an artisans market in the Ramblas and came back to the EuroPark, the staff at the bar on the first floor gave me a knife, fork and napkin to make the snack easier to serve.From making dinner eservations to suggestions when to walk and take the metro, they were so helpful. the location of the hotel is incredible. 3 short blocks to Passieg de Gracia shopping, a 15 minute walk down Catalunya to Las Ramblas and walki g distance to Sagrada Famillia (Gaudi). There is an amazing supermarket and fruit and bread market on the next block on Arago and many restaurants and coffee places in the neighborhood. The Geronia metro stop is a block away and connects one stop up at Plassieg de Gracia which gives you a choice of most routes. I a still here till Tuesday morning, today is Sunday and I will not only miss Barcelona immensely, but the EuroPark as well. I will definitely be back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fab City.”
Reviews.Author: NORTHY1971
Reviews.Content: I've been a bit slow in writing as I stayed here in January with my husband and some friends. However, I just wanted to say how great this hotel was. I'd spent many nights researching where to stay and I wasn't disappointed. (Good ole TA!) This hotel is in a good location near to all the shops and is very close to the metro station for easy access to the rest of the delights of Barcelona. There are a few little cafes nearby where you can pick up coffee and pastries for breakfast for less than 3 euros. The hotel room was great. Very clean, with modern decor. Great toiletries box in the bathroom and a very well stocked, reasonably priced minibar. The bed was comfy and the pillows were good. Our friends had a room that looked out onto the main road which they found very noisy but our inside room was fine. We didn't find time to use many facilities but the pool area looked great for a little dip when the weather is good. The hotel reception staff were always friendly and helpful and they provided a left luggage room at the end of our stay. I would recommend this hotel and would return. I did love the old town area though and would potentially stay there if I went again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, plenty of space”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is friendly and clean. Great service. Close to metro, bus stop, and walking distance to all attractions. The hotel has beautiful rooms and lots of space for the price. About 15 min walking distance From tourist locations, close enough to feel convenient but far enough away that you feel the local culture. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel In the Eixample District”
Reviews.Author: lofa
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I was dying to try out this small hotel located near the heart of Barcelona. I had room 2 which has the unexpected surprise of a lovely enclosed private patio. The room was well appointed, clean and decently sized. My only issue with the rooms is that you can hear every door shut, and every chair dragged across a floor near the area. The internet connection was really good and complimentary. There are also 3 computers available for guest use in the lobby and restaurant areas. Breakfast was standard for Spain. I have had a higher quality selection of food at other hotels but there was enough variety that anyone could find something to eat. The staff is very friendly. I did eat dinner there and would not advise anyone to try that option other than for appetizers. The food was pretty atrocious, breakfast should have clued me in that the kitchen chef is basically just showing up and not going to any effort. That said, I would definitely stay here again, just eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, loved the Europark!”
Reviews.Author: sebismom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews given by others in Tripadvisor and the hotel exceeded our expectations. Staff were friendly and very helpful at all times. The hotel is very clean and centrally located. We walked to "La Sagrada Familia" and "La Rambla". Breakfast was good but we only ate at the hotel once since there is a nice cafeteria at the corner of the street and the owner is just such a nice person. If we come back to Barcelona we will definitely stay at the Europark again no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - no faults”
Reviews.Author: Chris O
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel for my birthday weekend. I can't pick any fault with this hotel as the staff were very helpful with directions and tended to our needs without hesitation. The hotel was within walking distance of 2 metro stations and not far from the hustle and bustle of las ramblas. I would easily recommend this hotel to any of my friends/family should they visit this amazing city. The roof pool/lounge area is a quirky addition to a superb hotel, a spot of relaxing in the sun after a busy day sightseeing and shopping is a must. Not a lot of sun loungers but I'm not sure the hotel was busy enough so this wasn't a problem for us. This might become a problem in the summer months when the weather is better and the hotel fills up. But don't let this fact deter you from staying at this hotel as it is a pure gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tarras10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of other trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was comfortable, in good condition and very clean. The location of this hotel was perfect for us - we prefer not to stay in the thick of a central tourist area, but don't want to be too far away from the things we want to see. Everything we wanted was within walking distance of the hotel. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: vanillasky1980
Reviews.Content: i think the hotel was in a great location. very quite and yet very close to the main shoppibg street. the rooms were greatly designed but just a bur small. a bit i say. but that takes nothing away from a great stay. the staff was very very helpful and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one”
Reviews.Author: jituno
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the reviews in that it's a good hotel in a very good location with a lot of attractions within walking distance. Stayed during the Easter holidays and found staff very friendly and helpful. Flexible and customer focused as managed to change from a twin to a double room after the first night. Only question mark about hotel was the breakfast buffet, 14 euros / person, which we found a little excessive as we don't eat a lot. Great cafe come bakery a couple of blocks down towards centre. Velto Meillo (spelling?) which serves great continentals and Coffees/teas at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “General manager”
Reviews.Author: Eric Y Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reception of the hotel was very good services. They explained all the info of the hotel. The room inside was very nice, clean. We checked-in on the top floor and was facing the main street. We found that the main street was quite busy with a lot of cars. So I came down and asked the reception for the changed of room. They reacted very quick and agreed to change another for me which was on the 1st floor and was facing the back of the hotel. The room was very quiet and nice and we were very happy with it. Our hotel was nearby the metro and walking distance to the main shopping area, approx., 15 mins by walking. Also we were quite nearby the market & supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KateJones_28
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 night stay at Europark Hotel. 10 min walk from main train station and 15 mins walk to main area of Las Ramblas. Clean, spacious, friendly, helpful, welcoming and comfortable. My friend and I were slightly concerned when told we had a room facing the main road - especially having read reviews on here - but it really wasn't a problem. It's a city- you expect to hear cars go by? MiniBar was well stocked and well priced, breakfast was superb - even after 4 days the selection was enough to keep you going all day :). Room was cleaned every day, range of toiletries were excellent, ordered room service when we arrived (flight was 4 hours due to French air traffic strikes!) and they arrived quickly and provided us with what we needed. Free Wifi was excellent, PC's available throughout the hotel and were often empty when needed. Breakfast served till 11am meaning a long lazy breakfast after a lie in. Were able to keep cases in lobby on last day until our flight. Didn't use the fitness room or pool so can't comment on them. A truely fantastic hotel to use for a fantastic stay in Barcelona. I would recommend to family and friends without a second thought. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of May 2012. No, it's not adjacent to La Ramblas, but my partner and I didn't mind as it was only a 10 minute walk, and in a good area. There's a metro and train station stop very close by - about 5 minutes walk. The room we stayed in was at the front of the hotel. It was in very good condition, and tastefully decorated. It did overlook the main road outside the front of the hotel, but the balcony doors cut out traffic noise very efficiently. It didn't affect how well we slept at all. There's a nice roof terrace with a small pool on the 8th floor of the hotel. A fantastic sun trap, and a peaceful spot to have a drink. The staff were very helpful - the day we left, most of Spain was on strike. The hotel employees were around to offer assistance, answer questions, and make suggestions on what to do, how best to get around etc. We would recommend this hotel to travellers looking for somewhere clean, modern, welcoming, and comfortable to stay, and when we next visit Barcelona, we will most likely make a booking here again. Regarding price, we booked through lastminute.com so we're unsure of what we paid per night, but we feel we got good value for money from our hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Lovely City”
Reviews.Author: Kekkann
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent 3 night stay in the gorgeous city of Barcelona. Checking in and out of this lovely hotel and the service reception was easy, no hassle, first impressions of hotel were excellent, very clean, modern tidy and friendly. Breakfast was nice, although wasn't keen on the cooked breakfasts really, but they did an assortment of yoghurts, cereals and fresh pastries which were lovely. Breakfast served until 10.30am so not too early to have to get up! Our room was very clean with huge beds and balcony overlooking the city. The pool on the terrace very attractive and had sunloungers to lay on, we had gorgeous weather for March, so this was brilliant, although the pool was absolutely ice cold, so no going in there, unless you're very brave! Mini bar in room was reasonable and bar service excellent. The drinks are cheaper in the hotel than out in the city that's for sure. Just be aware that it's a very expensive City and if you're prepared for that then you can't go wrong. I would definitely go back to this hotel and city, fully recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsr84
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my son, purpose of trip was to visit the Nou Camp for the match between Barcelona and Sporting Gijon. Stayed for 3 nights, hotel staff very friendly and helpful, room spotless, very central for train, bus or just walking to the sights. Didn't eat in hotel but numerous places nearby

Reviews.Title: “efficient safe well staffed”
Reviews.Author: ramblingron99
Reviews.Content: A week's stay OK. Clean. Breakfast, quantity reigns over quality.

Reviews.Title: “Exceelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillianh40 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, not noisy nearby, 20min stroll to centre. However the rooms weren't very sound-proofed.

Reviews.Title: “Name should be EuroTRAFFIC”
Reviews.Author: skrilis
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is very good except two big cons: 1. Room (my was 203) was directed to Arago street. The noise from street were HUGE! And it was non stop, all 24 hours - cars, motocycles, motorbikes... Feels like you live in the street. Arago street has 4/5 traffic lines, and traffic light by hotel, so you can imagine the noise comming from the street... I know, that this is not location or position of hotel problem - biggest issue is poor windows quality and sound insulation. They are not closing properly - leaves gap between frame and window/door block.. 2. First time I stayed in hotel there registration stuff were so unfriendly - no "ola" nor "hello" on the mornings then leaving hotel and in the evenings then comming back. Strange feeling - looks like they don't care who come and that they want. Overall: hotel is good, but need to fix or replace windows, and more attitude for registration stuff.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Haley M
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Europark! The hotel is in the perfect location, the rooms are spacious and so clean, the staff is super helpful & friendly. It was so nice to come back to a quiet and peaceful place after full days of shopping and sigh-seeing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Barcelona and would most definitely stay there again when I (hopefully) return to the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeds 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Temer2
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at the Europark and despite reading the (predominantly) great reviews, were still wondering whether it would be that great! Absolutely no need to worry. We arrived over 2 hours prior to check in due to an early flight and quick train travel from the airport (approx 20 mins) and were given our room keys and a map of the area by very helpful staff. We were lucky enough to be upgraded and had a room on the 5th floor with a balcony overlooking the main road. The room was smart and sleek and the bathroom (large shower) was stunning. This hotel is modern, clean and fresh. There was more than enough wardrobe space plus 4 drawers. A safe was provided, a fab little toiletries kit, which if you'd forgotten everything toiletry wise, would cover you for the first night or 2 (including show polish sponge) and a mini bar which wasn't ridiculously priced. The hotel is walking distance to Sagrada Familia, La Rambla and the harbour - most of the attractions are within 15mins walk and even Park Guell is only a 30min walk (uphill). Yes, Hotel Europark is on a main road with 6 lanes of traffic so there is some noise, but it wasn't overly obtrusive and I think it's all part of the atmosphere of having a city break. It's definitely worth going up to the pool on the 8th floor for a relaxing view of Barcelona. We didn't go in, but the views are lovely. The staff are exceptional - a credit to the hotel; they're friendly, helpful and professional and nothing was too much. Our flight home didn't depart till the evening and we were able to leave our cases in a room behind reception and they even gave us our own safe (same as the room one where you put your own code in) so we could go out and enjoy our last day. Don't be put off by the 3 stars - this is the best 3 star hotel we've ever stayed in and I think it could beat most 4 star hotels!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL & LOCATION AT THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: TomHaydock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 4 nights from 12th March & had a great break. We flew into the main airport & took up the advice to get the train in on a T10 ticket, good idea less , than 10 Euros gets you a ticket you can share , that covers your journey in & back & then another 3 trips for 2 on the metro. The train stops @ Passage de Gracia , turn left off the train for the Pau Claris exit & you pop up on the cornerr of Arago & Pau Claris just 5 mins stroll down Arago to the hotel it could not have been easierr or more economical. We checked in as room already for us @ 13:00, we were on 4th floor facing front in a superior room which includes a mini balcony ( only for standing out on) Good sized room , large king bed , comfy by some Spanish standards, large bathroom with large shower. Large LCD TV on the wall to watch from the bed, large safe to use ( & free wish all offered this -- please note RIU hotels that charge 2 Euros a day!!!) Everything spotless clean! Yes the front can be noisier but glazing is good, you get a view & the sun in the mornings. Our package gave us breakfast & I thought it was good. From a yogurt fridge you can get Actimel drinking & eating yogurts, plenty of juice/ cereals / fruit/ cakes plus hot & cold options along with toast or rolls. All help yourself bar coffee / tea served to you. We spent c an hour each morning having a lazy breakfast with lots of tables available in the 2 rooms that are used on floor 1. There are PC's available with free WI-FI by reception & also in the bar / breakfast room on 1st floor along with a printer if you need copies of anything. In terms of location it is just away from the main tourist ''rip you off ''areas ( coffee for example is 4 Euros in the rip off areas but around here its 1.50 per cup) but it is very convenient as we walked to Sagrada Familia in c 10 mins, the other way to Passge De Gracia is c 10 mins , the nearest Metro @ Girona is less than 5 mins walk. The weather was so good we walked a lot to most places Ramblas/ Port/ Cathedral/ port Olympic etc. The grid style of the roads made it very easy to walk & not get lost plus it is a very nice area to walk around in & take in the buildings etc. There is a supermarket / local market c 100 metres up Arago that is good for anything you may have forgotten etc.The hotel provide you with a very good tourist map to use on check in. I was a bit wary with the hotel only having a 3 star rating but no worries needed, it is a smart boutique style hotel, very modern / clean & good staff in a very good location.It should be 4 stars. We would certainly stay here again on a next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean rooms, good service, decent location, worth a visit!”
Reviews.Author: Nimit P
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but clean and comfortable. Hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Location was nice, quiet and a little off the beaten path. I would recommend this place for couples or smaller groups, a nice, no frills type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Visit”
Reviews.Author: Samuel N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for a week of exploring Barcelona and the surrounding area. After a full day out, we especially enjoyed relaxing on the rooftop with a drink of local wine and beer from the 1st floor dining room/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for your stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: I chose the Europark Hotel in Barcelona using Trip Advisor and we had a great stay. The hotel is in a brilliant location - really central and not in a busy touristy area, within walking distance of the Cathedral, Las Ramblas, the zoo and about 30mins walk from Park Guell. Europark Hotel is really clean, the rooms are spacious and quite modern, the reception staff were really accommodating. Only a small downside but didn't really affect our stay (but is the reason I couldn't give an Excellent rating to this hotel) was that during breakfast we did find the restaurant staff were a bit unhelpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends & family (actually already have!)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull week!”
Reviews.Author: zazded
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the europark for a week in march. Fast check-in. Confortable bed. Really quiet place. We slept well during the whole week. The nearest metro station is Girona on the yellow line. You have a little cafe near by where you can have breakfest. We had a lovely weather, so we had the chance to enjoy the roof top :) Nice price,free wifi in the room, great hotel. Do not hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Burleighmill
Reviews.Content: Caught the train from the airport, walked up the stairs at Passeig de Gracia station & we were less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel, so the location was excellent. On arrival the staff were friendly & helpful, as they all were throughout our stay, couldn't fault them. The room & the rest of the hotel was wonderfully clean, tidy & very smart. The prices in the bar & the room mini bar were the cheapest we've found in any decent hotel. We had a room at the rear of the hotel so not a great view but it was quiet even with the window open. The bed was huge & very comfortable (we like a firm bed), there was no bath tub but the power shower had more pressure than a water cannon, great to hose down after a day walking the streets of Barcelona. A great place to stay would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nekoya3321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights in March and loved the hotel. We chose this hotel based on the Tripadvisor's reviews, and all the good things said were true. The hotel is in an convenient location, next to a local market (opens 8 am), two metro stations in the walking distance, and walking distance from Sagrada familia and Palau Guell. If you are a walker, you can get to the Plaza Catalunya and Casa Mila too. After the airport bus dropped us at the Plaza Catalunya, we just walked to the hotel. We did not use the hotel breakfast service - there are three cafe/bakeries within the block. So much cheaper. But it was so nice the hotel offers a free early coffee service from 4 - 7am. The hotel staffs were very kind and helpful, every one of them. The room and facility were kept clean all the time, they even mop the street in front of the hotel everyday. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable, an average city hotel size room. The big bathtub was a great bonus. The bed was wide and short, very comfortable. Our room was on the eighth floor, so it had a nice view and the pool and the rooftop lounging area was right there. Overall, we had a great time staying at this hotel, would love to go back next time. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “just the right size”
Reviews.Author: suzi61
Reviews.Content: The price was great, walking distance to metro and attractions. Very good value for your money. Staff was very helpful. Room was not big, but you only use it to sleep anyway. Bathroom great and towels a good surprise, big. Clean and quiet. Bed a little short if you are tall, but excellent pillows. They will keep your luggage for up to 2 days if you wish. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rain66
Reviews.Content: The good stuff: good-sized room, very clean, good location, close to Metro stop Girona & walking distance to Passeig de Gracia, sumptuous breakfast, helpful staff, quick room service, close to a convenience store & a market (for water, fresh fruit etc.) To reconcile with: no bath tub in standard room, noisy unless one asks for a 'silent' room, no iron, no water in room. To carry: soap as the one supplied is tiny. Hair conditioner as none was supplied. Shampoo is supplied. Towels are great, - clean & highly absorbent. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: BSSW
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice for a hotel in Barcelona. We chose it because of the price and it was good quality for the money we paid. The hotel was in a good location, there are probably better locations but for the price, this was not bad. Like other review say, this is good for a short period of time. The rooms are nicely designed, but the black and white probably wont age too well. The breakfast was good, but not worth the money. The bathroom mirror was a nice touch and the bathroom overall was great but starting to age. The beds were comfortable (although like most in Spain, quite hard) and the pillows were lovely. It's definitely worth a look. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you don't have many days”
Reviews.Author: Pgollm
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. I had my doubts before going, since it has only 3 starts, but it surpassed my expectations. The room is really nice, great design. The brakfast is very good and the location is excelent. Great option if you are visiting the city for a short period of time. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teab
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant at this hotel last February. My room was clean with updated bathroom, comfortable bed and pillows, and had a reasonably quiet environment. I liked the toiletries presented in a box complete with a body sponge. It was a nice touch. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. They arranged the taxi and wake-up call for my departure. I traveled with my cousin and we requested for separate beds which was conveniently arranged with no problems. The wi-fi access from the room was excellent. Although there is restaurant / bar onsite, it closes around 10:00 or 10:30pm. I didn't try the food but the ambiance is cozy. Wi-fi is also accessible in the restaurant so convenient if you need to work on your itinerary or emails while having coffee or cocktail drinks. Location: The location is quite tucked in away from Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. However, it is only about a 5-10 min walk to Passeig de Gracia (Rodeo Drive of Barcelona) and Casa Batllo (one of Gaudi's); about 7-10 min. walk to Casa Mila (which is also along Passeig de Gracia), about 10-15 mins. walk to Sagrada de Familia (opposite direction from Passeig de Gracia), and about 15-25 mins walk to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The area of the hotel felt safe and I was not worried walking back at night to the hotel from Las Ramblas. There's a drugstore right at the corner and a market (smaller version of Boqueria in Las Ramblas) about a block away from the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind walking a bit to Barca's main site of Las Ramblas area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Thaihappy
Reviews.Content: Great size room and bathroom with a balcony. they originally booked us in a room at the very front but we were worried about the traffic noise as its on a very busy road and I'm glad we changed. we were on the 8th floor at the very back of the building and it was totally quiet. The view from the balcony only overlooks residence housing but it was still good. good size doors open right up on two sides for fresh air. Only complaint was the wifi in the room which we could only get a good signal sitting on the floor in the door way but the two computers they provide in the restaurant and downstairs are very quick. breakfast is very good too. Location is only a short walk to most things and we always felt very safe. its also close to the very famous artist Gaudi church and its a MUST see.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! A great hotel to see a brilliant City from”
Reviews.Author: WillR79
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely awsome four days in Barcalona over a long weekend at the end of February. We found the Europark through Trip Advisor and a couple of other sites and heartily recommend it. My fiance had been to Barcelona before, but I was a virgin to the City and this hotel worked really well for both of us. We caught the train from the airport to Passeig de Gracia station, from which the hotel was a brief walk. The location was great- about mid way between the Sagrada Familia and the top of Las Ramblas, and on hand for loads of other incredible Gaudi buildings at the Northern end of town. The room was lovely- all black and white, and excellently presented; next to the glorious terrace and roof top pool; staff were excellently efficient, and not over bearing; the map of Barca provided at reception was unusually good and the sweets in the hotel room were a great touch. Overall the whole package was good value for money. We had a great trip to Barca and this hotel was a large part of that. If I could give it 4.5 I would, but I can't and that is why it gets 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: PaulMac2012
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 night stay at Hotel Europark. We chose the hotel based on previous reviews, which didn't let us down. The hotel is ideally located just a 10 minute walk from Passeig de Gracia and Playa de Catalunya and in the other direction the Sagrada Familia. The hotel itself is modern and clean, our room was based on the 5th Floor facing onto the busy street but when the window was closed the only noise from outside that could be heard was the frequent ambulance sirens. The breakfast consisted of a good choice of hot and cold food but depending on the time the room could become very busy. Overall the staff were extremely polite and very friendly and the free wi-fi throughout the hotel was a bonus. We chose to get the train in from the airport based on price and location. The T10 ticket can be used on this journey with the cost of a one way journey for 2 people being less than €2. Based on a previous review when you get off the train at Passeig de Gracia take a left along the platform and head for the Pau Claris exit. An escalator takes you from the platform directly upto street level where you are further down Carrer D'Arago, the street which the hotel is on. It is then only a few blocks down the street. This was our first trip to Barcelona and would definitely go back to the city again and would have no hesitation in staying in the Europark again.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel, well-located for city sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterLinda
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Europark, and again it provided a good base for our 4 days in Barcelona. The hotel is modern, well maintained and the comfortable bedrooms are kept spotlessly clean. The bathrooms are excellent with a good range of toiletries provided and re-stocked daily. We asked for and were given a quiet room at the rear of the hotel. There was no noise whatsoever, but of course there was no view from the bedroom window. If you want a good view, you may need to tolerate the traffic noise from the busy Carrer d’Arago. Despite some previous TripAdvisor reviews, we found the reception staff to be friendly, welcoming, courteous and helpful. The hotel breakfast (around 8 Euro) is an extensive buffet of hot and cold food, with fruits, cakes, meats and cheeses. It is perfect for those who like to “fill up” at breakfast, but anyone who wants only coffee and a pastry may prefer to eat more cheaply at one of the numerous local cafes. For later dining, we enjoyed the “menu del dia” late lunch and found that the nearby restaurant “O Fiadeiro” (at C Mallorca 334, intersection with Av Diagonal) provided an excellent 3 course meal plus wine for 10.5 Euro. We ate at around 3 pm daily and the restaurant was still full of locals, which is usually a good sign of value for money. For any other food or other purchases, there is a supermarket 2 minutes away from the hotel, housed in the basement of the old Mercat de la Concepcio (out of hotel, turn right along Arago). The hotel is easily reached by train from the airport. Use the RENFRE train to Passeig de Gracia station (25 minutes) and then it is an easy 5/10 minutes walk along Arago to the hotel. If you buy the T10 ticket strip (9.25 Euro) you can use this for travel to and from the airport, which is excellent value at less than 1 Euro per person per journey. Remember to keep one of the 10 T10 journeys on the ticket for the return to the airport. If you buy a separate ticket from the city to the airport, it will cost around 4 Euro per person! We paid a higher B&B rate compared to February 2011, but this seemed to be general in hotels across the city in preparation for a major trade fair the following week, when more than 60,000 delegates were expected. We would recommend the Hotel Europark for anyone wishing to stay in Barcelona. We shall stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quite expensive for a 3 star but very good value”
Reviews.Author: dntz
Reviews.Content: 1. Booking: we booked directly with the hotel (reservation was handled quickly) a top view room on the 9th floor, at a price of EUR 175/night. These rooms are quiet and have a lovely and large terrace with wooden floor, perfect for a glass of wine in the evening! 2. Rooms: they are modern and newly fitted with smart decor and there is nothing to fault them. Big flat tv with good channels, good speed internet (free of charge), safe etc. Bathroom was pretty luxurious too, a nice surprise from a 3 star. 3. Pool: there is a small outdoor one on the 8th floor but was too cold for anyone using it. 4. Breakfast: very good selection and attentive staff 5. Parking: it's in a garage at the ground floor and it is not operated by hotel, price is about EUR 25/day. Beware with the staff, are quite rude, they have their own rules how to park and they enforce them! 6. Location: it is quite good, few minutes walk to Passeig de Gracia, the closest metro station (Girona) is only about 200 m away. There is a market and supermarket near the hotel (turn right when you exit), few convenience stores opened late. Dining possibilities are limited, a pizza take away and a sushi restaurant across the street. You should venture further for more options, which anyway you have to do for shopping, sights etc. Apart from the price (high for a 3 star), there was nothing we had to complain about this hotel and therefore I am giving it the maximum rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 1 week and we really liked it! Nice, friendly staff; comfortable rooms, excelent bathroom amenities; good location. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “"so beutifull hotel"”
Reviews.Author: James N
Reviews.Content: erfect service, nice and clean rooms, good staff, bathroom with heated mirror, excellent breakfast, location near everything and a nice roof-terras with (a small) swimming pool. Breakfast very good service coffee with hot milk and fresh fruit! Nice view over the street also. When we go back to Barcelona, we want to stay... more This hotel was in a great location, 5 minute walk to the passgage Gracia which is the main street where you can get all the tourist buses and a great selection of shops and restuarants. The room was clean, spacious (but not huge) and the bathroom was lovely. The staff were friendly and helpful. Another plus was the free... more

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: a_kav87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, 5 minute walk to the passgage Gracia which is the main street where you can get all the tourist buses and a great selection of shops and restuarants. The room was clean, spacious (but not huge) and the bathroom was lovely. The staff were friendly and helpful. Another plus was the free internet in the hotel, we were able to use their computer to check in for our return flight and print our boarding passes free of charge. The breakfast was ok, but I would recommend finding a cafe somewhere as it is be cheaper and just as nice. I woud definitely stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexander v Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect service, nice and clean rooms, good staff, bathroom with heated mirror, excellent breakfast, location near everything and a nice roof-terras with (a small) swimming pool. Breakfast very good service coffee with hot milk and fresh fruit! Nice view over the street also. When we go back to Barcelona, we want to stay in hotel Europark!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but staff could be improved”
Reviews.Author: frfp1984
Reviews.Content: After we found a great deal on internet I decided to book this hotel. Had a great surprise as this is a very modern and stylish hotel. Close to the metro station and in an easy walk to Catalunya square this hotel is well located. Our room had a king-size bed and was spacious. A big range of amenities, towels and perfect cleaning. We just loved it! They provide on arrival a map and a small directory about Barcelona. Whenever you need they have 3 computers with free access for internet. Breakfast is very nice with a big variety on fruit, cakes, yoghurts, natural juices, etc. Also the room service menu is very atractive with lots of dishes to choose from. Staff was not so nice, everytime we went to reception they never say 'hello' 'how are you' 'how can i help you'.. they seem to be bored when a guest cames to the balcony, specially the young man working at night most of the times. One day I asked for the nearest buses and the answer I got was 'I don't know'... on breakfast staff speaks and laughs very loud when they go inside to bring our coffee. They should have some training on how to deal with guests. Besides this minor aspects we truly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return to this hotel if we ever go back to the beautiful Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Style in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located: from the airport it takes you about 25 min by train to get to the hotel. From the trainstop, it´s just a 5min-walk to the hotel and from there you can easily get to all impotant sights either by walking or bublic transportation. The black and white design of the hotel is very appealing and the rooms are very clean. Service is excellent. Breakfast buffet is nice, with a good variety of fresh fruit, warm dishes and lots of sweet stuff and breakfasttime is till 10.30 am. Staff is very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TimeTravelWife
Reviews.Content: Europark Hotel was a great base during our Barcelona stay. It was perfectly clean, attractive, cozy and comfortable. The room wasn't large but it was quite adequate. We asked for a quiet room and got a very quiet back facing room as we requested. There is a food market (a smaller version of La Boqueria) 1/2 a block away which we visited several times. The metro is quite close; it took about 15 minutes to walk to the top of Las Ramblas. It was easy to walk from the hotel to the Gaudi apartment buildings.and about a 10 minute walk to La Sagrada Familia. Convenient without being smack in the touristy area. Would readily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel , highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: marceloch
Reviews.Content: great stay in barcelona , vary good hotel and staff ... would came back and recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Criscrocce
Reviews.Content: Booked a room to me and my daughter based on the reviews I read on trip advisor and was very pleased. It´s a very nice hotel, modern, clean, well decorated and also very close to some of the best touristics points city has.. Front desk people are very nice and helpful. Room was quiet and had a great shower! It´s located only 20 minutes from the airport by taxi (easy access by Metro & Bus as well) The area has several nice cafes and restaurants as well as a big supermarket (short walking distance). Free internet is also a must. If I have to go to BCN again I´ll go back to this hotel. I do recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewAndNatalie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing value and situated within easy walking distance of many popular sites, the hop on hop off bus, and restaurants. The hotel rooms are spacious, modern and clean. There is a restaurant on-site. They also have a baggage check so you don't have to carry them around with you if you want to explore more before departure. There is a small pool, but let's face it, that's not why you stay here when you have one of the best beaches in the world a few blocks away. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply superb.”
Reviews.Author: Robbo140981
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay here for my wifes birthday based on all the reviews I read on tripadvisor. Super hotel....very clean, modern and an excellent location. The staff are very friendly and helpful too. How this hotel is only three star I do not know. I have stayed in 4 star hotels that don't come close to this place. Oh and the breakfast is well worth it too ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NikNaksJewellery
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November for my birthday and found that it was very clean, tidy and perfect location for what we wanted. It was just a minutes walk to the nearest Metro. The buffet breakfast wasn't that great but there was a lot of it! The only downside would be how warm it was in the corridors and the room - which we were able to turn now. Overall an excellent stay and would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “good to stay”
Reviews.Author: vilas_shahare
Reviews.Content: It was good hotel but you can hear the sound (specifically toliet flush from next room) The pool on the roof is not so big but not so bad either. water leakage in room

Reviews.Title: “V comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Toesies
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Only problem we had - the restaurant said there was no evening meals only microwaveable frozen food For a 4 star hotel I think this is not acceptable From reading other reviews I see people say they ate at the restaurant?? Strange

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: crazyseg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the EuroPark Hotel with my boyfriend. The hotel is far enough away from the tourist areas to be quiet and have decent cafes nearby but close enough to walk to tany attractions. The room was just right, lovely big bed and nicely decorated. I will stay here again next time I go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: particleboardpigeon
Reviews.Content: I'll add to the praise here. The hotel is a great value. It's in a good location, one block from a metro stop and within a few blocks of the Passeig de Gracia. It's a relatively short and pleasant walk to many attractions (or an even quicker metro ride away). The neighborhood is fairly quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They have a room to store baggage, which includes safes, if you arrive early (and we felt comfortable leaving our belongings there). Our room was stylishly decorated, clean, and comfortable. The bathroom was also very clean and tasteful. We opted for the superior room with a balcony. It faced the backs of a number of other buildings, so there wasn't much of a view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: dresswalla
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, good sized rooms, great location. the service was also very good. only downer was since i needed a smoking room, which i had asked for at time of booking, was not given , which i later realized it does not exist. The rooms have large windows which the manger asked us to keep open and smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice and Clean, Good price,”
Reviews.Author: Rockhopper83
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the hotel. I'm not a fan of the modern style, but this place had clean lines and style, with a decent enough comfort level to appeal to me. It was very well maintained, and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was on the expensive side, but there was everything you could want. It was delicious, filling, and open for a nice long time so you could eat very leisurely. We had dinner there one night, and the food was delicious but the portions were smallish. Turned out to be sufficient - but don't expect a hearty dishful like you get in the US. Hotel had free wireless, and three computers for shared use (one on main floor, two on dining floor that were only avail while restaurant was open). People shared well, and there was usually only a short wait, if at all. We had plenty to research, as we were there to cruise on Concordia - so we ended up having to do a lot of coordination once we found we were not going to be sailing. One of the misleading things that the hotel staff did tell us was that our calls to toll free numbers in the States were free. They were not, and we spent considerable time on hold - being charged nearly $45 at checkout. They said they have no control over the phones, but we had specifically asked about this, so we were not at all happy to have the bill presented to us. We would have purchased phone cards had we received the correct information. If you're going sightseeing, be sure and ask the desk what they have to offer. They had discounts for the bus tours, and maybe some other things we didn't have time to do. So ask. Hotel was great in extending our stay once we found out about the cruise. They even let us book it through internet price at hotels.com, which saved us some money. Beds were comfortable, but on the hard side. I liked it. Interestingly, they were two twins pushed together - so it was nice since I was in the room with my sister. It might not have been as wonderful if I'd been there with my husband. It took me two days to find the stairs - the emergency exit (marked as not to be used except in emergency) is not the only set of stairs as I thought at first. Once i found them, they were nice to use, with motion-activated lighting.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: oubliante
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a female friend, had previously visited Barcelona with my husband, we purposely chose this hotel for convenience to attractions and safety as we were two females walking back at night. The hotel met all our expectations, great location, 20 mins in one direction to las ramblas, 10 min walk in opposite direction to la sagrada familia, 5 mins from casa battlo and many designer stores and tapas bars, 50 min walk to park guell in the north or the beach in the other direction to the south. The hotel room was modern, very comfortable, clean always well provided with toiletries, an electronic safe and minibar. We paid for breakfast included and thought it was worth it, good choice, hot and cold food, fresh juice and unlimited coffee. would definately return again, we asked for a high a floor as possible after reading other reviews, we were given a room on floor 7 which was great and very quiet, it was very hot for us though as the air conditioning was not very powerful/cool. We slept with the window open, and with us being so high up it was still very dark and quiet. One thing I was very pleased with was that although checkout was at 11am. We were allowed to leave our luggage at hotel as our flight did not leave till 6pm. What really impressed us was that we were also allowed to use a digital safe in the luggage room, free of charge which enabled us to walk around and enjoy our last day in Barcelona without worrying about carrying valuables/passport. There was also a pharmacy with a 20cent scale just a few doors down from hotel, which was handy as being 2 females we had shopped ourselves out and wanted piece of mind before the airport as we were travelling with a budget airline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly staff, value for money”
Reviews.Author: 21susan
Reviews.Content: Can recommend this hotel, located very well, shops/restuarants/metro/ La Rambla/Sagrada familia all within walking distance, Rooms were just right and very clean and they also made the beds every morning. The front desk staff spoke ENGLISH and were very friendly. I didnt care much for a view as you only sleep in the room - so no view. On one of our nights out we found a wonderful "hole in the wall" pub called the AMSTERDAM PUB. It is in the same road as the Hotel 2 blocks down. It is run by "Bus" a hollander no idea how to spell his name. He comes across quite cocky buy man oh man does he know how to look after you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel For The Money, Staff OK”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel for the money. Nice clean rooms. I faced the back which is not a pretty view but very very quiet and that is what I wanted. The view while not pretty was interesting. You could see people hanging up their laundry on lines to dry. Rooms (we had the superior) were very nice and very well sized for Europe. Fitness center was a nice bonus. Some free weights and bikes and tread mill. Free newspapers and lovely lounge areas. Restaurant was very good for the money. We had several coffees and meals there. The only exception was one waitress on a Sunday afternoon I believe it was who shuffled over to us with our coffee while talking on a portable phone. She served us cold coffee and when we told her she merely microwaved them which made them hot but taste awful. A shame since the coffee at the hotel is usually so good. Also staff seemed to have no idea how far locales were from the hotel. We were told it would take 10 minutes to walk to a restaurant when it actually took 30 minutes. We are fast walkers and did not get lost. There were a few other similar incidents. However over all I would give this hotel a very high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: czarek r
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in BCN! Helpful and nice staff - even when you coming back to your room drunk as hell around 6-7 A.M. : ) Good location in the middle between Sagrada Familia and the La Rambla. Very nice swimming pool on the roof - great place to spend lazy afternoon before another hard night out: )

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Shortie115
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, with Girona metro stop only 5 minute walk away, and plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. The room was very clean with modern art-deco decor. Reasonable wardrobe space and safe. Small balcony to sit out on too. The bathroom was spacious with large shower cubicle (no bath in ours though). A great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: OlayaR
Reviews.Content: Overall excellent/ Nice bed and pillows, clean bathroom and room, excellent cable selection. Had dinner one night which was very good. Very good location if you wish to see the Gaudi architecture as it is within walking distance to the Casa Batllo and la pedrera as well as la Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: mrfoxy_11
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed in this hotel in January 2012. Booking site gave us a good offer in combination with plane tickets. Location is great, pretty close to the city center, metro and main attractions. Rooms are big enough, clean and well-furnished. Breakfast is ok, but you have to pay extra, it's not included in the room cost. Man at the reception desk, maybe a front office manager, was a bit mean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: blondie71716
Reviews.Content: We stayed at EuroPark during December 2011 and had a great time in Barcelona. The location of the hotel was amazing (really close to Girona stop and also within walking distance to Paseo de Gracia) and the staff her was great. They were very helpful and informative. Had coffee and an afternoon beer in the restaurant/bar which was a great way to start and end a day. If anything, I recommend you not booking a room on the 8th floor. It shares a level with the pool, which I am sure can get quite loud during the summers. The doors all around us from people going in and out was loud, but that is expected in Europe I guess. Other than that, our stay was perfect and so was our room. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Modest Hotel, Great Location, Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: Nasser P
Reviews.Content: My son (who is 15 now) and I traditionally spend the week between Christmas and New Year in Europe and for Christmas 2011 we traveled to Barcelona- Spain and we selected the EUROPARK Hotel for our stay. This is a modest hotel in an excellent location, one block walking distance to Barcelona Metro and 5 blocks walk to Passeig De Gracia (with excellent shopping and restaurants within a 12 block area) and the hotel is 8 blocks/20- minutes walk to Basilica De La Sagrada Familia which is a “must see” in Barcelona. The hotel staff is friendly and very knowledgeable and helpful. The guest rooms are on the small side however they are well appointed and very modern with good amenities (in-room safe, free Wi-fi, mini bar, flat screen TV). If you have a low-floor room facing the Arago Street (where the hotel entrance is located) you will have loud noise from the street below as Arago is a main city artery and it is busy with traffic from 4 AM until after mid-night. The food quality is good at the EUROPARK with breakfast served on the first floor of the hotel in a spacious dining room and good selection of meats, cheeses, breads and breakfast fruits and juices and the dining room staff is very friendly and helpful. My issue with this hotel is how they charge the customer and their rates; we booked on-line about 2 months prior to our departure and booked at 140 Euros (including breakfast) for 3 nights during the week and at 230 Euros (without breakfast) for the night of Dec 31st . When we arrived there, I found out the hotel was selling rooms at $110 Euros during the week (including breakfast) and $170 Euros for the night of December 31st (INCLUDING breakfast) and I was told by the front office manager (a man named Marc) that EUROPARK and all of the other 8 Nunez Navarro Hotels throughout Barcelona post higher rates on-line and for those guests who book rooms on-line they cannot offer lower rates and the customer is stuck with those higher rates. I felt totally ripped off by this hotel and will never stay there again. My suggestion is if you are planning to visit Barcelona- Spain and are considering staying in one of the Nunez Navarro Hotels (including the EUROPARK) to look on-line and see what rates they are offering for your travel dates and then call the hotel directly and strike your best deal with the hotel and avoid getting ripped off as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, close to centre and great value”
Reviews.Author: Enrets
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, close to the historical Paseo de Gracia and its Gaudì and other art-nouveau buildings (10 mins on foot), to the Sagrada Familia (15 mins on foot), and to the Plaça de Catalunya and the main shopping area. The Girona subway station is only 2 mins from the hotel (trains taking to historical sites of el Gotic in 5 mins; price of ticket 2 euros). There are many cafes, restaurants and shops near the hotel, in an area that is itself important for its modernist architecture (the Eixample) . The room (a double superior) was excellent from all viewpoints: large, extremely clean, pleasantly and soberly fitted out with very comfortable beds, and an ample bathroom (large shower, no tub). In the room there was a minibar, a safe, a lcd television with satellite channels (most of which in Spanish and Catalan, and a few in French and English), and free w-ifi connection. I did not have breakfast in the hotel, which seemed to be excellent and very substantial but a bit pricey if you need only a coffee and a croissant or cake (a cafe on the corner opposite the hotel provided them for 2 euros). The hotel is very close to the underground train station (Gracia) from/to the airport; and is not far from Plaça de Catalunya where buses take from/to the airport every 5 mins (a great service). Take the A1 aerobus if your flight is from/to Terminal 1; while both the A2 aerobus and the Renfe train go to Terminal 2 (from here a shuttle connects to the other terminal). Barcelona has a great variety of hotels in all locations, but I would use the Europark again and I would recommend it with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sxd9mm
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean. Very friendly staff. WiFi. Great facilities. Three blocks from the Metro (Subway) station. Five blocks from Passeig de Gracia (the main street). Don't need to take a taxi from the Airport - Metro will take you there for much cheaper. Can't say anything about their breakfast - we would have ours at the cafe (on every corner) on our way out. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for Christmas getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Trafalgar50
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my Christmas break in this trendy modern hotel, with its smart decor in shades of black, white and grey. A little disappointing to find only one easy chair in our Superior room, but there was a fairly big balcony to sit out on overlooking a very large and quiet courtyard. Breakfast was quite good for a city hotel; the best thing being the lovely cakes and pastries - mmm. Perhaps not the best place to stay if you want to be within easy reach of the bars and nightlife of El Born, El Ravel and Barri Gotic, as it is some 20 minutes walk away from these areas. But would be very convenient for the beach at Barceloneta in the non-winter months - just hop on the nearby Girona metro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, close but not too much..!”
Reviews.Author: Penichesurfer
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel late November 2011 after reading reviews about it on Tripadvisor. Have to say it was right up to the expectation despite perhaps a bit overpriced. The location was really ideal; geographically it is very central to the whole of Barcelona so you can just about go anywhere if you’re based there. Walking distance to the Sagrada Familia, Passeig de Gracia and of course the Ramblas, Raval and the Gothic quarters, but still far away enough to be in a safe and peaceful area away from night life buzz, can’t get much better than that. Small but comfortable room with a large double bed with an excellent mattress (very important), one but: a bit noise through the walls but nothing to keep one awake at night. Very good breakfast and a nice staff made for a very pleasant stay. There is free Wi-Fi in the rooms and when you checkout it’s possible to leave your bags in a secure room in the lobby, great if you still want to make a day trip before heading home. Would recommend a friend and book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Convenient Location.”
Reviews.Author: eweb101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights during December. From the airport I took the aerobus to plaza catalunya, the with a little help from my gps, i made the 20 minute walk to the hotel. I like being away from the noise of La Rambla, and when I wanted noise, I could easily walk down La Rambla, and even down to the beach, although the beach was a bit of a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: carl f
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful weekend at this city hotel. In our room the size of the bed hit us first it was a whopper. Its big on cleaning, all areas including the public ones are fresh and smart. As in most city hotels if you have the windows open the traffic noise can be a problem but with the windows closed we got uninterrupted sleep. It serves a good breakfast with friendly staff, coffee top ups were no problem. Easy to get all about the city, close to train and it was a nice walk to the shops after I sat too long at breakfast. Would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay @ EuroPark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyvvv
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. We arrived early morning and had to wait until check-in time to get our rooms. We had 2 rooms which faced the main street. Could hear the sound of traffic early morning. Otherwise, the rooms were clean and comfortable. We had breakfast included but when we went down to have breakfast the 1st morning, we were told it is not included and they wanted me to sign for the breakfast. After going down to the reception to clarify, they confirmed that breakfast was included. One of the staff at the reception was not very nice. Even after I showed him the confirmation I had, he still said, no. It was until the other staff who checked us in confirmed it. I was a bit annoyed that they even questioned if breakfast was included when it was clearly stated. Any way breakfast was decent but changes in food everyday would have been good. If only we had known that cafes are every where and very convenient. Computers and printer were available for printing the vouchers for shows, etc. which was good. Overall location is not too bad, although it was a bit of a walk to where the main shopping and eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iriposa
Reviews.Content: EuroPark is technically a three star hotel, but it felt like a four star hotel. Impeccably clean room with sleek decor and a comfortable California king bed. 1 block from The staff is exceptionally professional and friendly. The traffic outside is very loud if you have the windows open (I like a little breeze) but the windows are thick and insulate the sound. We took advantage of the in-room massage service (75 euros for 80 minutes can't be beat). The masseuse was very professional and competent, with a pleasant demeanor. The mini bar is well-stocked and affordable priced (3-4 euros for alcohol, not $15 like you find in USA). My only complaints was that the wifi did not work in our room and the shower was poorly designed and the glass door leaked water on the bathroom floor. Since the bathroom floor has a drain installed, perhaps this is part of the design... My other disappointment was that they did not offer a room-service breakfast menu, just a breakfast buffet. Another disappointment was their menu was extremely limited after midnight, and even more limited on Sunday after midnight. Because of this, I never tried their food. But the prices looked fair.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Thrasivoulos G
Reviews.Content: This is just an excellent hotel! I would suggest it to anyone visiting Barcelona either for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Park W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for 3 nights. The room was of average size and the design not of my taste but very neat. The housekeeping was excellent, since the room was spotless every day. the location is good, it is a 2 min walk of a metro station. The Wifi, use of computer, printing, room safe, bathsoaps, etc are free of charge. Overall it was one of the best hotel experiences in my life. Downside is that the breakfast was 14 euro p/d so we got it elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: anthony k
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Majestic on Passeio de Graca in Barcelona and having experienced great disappointment, I was really suprised by the excellent service, quality of the rooms, clean, and an outstanding business centre. Excellent buffet breakfast - all this for half the price I paid out to the Majestic. As i noe travel to Bracelona every month, this is my choice of hotel - just a five-minute walk from the main avenues. Check ninwas easy, check out much better and no hassle to your account

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful comfort and service at Hotel Europark”
Reviews.Author: JZener
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this delightful hotel from October 21-28, 2011. This hotel is within walking distance to many Barcelona attractions - just a 5 - 10 minute walk to the Sagrada Familia, and Placa Cataluna and La Rambla. The Metro Girona is just one block away, and there is a local market, and several restaurants in the immediate neighborhood. The hotel is very slick and modern with all of the standard amenities, including wireless in the room and free computer access in the lobby. The rooms are not overly large, but the bathrooms are sparkling clean with ample space. We did not take the breakfast but I do like coffee in the room. There were no coffee makers so I ordered room service every morning and for 1.50 euro I received a carafe of coffee and another carafe of hot milk (at least 4 cups of coffee) Sometimes I ordered croissants and at the end of the week the bill for this was just 12-15 euros. The staff which includes Elias, Miren, Ivan and Juan Carlos as well as the room service provided excellent service. Barcelona is an extremely busy city and you can't escape the noise of the traffic. This hotel is centrally located but away from the tourist crowds. Some highlights not to be missed are Park Guell, Sagrada Familia, the Gothic and El Born area, the Boqueria market y muchas tapas y sangria. A highly delightful trip enhanced by a very comfortable and accommodating hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, awesome service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Shaloo77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Europark Hotel just this week. It is a stylishly decorated, extremely comfortable and very clean hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. In addition to the free wireless in every room, they have a computer and printer on the main floor which is very handy for checking into airlines, printing boarding passes etc. The breakfast is good, though it tends to get a bit boring if you stay for more than a few days since they serve the EXACT same thing every day. The location - I liked that it was walking distance to Passeig de Gracia (this is like the 5th Avenue of Barcelona!) but still away from La Rambla and other overly touristy places. The Girona metro station is only a block away - a word of caution though - there is only one line (L4) that passes through this station, so to get to most places you have to take L4 to Passeig de Gracia and then change to a different lin which can involve a LOT of walking since Pg. de Gracia is a very big station and you have to go up and down several sets of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trent
Reviews.Content: We stayed Nov.9 to Nov14,2011 and found it to be quite charming.The place is very clean,has wi-fi which really comes in handy.The staff was really wonderful-especially Marc and Ada who helped us get our lost luggage.We love the morning buffet-cereal,juices,cold cuts,fruit,breads,pastry,eggs and much more.We had a balcony room on the street side-if light sleeper request inside room-you can hear street traffic.The hotel is easy to get to-take Aerobus from airport to Plaza Catalunya-short cab ride 7Euros or a little 10 min walk.If your looking for a safe,clean,good price hotel this is your place.Believe it or not I got this hotel by reading trip advisor reviews of the place.We would stay there again and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and modern”
Reviews.Author: dcist25
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Barcelona. People at the front desk were always helpful and friendly. The hotel is modern and clean. The room we stayed in, a double, was fairly roomy, well-equipped and had free wifi (although the signal was very weak). Location is great. It's 10-15 minute walk from the Gaudi cathedral "Sagrada Familia," a block away from one of the metro (subway) lines, and only 10 minutes from the main plaza. You can take that metro line all the way to Barceloneta (the beach), which is very convenient. Highly recommended and will stay there again, if we go back--and if the price is right. We paid about $140 (yes, dollars) per night on a six-night stay at the end of August.

Reviews.Title: “5 days of Heaven @ Hotel Europark”
Reviews.Author: Urzula87
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It was amazing. Staff are so lovely and helpful. Close to La Rambla 10 mins walk or else get the metro 2 min walk to the centre. Would def recommend staying here if in Barcelona. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Carefl thogh, you might just not want to leave.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay in Europark hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rachel293984
Reviews.Content: The room we received at the 4th floor was spacious, it faced the backyard of the block, but still had some noise from the street, which was at times busy, but not as busy as some other streets in Barcelona. The rooms at the 2nd floor get to feel the tremble of the metro that passes bellow, so if you are sensitive to these sorts of noises; ask for a room at a higher floor. The decoration is nice and gives a feeling of a cosy stylish room. It is equipped with a large, easy to use safe that can accommodate a medium size laptop, and a minibar. The breakfast menu looked good, but it is expensive, if not already included in the price. You can get a pot of coffee and milk for 2 people for 3 euro, but if you go out of the hotel to the left , one and a half blocks, you'll find a Cafe called Barcelona, which serves the best coffee I drank in a long time, tasty muffins and sandwiches. The beds were really comfortable, and apart for occasional noises from nearby or top rooms (depends on the neighbors) sleeping was very peaceful too. The stuff was great, they speak fluent English, they are nice and helpful. If you leave early, there is a Coffee cart in the lobby which cookies, very thoughtful and generous. We didn't get to use the pool or the fitness room, but they looked nice. The location of the hotel was great if you don't mind walking. It is about 11 blocks from Plaza Cataluña and 5 or 6 blocks from Segrada Familia. It is 5 locks from Gracia street and if you go on Arago towards Gracia, it faces Casa Ballio. It is close to two metro stations, Gracia (green line) and Girona (yellow line). Overall, the hotel was really what we expected reading other people good comments.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MalteserEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself spent 6 nights in this hotel and we had a very comfortable stay. Excellent location just 2 mins walk from the metro station. Polite staff,clean rooms, nice decor, good breakfast, free wi-fi. We would recommend it without hesitation but next time we will be taking a travel kettle with us as I missed not having tea/coffee making facility in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OpalSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of November 2011. Very nice room , clean and stylish but rather small and next to the lift. Not a great view but in the distance we could see the Sagrada Familia - fantastic ! Staff very helpful . Breakfast plentiful and well presented. Great location for most of city tourist attractions. Would stay again but would ask for a room away from the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Nigel-Jackie
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Barcelona and chose the Europark to stay based on the website. We were delighted to find that its actuality mirrored its promises. We loved everything from the black and white decor to the location. The bedroom, we stayed in a Superior Double, was huge and comfortable. It had a really lovely bathroom ensuite, safety deposit box, good air-conditioning, a minibar with plenty of room for our own drinks, splendid decor, a very large and comfortable bed and great service. The reception staff were friendly and spoke very good English, which was helpful for us as non Spanish/Catalan speakers. The common areas were modern and restful and internet access was easy too. We really felt at home here, the location was close to many good eating places and it was easy to get anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel staff were always happy to provide us with any information we asked for and seemed rightfully proud of this lovely hotel. We appreciate that the price might be a barrier for some, but generally in Europe you get what you pay for and this was worth every euro. We very highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - The Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: TheFunandSunFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Europark for 3 nights from Nov 3rd until Nov 6th 2011. It was the perfect experience! We stayed at room 611, facing the rear courtyard - quiet and spacious. We took the room based on the recommendation of another review here and they were right - it is splendid. We loved the design - you feel you are in an upbeat boutique hotel. The location of the Hotel in the Eixample is close enough to walk to major attractions - around 6 blocks from Plaza Catalunya, 6 blocks from Sagrada Familia, 10-15 walking minutes to the Barri Goti and Born areas. The breakfast was amazing and one of the better ones we've ever had at any hotel. The breakfast was so good and an superb value and terrific way to open the day. We loved everything about the hotel - the rooms, the design, the staff, the location, the breakfast, the value...

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customers”
Reviews.Author: blondie15k
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable room on the 8th floor at the front, large double bed, great shower. Excellent position for all the Gaudi sights and easy walking distance to La Rambla. Didn't bother with breakfast as plenty of small bars and cafes to choose from, average breakfast 6 euros for the 2 of us. A fairly quiet area at night, but near enough to the lively Placa de Catalunia and nightlife around La Rambla. Recommend the hop on hop off tour bus to get to all the surrounding points of interest. Don't bother to get the Barcelona Card unless you are planning to travel around each day on public transport. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent location”
Reviews.Author: ScruffyMurphy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly central, walking distance from most attractions, clean, modern and English speaking staff. It is however still a bit far from the more interesting Born and Gothic districts. Also, be aware that the "double room" is just two single beds pressed together, so not ideal for couples. And the breakfast is terrible. Find a nearby cafe instead!

Reviews.Title: “An good hotel... We recommend!”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a fairly good place, we were amazed to the closeness with the Segrada Familia and Casa Battlo. It's 10-20 mns walk from La Rambla, and ideal if you're looking for a bit of peace and quiet after a "Rambling" day. The staff is nice, and it seems like the receptionist talks almost every known language :) The room was very good, clean, well designed (even though a bit small), and looked gorgeous [the bathroom as well]. We felt very good coming back from a long day of traveling to that room. The breakfast was a bit of a disappointment, compared to the previous hotel, but it's rather satisfying. The best thing about it was the fact that every day new freshly sweats were made.

Reviews.Title: “everything i hoped for”
Reviews.Author: katrionai
Reviews.Content: i went alone with my ten year old daughter,not knowing more than two words in Spanish,the hotel staff were friendly ,kind and polite,i felt safe and comfortable. The view from our room which was at the back of the hotel. was somewhat rustic but i liked that,real life.Transport to everywhere could be picked up very close.fresh fruit and goodies in supermarket a few mins walk away,the whole experience was a pleasure,room service was swift.mini bar reasonable,great little goody box.

Reviews.Title: “Definitively would come back”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud21
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise since you could not judge by the pics if I had made a good decision. The rooms are comfortable and the size good by European standards. The pool at the rooftop offers great views of Barcelona and very romantic during sunsets. Just needs a bar. The location is unbeatable, and there are a couple of very inexpensive, unpretentious though excellent side cafes with very friendly people serving. It is a few blocks from Passeig de Gracia were the action is in whatever you are looking for, specially with classy atmosphere. My criteria for satisfaction in hotels and restaurants is if I would return to eat or stay. I would definitively come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good find!”
Reviews.Author: Bay51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for exploring Barcelona. The staff were friendly, the breakfast was good & the rooms were spacious & clean. Free internet access was an added bonus. Would definitely stay here again when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “It was well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, well suited for pleasure and business stays. It is within walking distance to major points of interest (15 min. to Sagrada Familia, 5 min. to Passeig de Gracia & Casa Batlo, 10 min. to La Pedrera) and from the Metro station in Passeig de Gracia we can get anywhere you want in the city.
