Rooms are confortable and clean and offer a good night sleep after a full day of sight seeing in Barcelona. With the A/C unit usually turned on during the day (the staff takes care of that), the temperature may prove a little low, but you'll appreciate the dry air. Staff members are helpful, although they don't smile a lot. The receptionist was very kind helping us with reservations for a flamenco night. Breakfast is well suited for any needs and staff members bring you hot coffee at your table. Sweets deserve a special plus. There is Wi-Fi in the rooms, but you also have 2 computers with internet access in the lobby and 2 at the first floor. There is a pool on the rooftop (8th floor) but it's very small. Nontheless, the terrace is intimate and you can relax in a longchair and enjoy the sun. Definitely worth coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 3* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bmwcs1969
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good location, clean and spacy rooms with balcony and free WiFi made our one week stay in Barcelona even better than expected! Not to big and easy to like. We will for sure be back when visiting Barcelona next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: marinasweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights in july. The location is excellent with walking distance to many of the shops, restaurants etc, in a nice area. The hotel is very stylish with the dark stripes as a common theme. Clean and neat with friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast was also very good. All in all a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good all round choice”
Reviews.Author: allurehomme
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to good reviews and excellent sale price on lastminute which inc Breakfast. Found it easily enough off the airport train, get off at Passeig Gracia and look for the Pau Claris exit. Check in was easy, although they only had one double room available for two couples, though we found the twin room was bigger on the corner. Had quiet rooms at the back. Very modern, clean and comfortable rooms. Emailed hotel in advance as it was a 30th birthday trip but no mention or acknowledgement of this on arrival or during stay. No upgrades either!! Found the free wi-fi very limited as there was no signal in the rooms, so had to use it in reception or on the roof terrace. Breakfast was ok, mostly continental, few different choices and good service. Bar and mini bar prices were very reasonable but didn't use the bar as it seemed empty with no atmosphere. Would have been nice to have had one on the roof terrace instead maybe? Roof terrace and pool was a nice addition after a days sightseeing or to relax. Pool ok for dipping in and not too busy so could usually get a sunbed or the sofas are very nice! Good location overall, 2 min walk to metro/train, supermarket very close by, some local bars and places to eat too. About 10 mins to Passeig Gracia main road or Sagrada Familia. Not so keen on the note under the door on the final night, a reminder that your leaving the next day and the check out time, 11am! Then also a phone call at 10:50am from reception asking if we were still checking out! Felt a bit rushed and wouldn't have expected this from a hotel of this standard, not until about 11:30 maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lizzybusy3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved it! Beautiful decorated rooms, clean, comfortable and very friendly staff! We'll definitely be back! Also great location, you can walk to all the landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Chambers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europark is in a great location in Barcelona. 5 min walk to main street and Metro. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. Our room was a very nice size, comfortable and clean, and also had a small balcony. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: keytrader33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europark for two nights last month and found the stay to be very enjoyable. The hotel itself was very neat and clean and the staff was very friendly. The airlines lost our luggage and they were very helpful in helping us get things we need. We loved the location (Eixample district)! It was about 8 blocks of beautiful walking to Placa Catalunya, one of the main tourist areas, but far enough away to be out of the buy fray. We would walk around late and night and felt very safe with other local residents out walking. We met another couple staying in the Las Ramblas district and their stay was very different than ours. In contrast, they did not feel safe out late at night and were in crowds the whole time. We really enjoyed our stay there and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Extremely Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JPSWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: The EuroPark Hotel was the perfect choice for our trip to Barcelona because it provided a perfect location to all that Barcelona offers while in extreme comfort. We had room number 710 which was great because it was very quiet, clean and with an amazing shower. There was also a nice balcony where we had wine every evening before adventuring out on the town. (We purchased the wine from the wine shop just steps away)...Despite previous trip advisor reviews, we thought that this hotel was very professionally run and it provided all of the amenities that we needed. We were able to walk to all of the Gaudi sites (except Parc Guell) and we could always catch an inexpensive and quick taxi to take us to La Ramblas or the Barri Gotic (so please don't feel the need to have to walk or take the metro - the taxis really were cheap and efficient). Tip: don't miss the Casa Batlo! And, don't go to La Rita restaurant (it's just for Rick Steve's tourists). Do stay at the EuroPark!

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff, lax information security.”
Reviews.Author: KatieandMatt
Reviews.Content: First night, toilet wouldn't stop running. It was very noisy, no way to sleep through it. We went through the routine of checking the ball stop, jiggling this and that, still kept running. We were exhausted and just wanted a new room, but the desk clerk forced us to suffer through 30 minutes of two housekeepers arguing and trying all the same things we had just tried while we sat miserably on the edge of the bed before he finally agreed. Room was nicely decorated and clean, but it looked out over an airshaft. Even in the middle of the day, we got no sunlight whatsoever. Couldn't see the sky at all. AVOID any rooms that end in '7' - 307, 407, etc. unless you like to feel like you're in a cave in the middle of beautiful, sunny Barcelona. Finally, check-out - they had taken photocopies of my debit card and passport upon check-in. I wanted to either have those photocopies back or see them shredded. Not an outrageous request. Desk clerk was EXTREMELY offended and unpleasant - he took a comically long, slow time to leaf through the stack of photocopies, stopping to glare at me between each page. Finally, photocopy in hand, we left. More shocking than the desk clerk's behaviour was the fact that these photocopies - passports and debit cards of EVERY hotel guest - were kept in a loose pile on the reception desk, and nearly every time we passed through reception, the desk clerk was in the office behind a curtain. Anyone who knew they were there could reach over and grab them at any time. If I had no idea - I assumed the copies would be kept somewhere safe, locked away. Not so.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean and nicely located. The staff were aways helpful and very friendly. If you couldn't walk to where you wanted to go, the metro was close by. I liked that if offered 3 computers for guests to use and a nice but small pool on the rooftop. I would stay here again. Tip: There is a nice supermarket two blocks away where you can stock up on water, fruit and snacks for your travels.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: briboard
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the EuroPark in Barcelona in early September 2011. Rooms are nicely decorated, well appointed and comfortable. Our room had a nice tub and shower in the bathroom. A small refrigerator and an in-room safe was included in the price. There is a small outside pool and a deck area on an upper floor, a small gym in the basement and extra-cost breakfast and dinners are available. We had dinner there one night and it was very good. There are also three computer terminals available at no charge. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our lack of Spanish was not a problem. We found the location to be very convenient. There are many restaurants and two food markets nearby. We were able to easily walk to La Sagrada Familia and La Rambla and the Girona Metro station is one short block away. The Metro is cheap, efficient and clean but BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS! A friend was victimized two days in a row! Barcelona is a wonderful city with lots to see and we would definately return to and recommend the EuroPark.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSteveB
Reviews.Content: The Europark Hotel is decorated in a black & white modern style, very tastefully done. The rooms and en suites are spacious, clean and comfortable. Breakfast has a variety of cooked and cold foods, freshly prepared, it can be a little busy, particularly on Sat/Sun. There is a pool on the 8th floor with views over the city and sufficient sun beds. There is a bar but it closes at 1030pm so don't expect a nightcap when you come in from being out on the town. A small criticism would be the hotel rule that coffee cannot be served in the lounge / lobby area, although a night porter will serve you in your room. There is free internet access and 3 available computers. The hotel is very well situated for exploring, about 2 miles from the marina and about three quarters of a mile from the Sagrada Família Church. Nearest metro stations are only a few hundres yards away and there a numerous bars and restaurants close by.. The staff at the hotel are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the area. I would recommend this hotel for a city visit. Excellent Italian restaurant (also open on Sundays), LA TAGLIATELLA Pau Claris, about a 7 minute walk. very good food, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: Groooveman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights during the Le Merce festival. The hotel was pricey, but due to the festival we had little choices. It is a great hotel. The staff was very helpful pointing out where to eat and where the action was. The hotel is located 2 blocks from a metro, 4 blocks from the train station, and about 6 blocks from Sagrada Familia. It's also 5 blocks from Passeig de Gràcia‎ where the main metro lines, shopping, and Gaudi buildings are. There is a great tapas restaurant behind the hotel around the corner. We had a superior room on the 7th floor which was quite large, especially for European standards. The floors were wood, large "king" bed (2 beds together), a small balcony overlooking the street, and a nice size bathroom with full bath/shower. There were even robes/slippers for us to use. We didn't eat there, but we did have to go to the dining room to get coffee (not in the rooms) for a couple euro. There was also a pool we didn't go in, but it was very cool on top of the 8th floor. The staff got us tickets to a flamenco show, and also let us borrow an adapter to plug our phones in (no universal "shaver" plug in bathroom). I would definitely stay here again if we make it back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in very safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: barryelkin
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed rooms that were not large. The staff was very helpful. 15 minute walk to placa catalunya. Pool and solarium are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Paisley1234
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was highly rated on tripadvisor. it was a nice hotel, but I would not stay again because I think I would rather be a little closer to the gothic district, as that is the area we enjoyed the most and spent most of our time.. Not to say the location is bad but there is better..,

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: SoCa1l26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EuroPark Hotel post-cruise. The hotel is very stylish and about a 0.4 mile walk to Passig de Gracia, a main street with the subway station and train station, as well as many shops. The neighborhood is very safe and we had no problems walking to the train station before 7am to catch a metro for a day trip. The staff was extremely helpful with details on seeing sights and visiting various locations. In particular, Mark (who spoke German, Spanish, and English, to mention a few) was very knowledgeable and helpful to us on how to catch different Metro lines to get various places. He even pointed out the location of a huge flea market, which caused immense happiness from my wife when she actually visited it! The lobby is very stylish with wood floors, wallpaper, and wood trim. The room was similarly stylish and well above your average ordinary hotel room. Everything was impeccably clean, and the bed and bedding were exceptionally comfortable. We didn't go in the small pool, but did check it out, and the area was really cute and a good way to see the rooftops of the city in the late afternoon. I'd highly recommend this hotel for anybody visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Spanisheyes00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Europark for 3 nights in September at the end of a 10 day trip through Spain. I booked the hotel through their website back in March and paid roughtly 100 Euros a night. I had rented a car and drove from Madrid and the only pain was trying to find where to park so I could unload my luggage before returning the rental. Once I arrived, check in was easy and the gentleman at the front desk was very kind and helpful. I was "upgraded" to room 001 - right behind reception. I think its an upgrade because there was a small patio outside our room. Nice but not needed. The room was impeccable - clean and tastefully decorated. I found the beds to be comfortable and the shower had adequate pressure. Nice towels and I thought the toiletry box (with a toothbrush, comb, shampoo, lotion, razor, showercap, shoe polish rag) to be a nice touch as well. There was a mini bar with the usual - vodka, rum, gin, sodas and water. But I found a little market just around the corner where I bought a bunch of waters and sodas for 3 Euros, so it would be a good alternative to paying higher prices for their drinks. Location is not too far away from Las Ramblas, but you can expect a bit of a walk. It is pretty close to the Passeig de Gracia metro stop which was a convenient way to travel to Parc Guell. One night I stayed in and ordered dinner through room service. I actually found the prices to be pretty good - ordered pasta bolognese and it was 13 Euros. Did not do breakfast and instead would walk to a small coffee shop about 3 blocks away on Arago to have a coffee and croissant. There is a computer in the lobby to check emails. I also like that there was a printer attached and no fee to use it! Wifi is also available which I found very useful. All in all, no complaints about the hotel and I would certainly return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: SDtraveler25
Reviews.Content: While the room was a little on the small side it was very nice with extremely comfortable bed. The location is great and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, steeply priced”
Reviews.Author: Vinay S
Reviews.Content: very clean, good rooms, great service and breakfast. Also very helpful staff. We ended up paying about 215 euros a day, since we booked late. Book well in advance, and you can get a room at easily 50% of what we paid...

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: Paul5795
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the EuroPark for four nights in early September prior to a transatlantic cruise back to the States. We really liked the location of the EuroPark. It was about five blocks east of Passieg Gracias and Las Ramblas, the two main walking boulevards of Barcelona, where you could go to shop, or to eat, or to see some Gaudi-desingned houses, or to pick up the Hop-on, Hop-off tourist buses (reviewed elsewhere). The Europark was also about six blocks west of La Sagrada Familia, the stupendous Gaudi-designed church. And the EuroPark was only a block away from the Girona metro (subway)stop, and from there only three or four metro stops (with no line change) away from the Barcelona Old Town with all its interesting museums and sights. The EuroPark was also only one block from a large, modern supermarket, where we bought meat, bread, cheese, and wine so as to limit the number of times we ate out. We stayed on the fifth floor (501) of the EuroPark. The room faced on to an alleyway. As such, it was removed from street noise, but the single window had no view and we had to keep the curtains closed to ensure privacy from the windows in the adjacent building. The room was small, only about 150 square feet (maybe ten feet wide by fifteen feet long) excluding a narrow entrance hallway. The decor was modern and clean, although the queen bed took up almost half the room. The room had a nice flat screen TV with three or four english channels. The bed was comfortable, with plenty of pillows. You could set the thermostat to your preferred room temperature, and the heating/cooling (OK, the cooling) seemed to work well. The room also had a small refrigerator with a minibar. The minibar prices were reasonable, but we just used the refrigerator to store our own food and drink. Our room was cleaned well and promptly every day. The bathroom was interesting. It was fairly large, clean, and relatively new. The bathroom was done up mostly in black tile and dark colors, but because it had facing infinity mirrors and a lot of lighting, it was not dark at all. The tub-shower combination had plenty of hot water and good water pressure, although the shower door did not close all the way (but it closed better than a lot of other European hotels we have stayed at). The sink was large, but there was limited counter space, and the hairdryer worked well. At times, the bathroom did have a somewhat rank odor. This seemed to come and go, although my wife was more sensitive to it than I was. The EuroPark offered a hot breakfast buffet. The clerk told us that the buffet cost did not come with our room, but if we booked it for all four days of our trip we could get a discount from 13 Euros (per person per day) down to 10 Euros, so that is what we did. The buffet was the same every day, with a few hot items (scrambled eggs, bacon, and two types of sausage) and a wide array of cold items, juice, and coffee. The EuroPark also had a small pool up on the eighth floor. It was so small and shallow you really couldn't swim in it, but it felt good to9 get in the water after a long, hot day of touring Barceloona. All-in-all I would recommend the EuroPark as a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip”
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: Nice place and great hotel, the food was ok but the staff was so kind and helpful. I recommend this place for sure

Reviews.Title: “Well designed hotel in l' Eixample”
Reviews.Author: HoosierIU
Reviews.Content: Very well designed room. Has everything and everything has a place.(oh, no hot water kettle for tea) We had a Euro Room. No view, but very clean and quiet; even fabric on walls. For four nights we paid 432 Euros, which did Not include breakfast. We found this via TripAdvisor, and hotel had a discount for 3 or more nights. Free Wifi in the room very fast. My husband traveled a lot on business (U.S.) and he said this was the best room he ever stayed in. We ate breakfast around the corner (W) at La Particella to save money; it is open all day with great cafe con leche. Just about 4 blocks away is Casa Batllo, an amazing home designed by Gaudi with great audio tour. It can get hot in Barcelona so bring shorts etc. You can set air con temperature in your room which is great. Our electric adapter was not the right fit so hotel loaned us an adapter....very nice. We took train from airport, but first you must ride bus over to T2. Then ride train to Passeig de Gracia stop - about 4 blocks east on D'Arago and you reach the hotel. We used the RENFE to get around - buy a T10 ticket which you can share. Overall we loved this hotel. I would recommend going to Barcelona in Spring or Fall unless you like hot weather, but we ran into a nontypical hot spell in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghia70
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very well appointed, staff are very helpfull, good location for seeing Barcelona, good local restaurants and bars, rooms very well specified and bed was huge and very comfortable. close to subway station and bus routes - 15 to 20 minute walk to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay at Europark”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas L
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff, always available for advices Very nice room (with a patio) Very good breakfast (continental style) Very good location between every Barcelona must-see sites Nice swimming pool and solarium The only weaker point is the noise. Our room was directly under the kitchen or breakfast room and we were hearing the steps of people above us. We were also hearing some slapping doors

Reviews.Title: “Great memories!”
Reviews.Author: McDeeTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at EuroPark for 3 nights, following a cruise. What a nice surprize this hotel was. Not expecting much, we were very pleased with decor, rooftop deck, even room service food. For all the tourist-trap lovers, it may be far from La Rambla (15 min walk), but it was just a block from subway station, which can take you anywhere. Surrounding streets are full of street cafes and local flavor. Our room was clean (shiny hardwood floor) and bathroom was spotless. If there was one thing I could change, it would be storage. Two little drawers and few hangers made us go thru our suitcases little too much. Overall great stay, will stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but very hard bed”
Reviews.Author: lcprieto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, The service was excellent, The pool was very preatty but small, and it was always crowded. Room service was decent. We had pasta, and it was a bit too soft, but tasted ok. The location is nice, but too far from the centre. It's a good 20 min walk to reach the barrio Gotico. On the other hand, the downtown area was so full of turist that I think maybe it was good that we were outside of it. Overall, if it wasnt because of the hard bed, I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Malabarce
Reviews.Content: Awesome, huge and beatifully decorated rooms. Centrally located, very close to the metro station. Good value! Very nice pool. Free wi-fi. Good value! Would definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine P
Reviews.Content: I have just return from a very pleasant stay in EuroPark Hotel in Barcelona. I chose this hotel as it has a swimming pool / sunbathing terrace, offered buffet breakfast and was near to the main shopping high street - which was the main reason for my visit. It was marked as 3 stars but I found it to be better than the last 4 star hotel that I stayed in Barcelona. Our room was upgraded to a superior room upon arrival which was very decent of the hotel. There was free WIFI and a few PC's around for our use. The mini bar stocked drinks which were not prohibitively expensive. It was really centrally located - just a short 5 minute walk to the main high street and probably a 15 minute walk to Las Ramblas. The rooms were modern and clean and we were given a good selection of toiletries as well as towels to use for sunbathing. The pool was small and basic but the terrace area was more than adequate to catch a few rays in the middle of this impressive city. The breakfast was varied and adequate to set us up for the day - a mixture of hot and cold choices and loads of cakes!!! I have had more impressive buffet breakfasts in 4 star hotels, but for a 3 star Hotel was much better than average. The staff were friendly and helpful when required. I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find in a wonderful city!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkpaulandliz
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor's valued input we booked this hotel for a pre-cruise visit in Barcelona. We could not have made a better choice. The hotel is conveniently located in the Exiample district in a very quite and lovely neighborhood, yet it is within convenient walking distance to all of the activity without all the noise. The rooms are very very clean and modern and best of all the beds are fantastic. We have bad backs and finding a good hotel bed that gives us a good nights sleep is rare. In this case we give the beds an A+++. The front desk staff could not have been more pleasant and accommodating. Their assistance in suggesting some local restaurants resulted in us having excellent meals. Unfortunately we were so busy seeing the sights that we did not take advantage of the rooftop pool. We had the continental European breakfast every day and it was definitely worth it. Could not find or comment on anything bordering on being negative about the Europark. Highly recommend it and would rebook again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but I expected better considering the reviews”
Reviews.Author: amyelizabeth94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Europark hotel for 3 nights in September and booked the room based off the the tripadvisor reviews. Unfortunately, I wish I would have booked elsewhere. Pros: Clean Friendly Market nearby Cafe's nearby for breakfast Pool Decent size Cons: View was less than desirable Location- busy street, not close to anything unless by train Room Service: Ravioli was half cold as if it had been microwaved Again, the stay was OK, but if I was coming back, I'd book closer to the water or attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kris G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel based on the recommendation of a co-worker. Excellent. Very nicely appointed rooms, comfortable beds, clean, very nice bathroom and even a decent LCD TV if you just want to kick back. The accessibility to the center of Barcelona is also a plus, being about a 15-20 min walk away from where things start to get interesting. Back to the hotel, we also found the staff friendly and overall we enjoyed our stay. Oh, before I forget, the pool on the roof is quite ok as well. If we are back in Barcelona, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooftop swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Remcoreviews
Reviews.Content: Well if you go to this hotel pray for excellent weather! The rooftop terrace with swimming pool is just awesome to chill after a day walking around town. Metro Girona nearby takes you to Barceloneta beach in just 4 stops. Market - fresh bread, fruits, meats, cheese - with supermarket nearby, so no need to book breakfast at all!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MVAF4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July in one of the "top view" rooms. Lovely rooms, tastefully decorated, very clean. Only downside was that there were no tea/coffeee making facilities in the room (but that appears to be the standard for Barcelona!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, tastefully decorated”
Reviews.Author: SusieE1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for discovering the wonderful city of Barcelona. Reception staff helpful, rooms very pleasantly decorated in black and white with beatutiful bathrooms. Room service very reasonably priced as was the mini bar. We asked for an iron on arrival and even though it took an hour to get to us and after a reminder from us we had it for the whole evening and the maid took it away next day. Free internet use also a bonus to plan each day's outings and to check work and home emails. The roof top swimming pool was small but quite adequate for a "dunk" after a busy day sightseeing. Would highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: AEG130189
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EuroPark during the last week of August and although our room was fairly basic and quite small, we found it more than adequate for what we wanted - a room to sleep in after a day of sightseeing. The staff were helpful and were happy to store our luggage for the whole day while we were waiting for our late flight home. We chose not to have breakfast at the hotel and we found a lovely cafe down the road from the hotel called La Particcela that served an excellent selection of breakfasts and sandwiches. The hotel has a small pool area that can get quite busy but it was clean and comfortable and perfect for relaxing after a busy day. The hotel is perfectly located, being very close to Sagrada Familia and Passeig de Gracia and if you don't mind the walk it is possible to get to the city centre, the port and the beaches within half an hour or so. We had a fantastic time and would recommend visiting the Sagrada Familia, the lovely port and beaches, Parc Guell and Casa Battlo, and if you're lucky enough to catch one, a football match at Nou Camp. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ddubman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EuroPark Hotel in Barcelona the last week of August 2011. It was a very clean, practical and modern hotel. It is in a very nice, central location about a 5 minute cab ride from Plaça de Catalunya (city center). Very close to multiple subway and train lines as well. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but this is to be expected in Barcelona. The staff was not the most helpful we have encountered. There is a nice rooftop pool which is not too big (also not too small) but it is a very nice amenity. There are 3 free computers for guests to use, which is nice since many hotels will charge 1 euro or more for 15 mins of computing. Overall I would recommend the Europark as a basic hotel which will not blow you away, but you will get just about everything you really need here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: suedUttoxeter
Reviews.Content: My son and I visited 29th August for 3 nights. Arrived very late on the 29th ie midnight and were greeted pleasantly and processed quickly. The room was spotless and very well appointed, crisp white sheets and lovely comfy pillows. A small balcony table and 2 chairs. The room was quiet and a cosy haven after a busy day sightseeing. (room 508) The bathroom was spacious very clean and well thought out. Complimentary toiletries were various and plentiful and the hairdryer was extremely efficient. Breakfast was a very civilised affair white table cloths and lovely fresh coffee and hot milk. Freshly squeezed orange juice and a wide variety of hot and cold food fruit and pastries. The staff were all polite, friendly and exceedingly helpful and professional. Our flight was very late and the hotel were happy to keep our luggage and allowed us to stay by the pool and in the recepton area until we were ready to leave. One of the staff recommended a wonderful restaurant 4 blocks up the road called Rita . It was fantastic definately go for when they open at 8:15pm as they get full very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent City”
Reviews.Author: Graham765
Reviews.Content: Very well located, we spent 5 nights here but would wanted longer as it was our first time to Barcelona we didnt know what to expect. On the first day we some of gathered our bearings, 2nd &3rd day we use the Tourisic bus (ask at the hotel reception for a ticket plans / discount pack) 4th and 5 th day we used the public underground which is very easy to use, and saves coming home at night with bilsters as to see everything you need to have good walking sandles / shoes. Excellent free wifi throughout Hotel, however pool was too small and far too cold! There was No tea or coffee facilities in the rooms which i found frustrating but you can order room service at any time.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: xxapmc
Reviews.Content: convenient location. rooms clean, big, and reasonably priced. only negative was the heated mirror in the bathroom. the darn thing turns red hot!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona; near transportation and good value”
Reviews.Author: Jessica0507
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Barcelona for 3 nights and our stay at EuroPark was great! The hotel is located near 2 Metro stations that can get you to just about anywhere in the city. It is a short walk to Passeg de Gracia and also a manageable walk to La Sagrada Familia. Barcelona's other "must-see" sites are a short metro ride away. As for the rooms, they were clean and well-appointed. We opted for the Bed + Breakfast option and with my gluten allergy I was pleasantly surprised with fresh baked gluten free bread each morning! I just let a member of the staff know when I got to breakfast and 10 minutes later...fresh bread! If you are looking for a place to stay that's unique to the area, close to the sites but not smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle...this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: 2011MaYa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, lovely decor, friendly staff, well cleaned and kept rooms. Based on the reviews I read a asked for a room at the back of the hotel so I wouldn't be disturbed with street noise, the hotel did accomodate this request but be advised although you miss out on noice you also miss out on nice scenary. Although, if you're in Barca you need to be out and about and not stuck in your room! I would definitely recommend this place and would go again although I'd look out for a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and a lovely pool area”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelbuddies
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, not too small with a great bathroom and huge shower. Unfortunately we were at the front of the hotel which looked onto the main road (a big 5 lane road!) so had trouble sleeping on the first night as traffic was noisy throughout the night. However I did get used to this and managed to sleep throught it. Maybe request a room at the back of the hotel though. Service from restaurant staff and cleaners was very good, however I found the reception staff to be fairly unpredictable. Some were helpful, however some not very helpful and when we arrived we had to wait about 5 minutes for the man to even acknowledge we were there as he was doing some paper work right in front of us... The pool area was great, it is fairly small but we never really had a problem finding a seat and it was great after a hot day walking around. Also aircon in the room was fab! Breakfast was soo good!! Hot food, pastries, fruit, cereal, continental etc. All in all had a very nice stay here and loved the pool, just a shame about the noisy road.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a girly weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: becka85
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a few nights in May this year and we found it perfect for us! The location is good (if you don't mind a 10/15min walk to the find shops and restaurants. The rooms were tastefully decorated and a reasonable size for a city hotel. The service was wonderful, the roof top pool was lovely, and the breakfast was varied. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Europark!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JacquieP
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3 nite stay at this hotel. Ihe rooms were very well appointed, spacious and decorated beautifully. The breakfast was delicious!! I had told them i was gluten free and they prepared my very own GF french baguette hot to my table every morning. It was absolutely delicious fresh bread - I felt extremely spoilt!! On the last morning I asked for 2 rolls which they were happy to make for me and I was able to take one on the train ride to France. ( Finding a GF lunch on the run is tricky in Europe) The rooftop pool is an added bonus and the close location to Passage Gracia ( great shopping )and other attractions was fantastic. We enjoyed 2 yummy dinners at La rRtas and Maitea Taberna both recommended by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, claen and well equiped”
Reviews.Author: CrispDust
Reviews.Content: Other reviews have already said it. Prime spot, good metro connection, free fast wifi (for android anyway). Room service prices seem reasonable although we didn't try. Small corner bar (Daas) over the road is fantastic value for breakfast and simple lunches. Several mine mercats to stock up on drinks and nibbles. Minus points? Pool is minute with very limited seating/lying area. We never managed to find space after 3 attempts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel051
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, only 500m from the metroline, with easy access to the airport. As it is close to the Passeig de Gracie and the touristica bus route we don't think we coiuld have bettered the location and it is away from the noisier parts of the city. Rooms are very clean and have all you need for a city break . We paid extra for a superior room and really it's not worth it. The balcony is too small to use and apart from bath robes and a few extras probably not worth the extra cost. Overall though a very good, comfortable hote with good service. Opposite is a very good cafe/bar where we enjoyed tapas and a jug of sangria after a days site-seeing and before hitting the town again in the evening. We had breakfast as it was included in the price but at 12 euros I think we would have eaten in the cafe. The tourist bus is excellent and we used it over 2 days so think it was good value. The book of ten tickets to use on the metro and buses also saved time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel, ideal for a Barcelona city break”
Reviews.Author: JoCoSi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europark Hotel for a friend's hen-do in July 2011 but don't let the words hen-do put you off as we were the only large party there. The Hotel is located in a quiet residential area only a 10-15 min walk from the top of La Rambla and is a great retreat from the hustle & bustle of the City after a busy day of sightseeing. The interior design is very well done, all black & white, and runs throughout the bedrooms and public areas. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and the Pool area is a God-send. Although quite small it is well equipped with sun loungers, comfy lounge beds and a separate sun-terrace for those who just want to soak up the rays. The bar is also very nice but we did not sample the breakfast as there was a very good supermarket around the corner and a selection of local bars and cafes. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the mini-bar was re-stocked daily and very reasonably priced (with free crisps). I would certainly recommend the hotel and would return there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: shortyz123
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a one week stay at Europark, i had a great time. Staff are very accomadating and helpful! The hotel is modern but still retains a personal feel as isnt a large hustle and bustle type hotel. Our hotel rooms were lovely with new sheets,towel and cleaning service every day. We opted for the breakfast option which i must say was one of the best things we did as we were overwhelmed with the variety available for breakfast. You can eat dinner in the hotel restaurant but we opted to eat out and asked reception staff for recommendations which they had along list of and never let us down.Location was great with a metro one block away which took you to the beach in 20mins and las ramblas in 5mins to name but a few tourist musts. I am going to come back next year again for round two and will def be booking this hotel. Thank you for such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Girona metro and Sagrata familal”
Reviews.Author: captainjollyjacksav
Reviews.Content: Learnt quickly that one needs to take cold or frozen water to such places as Guell park in th summer...it is a long way to the top. There is water fountains in some parks just follow the water trails. Bar fridge in room but no tea making ...room service at reasonable prices. WiFi in room excellent. Aircon excellent but lighting in room very poor and inadequate storage space for two for a long stay. shower extra hot and fit 4 !!!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Barcelona Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myannew
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, easy walk to metro but off the main thoroughfare. We were travelling as 4-two adults and our 2 college age sons. Had reserved a quad room for 3 nights at a sister hotel but upon arrival a booking error released the room to someone else. We were graciously moved to this hotel, given two very nice rooms, and cab fare was covered. Very gracious compensation; especially since this hotel was apparently an upgrade from our original booking at the Hotel Europa. Great buffet breakfast, wireless access, and beautiful modern appointments--very Barcelona. We had a great time and loved the location. Easy 5 block walk to Passeo Gracia and the incredible night life. Will stay there again. Did have one TV problem. Our sons had a room with many english speaking channels. Our TV would receive only 1. Of course, in Barcelona....who has time for TV???

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a pleasant stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FirstCoastTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Europark Hotel was recommended by friends back home, and it lived up to all the positive comments. It is a fairly new hotel and tastefully decorated in a contemporary style. We found the desk staff to be continually helpful about sightseeing, use of the computer, and getting taxis when needed. We used the room service for several late night meals when we arrived back at the hotel after a program. The location was convenient to metros and some of the major Gaudi buildings that we could easily reach by walking. An important feature was the in-room safe that provided a secure spot for valuables that we wouldn't have wanted to carry with us as we made our way around Barcelona. All in all we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect jumping off and relaxing BCN spot”
Reviews.Author: annerene
Reviews.Content: right in the heart of BCN, this hotel is ridiculously lush, with a killer rooftop pool, amazingly quiet and cool rooms (needed for recovering from INTENSE jetlag) AND right next door to the big market, and just a few minutes walk from Sagrada Familia, Gothic District, and metro lines going everywhere. Also, walk in any direction and BCN unfolds its awesomeness around you. Only bummer- the lower (really quiet, dark) rooms don't get internet, so we had to watch youporn in the lobby. Awkward!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: smileme2you
Reviews.Content: A good hotel spoilt by unhelpful and bored staff. What a pity - could have been so much better!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wherewegoing71
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Europark in Barcelona in June just one night but we would have liked to stay longer. The young male receptionist wasvery helpful indeed and gave us a deal which included breakfast. Fab modern ultra clean hotel. Room was quite small but had lovely black & white decor and superb comfy bed. Our room was on the 8th floor just around the corner from the pool access door so it was very handy for a rooftop swim. The pool surround decking area has sofas and loungers with a city rooftop view. It was a great location too, about 20mins walk to the Sagrada Familia Cathedral, walkable also to Square Catalunya. Our hire car had to be parked about 2 doors along costing 21 euro but this was convenient, as was the hairdresser just around the corner - handy for after the swim. All in all not the cheapest but highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: st89
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, well located, modern, good breakfast, excellent for vacation, and not expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Smart rooms and helpful staff at Europark”
Reviews.Author: MikeB1981
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for three nights and had a great time. The hotel is located near Passeig de Gracia train station (easily accessible from Barcelona airport) and a short walk from the Sagrada Familia. Passeig de Gracia is a major shopping street which leads down into La Rambla, the tourist promenade. If you want to be located as close as possible to the beach, La Rambla and the old town then this hotel isn't for you. However, if you enjoy walking around (or are happy to take the metro or bus) then you'll have no problem with the location. The room had an elegant black and white design, was spacious and had a good selection of complimentary toiletries. The reception staff was very helpful when we asked about the surrounding area (the Eixample district of the city) and suggested some good restaurants for us. We didn't bother paying the 13 euros a day for the buffet breakfast - cheaper breakfasts are available at any number of cafes in the nearby streets or on Passeig de Gracia. Close to the hotel is the bus stop for the open-top tourist bus, which we would recommend as a fun way to get an overview of the city. You can buy discount vouchers at reception which will save you a few euros on each bus ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SarahandAron
Reviews.Content: The Europark is nice, clean, and in a good location. the guys at the front desk were always pleasant and willing to answer any questions that we had. Our room was comfortable with a nice bathroom and was cleaned each day after we left. When we checked out we were able to leave our bags at the front desk until we needed to go to the airport later in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: marsbars10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Europark Hotel in Barcelona for Memorial Day weekend. We were so impressed by the hotel and the helpful staff. The front desk was awesome, and they always recommended great places to eat that weren't too touristy. My only recommendation, however, is that if you stay here, bring plenty of your own toiletries! This really applies more to the ladies. Men will be ok with the toiletries available there, but if you like a particular conditioner or body lotion, I definitely recommend bringing your own, as the ones they had there were a little masculine :-D

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for family birthday in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: merrymillerRotherham
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to fantastic half price offer on lastminute and it did not disappoint! Lovely, clean and modern hotel with very welcome air conditioning after a hot day exploring Barcelona. Rooms were stylish and breakfast had enough variety to please everyone in family group. Metro station close by but we mostly walked into the centre of Barcelona. Quiet location too so no disturbances for sleeping. Staff were helpful and friendly. Pool on rooftop was small but nice to relax for an hour after sightseeing, although this was peak time and busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcs2sgc
Reviews.Content: A most acceptable hotel which is modern, clean and comfortable. We paid about 300 euro for three nights (over a weekend) including breakfast. It seemed a fair rate. We spent little time in the hotel because there is so much to see in Barcelona. Next time i would opt for much cheeper and more basic accommodation because this nice hotel felt somewhat wasted on us. If i were to be really picky, our room that overlooked the main road was a bit noisy, but we were on the second floor and live in noisy city's so it didn't bother us at all. Service at reception was functional - no 'warm' welcome. Room service was good and quite reasonable. Breakfast was alright but choice of food relatively slim. We would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Debby2990
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the reviews on this site. Great location just 10 mins walk from Passiag De Gracia train station. Staff helpful and polite. Busy road but many roads are busy in Barcelona. Asked to change from room overlooking the road upon arrival because of the traffic noise, quickly given another room without any fuss. Rooms were lovely, modern and tasteful, minibar, toiletries, shower and bath very nicely decorated. Did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. Lovely coffee shop 2 minute walk away great for breakfast pastries and very reasonable. Free use of internet including a printer. Roof terrace lovely to chill after a busy day. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCC35
Reviews.Content: Great hotel (with comfortable beds) in a terrific location: close enough to walk to the major attractions in Barcelona, but outside of the busiest tourist area. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: germancarfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights, Barcelona has enough things to see for 4 full days, I can't say that for many cities. The location of the hotel is great, also very close to Metro. We walked down to Gracia few times, Casa Batllo is right there. A smooth stay. Staff is fine, nothing particular good or bad about them. An enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lance0706
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying at this hotel. As many others have mentioned, the location is prime, the staff is VERY friendly and helpful, and the rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable, and all around great. Room advantages include free safe, stocked mini-bar, free Wi-Fi, very comfy beds, lots of electrical outlets, and are quite spacious by European standards. One really cool feature in the bathroom was a device the prevented main parts of the mirror from fogging up. The staff was very friendly and helpful, giving suggestions, advice, and directions on where to go and what to do. Although the Metro does run under this hotel, we stayed on the first floor and could barely ever hear it. A non-issue for us. The location, being away from Las Ramblas and close to Sagarda Familia, is a huge plus. Barcelona is a very cool city with a lot to see and do. The Gothic Section of the city is one of the best places to tour. Las Ramblas is a waste of time - way too busy with people, over-priced restaurants, and nothing really of value to add to an excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: SCH275
Reviews.Content: I bookd this hotel through Lastminute and only really picked it because of its location and price (50% off). The fact that it had a rooftop pool was just a bonus. We were upgraded on arrival and given access to the room at 11am instead of 2pm - all done with absolute pleasure and a willingness to help that I haven't seen in a long while! The hotel is in a great location and the room was lovely - despite being on the street side and potentially noisy, the double glazing and aircon meant we had a great night's sleep. The rooftop pool was incredible too - we spent one whole day there lying in the sun while the city buzzed below us. I will definitely be back, even if I have to pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MKandT
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel, with clean, well appointed rooms. The staff were very helpful and on arrival the receptionist provided us with a map of the city and described how to get to the major sites. Following a full day exploring the city, it was great to return to the hotel and sit on the sun loungers by the small rooftop pool to relax in the sunshine. The hotel is in a perfect location to explore this exciting city. It is located just a 5 minute walk away from Passeig de Gracia train station, which itself is just a 30 minute train journey from the airport. I can't remember the exact cost, but it was around 5 Euros - much less than getting a taxi and completely stress free! There is also a metro station one block away, called Girona. However, you need not use the metro to visit areas such as Las Ramblas and the Sagrada Familia as both are within 15 minutes walking distance (at a leisurely pace) from the hotel. We would very much recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Barcelona and we will return here on our next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “slightly above average...”
Reviews.Author: ajdizzybird
Reviews.Content: ...but only slightly. The hotel's design and general location were great. Somewhat of a business-y part of Barcelona but a fairly short walk to Las Ramblas. Price was fair, not great but not horrible. We had a great central location for the site seeing we wanted to do - Gaudi architecture, Las Ramblas, etc. If you don't want to take the metro as much and are going primarily for Las Ramblas, just pay for a hotel in a closer location. We were only going down the main street a few times so it was not important to be there esp. at the higher prices of some of those hotels. Aside from location, I think this hotel was more of a relaxing 'base camp'. Quiet rooms and pool on the roof. I wouldn't spend a ton of time there, but there are other hotels that would seem more relaxing and inviting but are so old and 'charming' that you can hear people talking next door. This allowed complete privacy and almost just as important, one single large bed instead of two twins!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Hushabymountain
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. So long as you can cope with monochrome decor (and lots of it) this hotel is amazing. The best staff I've ever encountered in a hotel; they were so polite and helpful. The location is great: close to beautiful Gaudi houses, the Sagrada, the metro all on your doorstep. Personally, I couldn't stand La Rambla. A bit like Leicester Square area of London. Another reason this hotel was ideal - you could avoid that area completely! Roof top pool was small but delightful. Barcelona ever so slightly stole my heart and I would definitely come to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3* Hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: jimmycars33
Reviews.Content: Booked a Superior Room through last minute for £85 and was really impressed with it. The room was large, modern and clean with a huge bathroom and balcony, which faced away from the street. Was nicer than a lot of 4 and 5star hotels that we've previously stayed in. The hotel itself was nicely decorated and provided free wifi. The staff were also really friendly and helpful with recommending places to visit. Would definitely recommend to others and will stay again next time I'm in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona is ace!”
Reviews.Author: christine48
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona and stayed in the Europark hotel. We really enjoyed our stay here as the hotel is really central. It is very close to the Sagrada Famalia (which is worth a visit) as it is about a 5 minute walk. This hotel is also located close to Passeig de Gracia, one of the main shopping streets. On this street there is also good access to public transport as there is an underground station with metro and rail links (the 'Renfe' is connected here straight to the airport). The hotel itself is very nice. The bedrooms are decorated in black and white so they look lovely and modern. The rooftop pool is a bit small, but there is so much else to see and do in Barcelona so this is only a minor fault. The breakfasts were tasty and had plenty of variety. The hotel staff also spoke English quite well and were helpful and friendly. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here in this hotel and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: laretal
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in the wonderful city of Barcelona and found this hotel on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. It is reasonably central - you can walk to the Ramblas and also to Sagrada Familia from here. The room was small but well appointed. There are 3 internet connected PCs available for guests´ use. There is a small swimming pool on the roof terrace which is welcome at the end of a hot day. The breakfast is good and you get a good night´s sleep. All in all a good package.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Juveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and flight through expedia after reading many glowing reviews, was not disappointed at all! Stayed here for 8 nights and the location is great! Walking distance to some of Barcelona's main attractions like La Sagrada Familia and Casa Batllo! We were fortunate enough to get a quiet room as I took heed from the other reviewers and requested one. The pool/terrace area is a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing. Reception was great always greeted you whether you're coming in and out of the hotel and upon check in are very helpful by giving you a map and showing you how to get around the city! Just a heed of warning, if you do not want your room cleaned, be sure to hang the 'do not disturb' sign on your door as we had learnt that after a couple of knocks while we were asleep housekeeping had no qualms in proceeding to open the door! We found it amusing, so we let it pass, and of the 8 nights we stayed there it had only happened once. Mini bar and room service prices are very reasonable, and there is a market about 2 blocks from the hotel where there is also a supermarket and and a 24hour flower market at the back! The metro is also only a few blocks from the hotel, essential when you don't want to walk back from a night out on the la rambla, 8 euros will get you 10 trips, which is worth it! Overall the hotel is in a great upper middle class location and has the requirements for a great stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Piramidon
Reviews.Content: Positives - Modern design, very comfortable bed, good breakfast. Moderately priced, relatively quiet considering location. Walking distance to Sagrata Familia and Casa Batilo. Negative - First room we were given had terrible sewage smell. it was by the pool... We were not offered new room right away - were told to wait for 1 hour until they deal with the problem (it was around 6 PM). Not good enough for us - we were tired and check in time was 3PM. I had to ASK myself for a new room . It was given and was fine but I would have been happier if it was offered spontaneously... And I couldn't figure out how to use toilet paper holder - very strange design... Overall - extremely good for a 3 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: torz2020
Reviews.Content: Thought this was a great hotel, the best three star hotel we've ever stayed in. Room and bathroom really clean, free wifi (very handy), reception staff were great and eager to help looking up information and making calls if they did not have the information that we wanted. The breakfast also good, lots of choice and all fresh. Location...a bit of a walk from the ramblas, this I thought was a good thing though. On a busy street but lots of eating and drinking options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: elnavermaak
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed at this hotel from 18 June - 21 June. Very good accommodation, staff very helpfull; Internet very accessible - 3 computers to the use of the guests. Would stay there any time again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Annie055
Reviews.Content: This was at the end of our month-long trip and it was a wonderful surprise! The hotel was lovely and our room a true delight! Very pretty with a nice balcony (that we didn't request!) and lots of amenities to make the ending of our trip extra nice. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was great. Can't think of one complaint except that we got there kinda late and had to leave the next morning for the airport. Would have loved to stay longer! Great staff, too!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, nice staff and good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Martikaa
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for 4 nights and it was very nice however the location was a bit too far away from the center of Barcelona (in my opinion). This was the only negative thing about the Europark hotel. The staff was very nice, so nice that they even upgraded us to a nicer room which was a lovely surprise for us. The rooms are beautiful, very modern. If you like the colors black white and grey you will LOVE the rooms. I will make sure to put a couple of self-made pictures up in this review so you can see for yourself. In the room you will have Wi-Fi access on your laptop, if you don't have a laptop with you you can use one of the computers that the hotel provides. I believe they don't charge for this. The breakfast costs per person about 12 euro which is pretty expensive but you do get access to an all-you-can-eat buffet which includes fruit (strawberries, melon etc.) bacon, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, bread (whole wheat, wheat..), milk, freshly squeezed orange juice, cereals, sandwich filling (cheese etc.), hot chocolate, tea, coffee........ anything you would like to be on your breakfast plate! The hotel is very clean. The rooms get cleaned everyday. Also the pool looks very clean but I should tell you that the pool isn't really to swim in because it is very shallow, it is rather a pool where you can just cool off from the hot weather. The room has a mini-bar which actually has a couple of not too overpriced drinks and foods so if you are really thirsty and don't have anything to drink it will not be too expensive! There is room-service which I believe is great too (at least the menu looks really nice). The hotel also has a gym but I didn't see it so I can't really say anything about it. I bet it is just as fancy as the rest of the hotel so you won't be disappointed. The location of The Europark is alright but know that it is quite a walk to get from the hotel to the center of Barcelona. It is about a 20minute walk from the hotel to the complete center, by that I mean the shops such as H&M, ZARA and restaurants etc. It is a 10 minute walk to one of the famous sightseeings of Barcelona: the art of Gaudi. The hotel has a supermarket very close which is a decent size to get some necessary groceries. In the same building you will find a little market where they sell beautiful veggies, fruits, fish and meat for nice prices. This is about a 4 minute walk from the hotel, it is on the same street as the hotel! IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, JUST ASK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Solid Location”
Reviews.Author: zoinnk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights during my short stopover in Barcelona after being in Tanzania for a month. Everything was great! I had a lot of questions right when I checked in and the hotel staff was very eager to help. The rooms were cozy but very modern, well-furnished, and well-decorated. The bathroom was very clean and modern as well. The laundry service was fast (<24 hour turnaround time) but a little pricey. The free wi-fi was very important, since I had not yet planned any part of my stay when I arrived. The location was great for sightseeing, as it's close to the subway and to many of the sites as well (e.g., La Sagrada Familia, a lot of the Gaudi buildings). I would definitely recommend staying here and would do so if/when I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: swong1709
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with internet and printing facilities Rooms were very nice - fairly large bathroom and comfortable bed Helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, we'll come again”
Reviews.Author: Al0ni
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights on June 2011, first time in Barcelona. A booking problem that we encountered upon reception was solved quickly with a lot of courtesy. Following that we wanted to switch rooms and were treated again with a smile and effective service. The room was modern and tidy and gave a good feeling when we returned after a long day travel. Hotel Europark will surely be our first priority when we return to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get over excited by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdStansmore
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fairly new very clean. We booked a "Top View" room which was supposed to have great views. I suppose you could say it had if you had a pair of binoculars with you. The view surrounding the hotel isn't great. The "Top View" balcony was about 8 feet by 4 feet in size and not worth the extra expense. This hotel is quite small and they have made use of every spare inch, meaning the rooms, reception area and breakfast room are quite small. The breakfast was adequate but nothing more. We stayed for 4 nights and the menu didn't vary. The breakfast room staff showed no pleasure in their work, it would have been nice to see the ocasional smile instead of the grumpy looking long faces. We also found there was very little assistance for tourist advice. The room was nicely decorated and the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inconsistent staff”
Reviews.Author: ronhaha108
Reviews.Content: Actually writing this on our last night here. We had a room on the 8th floor, same floor as the Pool. The room we are in is nicely styled and, as others have said, have economically priced mini-bar. The bathroom was big, but I was surprised by the lack of water pressure, though the hard water made sure to get the soap off effectively. The area the hotel is located is excellent, not all the hustle and bustle of the more touristy areas, within walking distance of the Metro as well as Sagrada Familia and Passeig de Gracia. Our favorite places to eat was along the Rambla de Catalunya. After visiting Las Ramblas, Port Olimpic and Port Vell and after seeing that there are more tourists there than locals, I'm very pleased with the choice to stay at EuroPark. As for the inconsistent staff part of the title, the maids and the breakfast buffet staff were wonderful, very friendly and very helpful. The staff at the front desk weren't as much. For the most part when I came into the hotel and said hola, just a blind gaze at me, not even a flinch. Also, there was some protest or something going on at the courthouse right across the street where there were police were trying to hold back people, we just happened to be walking outside when this started and there was an explosion (come to find out it was an m80 or something), but we started walking outside, and *boom*, went back inside and asked the desk what was going on and that there was an explosion, he replied back 'no explosion' and just ignored what was happening even though everyone in the lobby was pretty shaken up. By the way there were probably 8 or 10 m80s exploded, not fun when you don't know what's going on. One more example of not so friendly front desk staff, I went to the front desk and two people behind the desk were talking. I waited before asking my question and they just ignored me until I said something, to which I got an eye rolling and then an hola..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: Princesssazzle
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel and will definitely go back. It is well located and walking distance to the Sagrada Familia and Passeig de Gracia. We wanted to stay near the Ramblas at first but a friend said Passaieg de Gracia was more relaxed ( Las Ramblas may be better if you want to go out and party). The hotel was recently re-decorated and everything was in good condition and of good quality. The only thing I keep in mind is that the hotel is on Carrer D'Arago, which can be a bit noisy. I would recommend one of the rooms in the back or one of the rooms higher up. That being said, our room gave onto the Carrer d'Arago and it was well insulated so we were not bothered too much by the noise. I recommend the Barcelona suite which is particularly convenient if travelling with children as there is a fridge, a large terrace, and the sitting area and bedroom are separated by a sliding door.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel policy a fly in the ointment”
Reviews.Author: gstreete1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the EuroPark on our trip to Barcelona in June of this year. We had reserved through hotels.com. Initially, our impression of the hotel was very favorable, not least because we had been forced to stay an extra day in Brussels because of a strike that grounded our flight. As soon as we were able, we phoned the EuroPark saying that we would not be able to get there when we planned, but we would be there the next day. The desk clerk did not indicate that we would have to pay for that night, either on the phone or when we finally got there in person: in fact, he had to look up our reservation under the previous night. Both clerks at the desk that evening were extremely helpful and courteous. The room itself was lovely, especially to travelers used to staying in the typical small European hotel. The room was very modern, in a black-and-white color scheme; the bathroom was good-sized with a large shower (no tub), plenty of towels and free personal toiletries. We were also especially pleased by the mini-refrigerator with reasonably-priced drinks and snacks. The hotel also provides computer and printer access, has a small, well-equipped fitness room and a rooftop pool and deck with a great view. The location is also good, in L'Eixample. The room was also reasonably quiet, although sometimes you could hear street traffic on Arago. In all, what's not to like? When we were leaving on our final day, we spoke to the day clerk about our not being there the initial night, and could we have that taken off our bill, please? He said he could not do it; we had paid through hotels.com, and that this was not his business; we had to speak to hotels.com. He refused even to make a note. We might have pursued it further at the time, but our taxi was waiting for our return flight. We called hotels.com and despite the fact that no one had made an annotation on our bill, they gave us half off the night we didn't stay. Because of the hotel's unsympathetic and dismissive attitude, I would not recommend it to another traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly average for the price”
Reviews.Author: surreyUK70
Reviews.Content: The Good: Terrace and pool are small but provide a nice retreat from the busy city. Rooms are clean and functional. Lots of cafes etc nearby to get a cheap breakfast in. No need to spend 13 euros per day for breakfast at the hotel. Good location, near a metro station. The Bad: Very disappointed by the front desk staff. They came across as rude, unfriendly and unhelpful (perhaps especially to English guests). The prices do not match the 'service'. A smile every now and again and some manners would have gone a long way. Rooms are small, noisy and essentially overpriced. Requests are not adhered to. Make sure you get an internal facing room as high up as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with a few inconsistencies”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCDN_travlr
Reviews.Content: All in all, this is a great hotel. It's perfectly located, just away from the (somewhat annoying) bustle of Los Ramblas but still within walking distance of everything. It's a few blocks away from placa de gracias, which is a much more laid back street than the ramblas, with nice tapas restaurants and street side cafes. Service at the hotel was generally good. The rooms were stylish and very comfortable. I liked the wood flooring as opposed to carpet. Some slight annoyances: the shower door didn't close properly, our room was not serviced one day until we asked at dinnertime, we did not get our amenities refilled on one day and amenities do not include hair conditioner so I had to buy a small one for 5 euros! Other than that, a great stay and for the price, i'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wahwahweewee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days and loved it. The hotel's location could have been better but the hotel itself was beautiful, well-kept, had friendly staff. The pool was reason enough to stay there. It was a welcome cool-down after hours of sight-seeing and shopping! Europark is a great hotel and well worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicichan
Reviews.Content: I gave my boyfriend a trip to Barcelona for his birthday and booked this hotel after doing lots of research. We were not disappointed, and I'd definitely come back! Our room was a lot more spacious than we expected after reading the reviews on here and it was very nice and modern and stylish, and very clean. Staff was friendly enough and there was a nice selection of food for breakfast. Our room was facing the courtyard on the back, so there were no issues with street noise. The location is great too, it's just a few minutes from the Passeig de Gracia and we were able to walk almost everywhere. The nearest underground station is just around the corner though.

Reviews.Title: “We realy loved it”
Reviews.Author: Yos863
Reviews.Content: Every thing was good. Staff was kind and helpfull. Room was very clean. good smell. good feeling. Quite, When windows closed. our room was in the back side, i don't know if it is as quite in the front side. breakfast was very good. could enjoy more Vegetables and fish, but we enjoyed it all. fresh fruit juice was very good. Location-not in the middle of everything but one or two metro staions away. there are few metro station in a distance of 500 m' and one around 200 m'. the bathtub was small. big safe in room , you can keep your laptop inside. there is small swimming-pool , we didn't even see. free wi-fi internet connection. i am not sure how fast was it. there were 3 computers (with interernet) for the guests. worked good. we reccomand this hotel without any Doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but beware of street noise”
Reviews.Author: PilsnerDk
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a very good hotel. The hotel is clearly built within recent years, and has a very modern, minimalist and clean look, which I like. We were greeted by a friendly guy at the reception who spoke English well, and got checked in without a problem. We got a room on the 7th floor (room 705), which was a "superior" room. There was a tiny balcony towards the street (Carrer d'Aragó), and here comes the only big complaint: There was a high amount of noise coming from the street. Traffic in Southern Europe is generally very noisy, due to the high amount of scooters and motorcycles on the streets, and Barcelona was no exception. In fact, I'd say it's about the noisiest city I've been in. The street was a 6-lane, one way street with a high amount of traffic, and roughly every minute, as a nearby street lamp turned green, there's be a loud roar of traffic zooming by. It persisted all through the day and night, even the night from Sunday to Monday it was there on the dot. I was able to sleep through it without a problem (I'm used to city noise from home), but it was a shame that it was unbearable to keep the balcony door open due to the noise. Giving the handle on the balcony door an extra firm turn helped a bit, but a LOT of noise came through still. In conclusion, make sure you ask for a room that is not facing the street if you're staying here! Anyway, to continue with the room. Air conditioning worked flawlessly. Wifi worked flawlessly and was fast - but, it was a 100% public network, so consider this before you enter any sensitive information while connected. The room was clean and matched the modern style of the entrance of the hotel. New furniture of decent quality, big flat-screen TV by the opposite wall of the bed (no English channels though), and plenty of closet space. The bathroom was good. Clean, spaceous, plenty of soap, and a nice shower. One downside was that the lightning in the bathroom was ridiculously hot, it was like standing under one of those heating lamps at outside restaurants and almost made me sweat. Towels were replaced even outside of cleaning hours without a hassle. There was a free safe, which could fit a smaller laptop (my ThinkPad was about an inch too wide to fit). Bed was decent, although quite firm and had the usual crappy foam pillows. Great lightning in the room, except for a slightly buzzing reading lamp (weird). The breakfast buffet was pretty good. It was your standard European hotel breakfast, with bread, cheese, ham, egg, jam, sweet rolls, etc., even mini-donuts :). It was lacking in fresh fruit, but made up for it by having freshly squeezed orange juice, which I love. The hotel is located in a good spot. It's about a 5 minute walk westward to a big street named Passeig de Gràcia, which has a lot of shops and good places to eat. If you continue down south the Passeig de Gràcia, you'll get to a huge square named Plaza de Cataluña, which has an El Corte Inglés (huge department store), plus more stores and cafes, and south of that if the famous La Rambla street (which is rather crappy, but its side streets are good). The hotel is also right next to a metro station, although we didn't use it. We just took a taxi around the city and usually paid 5-7 euros for about 5-10 minutes of driving around. The rooftop pool and sunbathing area was nice, there was always a free chair/sunbed, and plenty of sun all through the day. A bit noisy though, thanks to the mentioned traffic, but there's also a part towards the back of the building, which is more quiet. The pool is only for dipping though, it's barely a meter deep. We had some sandwiches from the room service at one point, which were okay, but nothing special. All in all, I'd stay again, but only if I could get a room not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: freespirit7777
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights recently. Nothing bad to report at all - which is rare for me! When I checked in I was located in a room on the front of the Hotel - it was like trying to sleep on a motorway! The next morning I asked to be moved and they said that would not be a problems . I was not able to move straightaway but on my return to the Hotel about 3pm my bags were in my new room. I was moved to the rear of the Hotel and it was brilliant - even with a larger balcony Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: remosia
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay at Europark and all the hotel staff were super friendly. The rooms are spacious and everything clean and stylish. We will definetly stay there again when we go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “As profiled in TA”
Reviews.Author: mdh95070
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip and booked two rooms for a family of four. Great location. The staff did a great job recommending a visit to Sitges.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: D2112
