Reviews.Content: This hotel vastly exceeded our expectations. The room was the perfect size. The bed was huge. The staff was helpful. The location was unbeatable. I would ABSOLUTELY stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Thorgal7
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 night stay at the Europark Hotel. Rooms were well appointed, breakfast was copious and service from Jesus and Lillibeth was flawless. The hotel was only 50-100 yards away from the Girona metro station a five to six blocks from Paseo de Gracia, a major shopping avenue, and home to casa milla and casa botilla, two of Gaudi's masterpieces. You will not regret staying in this hotel, staff is trained to provide personalized attention and it is a great value for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel EuroPark is recomended”
Reviews.Author: DannyMiki
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after we got a recommendations about it. The hotel was very nice for us. We liked the front desk service, the room (although it is a little tiny) and the design of the hotel. Very important- there is a free WiFi in the hotel. Around the hotel there is some nice Cafes/bars, that we found very nice. There is 2 metro stations nearby, and it is 4 minutes walk from passeig de gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, could not flaw it”
Reviews.Author: POlivia
Reviews.Content: It was one of the greatest hotels i have ever stayed in. Close to everything important in the city and the metro. It's more of a 4 star for me really. The breakfast was good and we also used the computer that was in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Quiet, relaxing oasis within the city.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europark for four nights last week. The hotel was so quiet and the beds were ultra comfortable. The room had thick black out curtains that were so effective we had to set an alarm to wake up in the morning. We booked a bed and breakfast package and the breakfast was more than adequate. We didn't get to enjoy the pool area because we had terrible weather but it looked like it could have been nice on a warm day. All in all, a very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely area!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: Overall: Very nice, modern hotel for European standards, although I think it should have been a bit less expensive (we paid $200). I would stay here again. Location: A bit north of the top of La Rambla, which I was actually fine with since La Rambla and the Bari Gotic area are so much more crowded. We were able to easily get to the hotel from the airport by train (straight to the Passeig de Gracia stop) and then a 5-10 minute walk. There are 2 trains near the hotel, one is basically right across the street and can take you directly to the Barri Gotic area (a couple of stops) and also to the beach. The hotel area is very nice, and and very close Passeig de Gracia, which is a popular shopping street, off of which there are any nice restaurants/cafes. We were walking distance to Casa Batllo, La Pedrera and Sagrada Familia. Hotel Room: We booked a standard room and received one on the 1st floor overlooking the street (no street noise to speak of). It was very modern looking and had a nice king bed (comfortable enough, blanket could have been better) as well as a clean, nicely-sized, well-appointed bathroom. Bathroom amenities included the usual kit of shampoo, conditioner, etc. I appreciated that the towels were pretty large vs the tiny ones you sometimes get that barely go around your waist. The room was also equipped with a TV, desk, full-length mirror and closet area. Free wifi service was sometimes in and out, but the front desk gave us a cable to connect to internet, after which we had no problems. Hotel Amenities: Nice lobby with a computer for guests to use. Rooftop pool area was very nice. The pool was too cold for me, but it was a nice area in which to lay out and relax. We didn't get breakfast there so I can't speak to that. Service: Everyone here was very nice and helpful with all of our questions and requests

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find! Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: rberk
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for five nights in June 2011 and we had a great experience. The hotel is situated in the quaint Girona section of Barcelona, about a 20 minute walk from Placa Cataluyna and La Rambla. For American tourists that we were, this hotel is located in a non-touristy corner of the city that was filled with really great tapas bars, block parties, bbqs and street fairs. Its a perfect location because you can quickly walk to the action on La Rambla but dont have to deal with the crowded tourists on the sidewalks outside the hotel. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast for a slightly higher nightly fee. ITS WORTH IT!! It was, by far, the most amazing selection and finely cooked local fare I have ever seen in a hotel breakfast. All fresh local sausage, ham, cheese, bread, smoked bacon, i can go on for ever! The hotel also has a very relaxing roof top pool and patio. The hotel offers 3 business computers for common use. The computers internet service were faster than anything in the US. FIVE STARs for Euro Park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful comfort, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kessham
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first week-long trip to Barcelona and I still have images of Gaudi dancing in my head. We chose Hotel EuroPark on the basis of the location and the many 5 star reviews I saw on Trip Advisor. I'm so glad we did. The location was ideal -- in a lovely neighborhood that was quiet at night but extremely well situated for either walking to nearly everything (we're walkers) or with several metro stops close by, including the RENFE train station for the airport. The hotel itself is very modern, clean, well serviced. Our room, a superior, was extremely comfortable. It was cool and rainy during our visit, so we slept with windows open (we had good cross-ventilation from two windows). Ask for a room at the back if you need quiet. We took breakfast and it was very good, English-style. There is wifi throughout, but I found it a little fickle. I discovered that I could reconnect by rebooting my iPad every now and then. When in doubt, reboot! All in all, an excellent hotel with excellent value. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiMies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at EuroPark during Easter and it was PERFECT! Great location, near all the Gaudi sights and some great restaurants. Room was not huge but certainly big enough for us. You'll won't be spending much time in it anyways. Bathroom clean and spacious. We had a room facing the street, which gave a bit of noise. Would recommend you get a room on the other side if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALfromBoston
Reviews.Content: The room was very modern and exceptionally clean. A very generous supply of personal toiletries was replaced every day. The location is perfect--near the subway and bus lines and only about a 5 euro taxi ride to Placa de Catalunya, where all the tour buses start, and Las Ramblas, the old Roman road which is now a really fun tourist strip. You can walk to the Sagrada Familia in about twenty minutes. The front desk staff were extremely helpful in giving directions and provided free maps that were very easy to use. There is a supermarket and CVS-type store (check their hours) across the street as well as a pharmacy and various restaurants in the area. The free wireless internet worked fine and there is a computer and printer available for guests. I was on the fifth floor near the elevator and the soundproofing was so good that I never heard any noise from the corridor or the street. As usual in Europe, there were no ice machines but you can get a bucket of ice from the bar on the second floor. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else the next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Europark is GREAT VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: marty451
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights recently at Europark Hotel in Barcelona (May 22-27) and I highly recommend it. It is GREAT VALUE! This is not a three star hotel and I would rate it as a 4 star hotel. The rooms are spacious and new and clean. There is also a rooftop pool to relax after a day sight-seeing. It is only a 10-15 minute walk from the action in L:a Rambla and the great side streets. It is also very quiet so you cna actually sleep if you want to. My daily routine consisted of waking up around 10am and doing my sight-seeing, always by foot, and then returning to the hotel around 5pm. Take a book, a drink and a cigar to the rooftop pool and relax for a couple of hours before heading out to dinner and drinks. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: yaronkalkstein
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've stay in any of Europe's largest cities. Large rooms, huge bed and perfect service. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I really recommend it”
Reviews.Author: BudaSorridente
Reviews.Content: It was the second time in this hotel. I found the hotel very good since the first time. Friends who have stayed in this hotel also felt great. The price is good, the service courteous and correct. Good location, spacious, clean and well decorated. I was always in the rooms facing back. There is not a good view, but is silent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jef009
Reviews.Content: We first tought it looks nice but it is a bit far from the center. How wrong were we, 10 minutes walk from restaurants, ramblas, ... Great restaurant nearby. Room was great and the pool on the roof was very calm if you wanted to rest a bit in the late afternoon before going to eat something. 24 reception, always ready to answer your questions, ... If I would come back to Barcelona I would again book the same hotel. Also to go back home no problem for leaving the luggage there, printing our plain check-in tickets, ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, definately delivers 5* luxury for 3* prices!”
Reviews.Author: dgbtrain
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on a recommendation from our son, who had stayed here on a recent business trip. On arrival, late afternoon on a Sunday, we were a little concerned that the hotel was situated away from the popular tourist areas. How wrong we were, the very friendly Receptionist informed us that we were actually only 5 blocks (10 min walk) from lots of restaurants and only a further 5 mins from Le Ramblas, giving us a map so that we could find our way around easily. We also discovered on day 2 that we were only a 10 minute walk from the Sagradia Familia (definately worth a visit). The facilities in the hotel were faultless, the rooms were lovely and luxurious, not what you would expect from a 3*. We spent most late afternoons on the rooftop terrace, which was suprisingly quiet. Would definately recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Flowerpop5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for four nights. It was january so the room rates were a lot cheaper than what they would normally be I think. This hotel is located just a 10min walk from the street (Passeig de Gracia) that has some of Antoni Gaudi's most famous architecture including Casa Mila (which has an amazing rooftop) & Casa Batllo. The hotel is a 15min walk to Sagrada Familia- which is a must see when in Barcelona! It is the most amazing place to see and walk around. We caught public transport to transfer & from our hotel from the airport no worries. And during our stay we only caught public transport a few more times, the rest of the time we just walked about. So Location is fantastic, with lots of resturants down the side streets with yummy tappas! Our hotel room was fantastic. Very clean & modern. Perfect size. There is a roof top pool but it was too cold for swimming in January. We tried the breakfast only one morning as it was quite expensive, but it was lovely with a large variety of cold & hot foods. There is a delicious bakery on the same street as this hotel, a few blocks down on the corner which does lovely fresh bread & the most delicous apple danish's! There is also a supermarket on the same street (walking from Passeig de Gracia towards the hotel) which we used to buy our lunches etc. This hotel is about a 20min walk to the famous La Rambla - which is worth a visit but we preferred the street near our hotel as it wasn't as crowded. We had a picnic on the wharf which is about a 25min walk. A must do while in Barcelona is to go to Park Guell & to get to Tibado- it has great views of the whole city and is a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: ChristineCitrano
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I recently had the pleasure of staying at Europark in Barcelona and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location, somewhat quiet residential area, was perfect and it was easy to catch a cab or walk to nearby metro station. Staff were courteous and helpful. Room was large, clean, and modern with all the striped decorations. Breakfast was ample. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DunblaneScully
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little away from the hustle and bustle of Barcelona centre but that's no bad thing. The rooms are'nt spacious but are clean and trendy. They had double-booked our room but were very apologetic and gave us an upgrade to one of there apartments. The aprts have a balcony which gives wonderful views over Barcelona so we did'nt complain too much. There's also a handy supermarket just up the street to stock up on drinks and food for day-trips. All in all, we were pleased with the accomodation and would recommend it as a place to base yourselves for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for an authentic Barcelona experience”
Reviews.Author: KD49
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is fabulous... not in a touristy, loud area, centrally located, safe neighborhood, and close to both the L3 and L4 metros, which take you to everything you could want to see in Barcelona. We felt like we got a glimpse of real life in Barcelona, as we were in a neighborhood with many young families, people walking their dogs, kids going to school, etc. The restaurant across the street, Dass, is excellent and the lunch is 11 Euros for 3 amazing courses! Such a great find! Manuel owns the Particcella cafe on the corner, and is very kind and welcoming to tourists. The hotel rooms were very much as pictured on the website, with no disappointments. The shower was fantastic, the breakfast buffet had great selection, the bed was comfy, the blackout curtains worked a little too well, and the internet worked fantastically. The fitness room had a very nice treadmill and two newer exercise bikes, and free water bottles. Room service food was not very tasty, but that is the only drawback. I am very glad we chose this hotel, it was an excellent value for our stay, and surprisingly in a very convenient and enjoyable location.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: carberry1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Europark for our honeymoon. We spend 4 nights in the penthouse and we were not disappointed. As all the other reviews have said, this hotel is one of the best in Barcelona. From the check in to checking out, we never had a problem. The staff were very helpful, the penthouse was beautiful and the area is perfect. The penthouse is as you would expect. A separate sitting room with doors to the balcony. There is a coffee maker and kettle and a full size fridge. There is a seetee and 2 chairs plus a TV and separate AC. The bedroom had a HUGE bed, wardrobe space, a TV and doors to the balcony. The bathroom was fantastic. We had 2 sinks, 2 showers and the window looked out on the Sagrada Familia!! The little pack of goodies was restocked every day with everything you would need for your stay. The staff sent up a bottle of Champagne when we arrived, which was grateful received :-) The area is safe and within a 10 min walk to the Sagrada Familia in one direction and Las Rambla is a 15 min walk in the other. The Girona metro is 2 mins away for getting to the beach and the Passage De Gracia metro is 5-7 mins away to get to other sights around the city. Please don't be afraid to use the metro as it is so easy, so quick and so cheap. We used it a lot and never got lost. We ate in 3 restaurants, Citrus and Pomarada on Passage De Gracia and La Rita on C. Arago, just up from the hote. Would not rate Citrus, rude waiter, cold food and steak not cooked as asked. La Rita was lovely and very reasonable. Doesn't open til half 8 and a queue forms very quickly so booking would be a good idea. But Pomarada gets our vote. When you reach Passage De Gracia from the hotel, turn right and the restaurant is up that way on your right. You have to go upstairs. The food was gorgeous, esp the sea bass. Beautiful. We ate twice there and weren't disappointed. To finish up, brilliant hotel and would definitely stay there again, we were sorry to leave. It is just far enough away from the mad area of Las Ramla but close enough to reach everything if you need to. Thank you Europark, you made our honeymoon very special.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean, great service and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Katongo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Europark and it would be my hotel of choice if I visit Barcelona again. I found the service to be even better than on my first stay. The rooms are well maintained with comfortable beds. Our room was at the front of the hotel and I would disagree with other reviewers who complained about noise. The noise was minimal and certainly did not disrupt my sleep. Location wise, the hotel is very close to Girona metro station which is the line you need for visiting the beaches. You can also walk to Passeig de Gracia metro station which is close to Casa Battlo (a Gaudi must see) and takes you with ease to the Ramblas and usual touristy haunts. The top end of the Ramblas can be walked in about 15min and in good weather makes more sense than getting the metro. The rooftop pool is more of a plunge pool, but certainly a comfortable and pleasant place to spend a lazy afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “definitely a value for money hotel, i would stay there, again and again”
Reviews.Author: gringo_1975
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, in an area far from the touristic "Las Ramblas". Very clean room, lovely buffet breakfast, helpful and gentle staff, safe area. Noise could be an issue, but as long as you get a high-floor room, this should not be a problem. I will definitely visit Barcelona again and i will choose this hotel for may stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jorg
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay, we were upgraded to a superior room with a massive bed!! Positives = room lovely, staff very helpful, very very clean and the shower was wonderful! Negatives = not many other than breakfast at 14 euros per head is way too expensive (we didn't have it so don't know about value) and the location is not quite ideal, local metro is girona which doesn't take you quite to the centre (but does go to Jaume 1 which isn't too bad) but you are a bit 'away' from it - but that might suit you. There is also a good bar a couple of blocks away called Republic which is much cheaper than centre bars.

Reviews.Title: “convenient hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: malena7033
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, close to metro , in a beautiful neighborhood, will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good but a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: PJBBournemouth_UK
Reviews.Content: Overall I would recommend this hotel but the location may be troublesome if u want to be nearer the tourist crntre or the front. There is one tube line very close (L4) however the tube is not open 24 hrs except Saturday. This was not really an issue but did require us to think where we were going each evening as we generally eat late. Rooms are good and clean but there is no English tv which is strange as the public rooms have sky and BBC world but not in the rooms. I am not sure why? We had a problem with the air conditioning and we were moved to a different room and they were very apologetic. Breakfast is good and really all you need for a simple and straightforward Breakfast. English is understood unlike many places in Barcelona . Would I come back ? Yes but may try one of their other hotels nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittyketreid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europark for a short stay. We stayed here as we wanted to stay away from the hustle and bustle of La Ramblas while still being in a central location. It's less than 500m from the train station so you can get there from the Airport in no time at all. You don't need to take a taxi, it's so easy to get to. The hotel was amazing. Very stylish, modern and spacious room. We actually thought we had a superior room it was so plush with it's monochrome styling and high end bathroom . Located near metro stations and all the high end stores like Burberry and Tiffanys, its also a couple minutes walk from Casa Batlló. Service was good and hotel very clean. It fits the classiness of the L'Eixample district. It also has a very stylish rooftop pool to relax by. The hotel also have free wifi and computers with internet and printers located on the ground and 1st floor you can use for free which we found so so useful during our stay. It's very quiet too so you can get a good nights sleep. There's also a fitness centre on the lower ground floor free to all stayees. It also came with a lovely box in the bathroom packed with complimentary, comb, dental and shaving kits, shower gels and shampoos, a sponge and even a shoe buff! There's also a hair dryer in the bathroom so no need to pack one. My only down point is that it's not near any decent bars or cafes that are open late at night. However the room service was so cheap that we came back from a night out and ordered a nice cup of tea and coffee to our room it was cheaper than having it in a cafe. It appears pricey at first, but you can get good rate deals on booking sites. I recommend getting a deal with this hotel which will include breakfast in the price, it will save you money in the long term during your stay. Most hotels in Barcelona don't include breakfast and charge you by the day for it. We would definately stay there again and recommend it to others. Ideal for families, couples and business people.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: ahopkins69
Reviews.Content: Great Location near metro and 15minute lesiurely stroll to Ramblas, Huge comfortable bed and shower, Staff really look after you, on arrival greeted with suprise bottle of cava, rose in the room on St Jordis day 23rd april, very relaxing ambience and good hearty breakfast choices, free WIFI, Would definitely stay here again if returning to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLouise10-71
Reviews.Content: We loved the Europark! We stayed here for 3 nights and recommend it highly! It was very close to the main attractions and Passeig de Gracia, close to metro stations and great shops. The room was very comfortable and true to the pictures! The staff were very helpful! Free WiFi was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Markydee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Europarks hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of April. we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the hotel is in a good location; it is 5 blocks to the Passage De Gracia aprox 10 minute walk and 4 blocks in the opposite direction to the Sagrada Familla again about 10 minutes walk, we also walked to Las Ramblas which took about 25 minutes. The room was great, immaculately clean and the bed was huge! The staff were really friendly and spoke very good English, they directed us to every where we wanted to get to. We spent our late afternoons by the pool which was lovely. This is a great hotel and we really liked the location too. I would defiantly recommend and would defiantly return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and style in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ciara_o_11
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, didn't try the food but our room and en suite was spacious, elegant, comfortable, and in a central location (and very safe area) that would be hard to beat (only about a 5 minute walk from Casa Batlló). Excellent value for money too, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: toldigabi62
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, it is available with the train from the Airport, and it is close to Passeig de Gracia and the underground. The staff was kind and we could get our room earlier than the official time. The room was clear and nice and surprisingly we have a terrace as well. The bathroom was very good and light. I would like to emphasize the light of the room and the bathroom, because there were reading lamps, and it is not so frequency in the hotels. There is a free internet. We would like to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelDLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in this hotel at the start of April. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Both were at the back of the hotel and so had a balcony and were very quiet. I hadn’t realised just how central it was with three Gaudi sites nearby but also a fairly easy walk to the central square. The local metro is quiet at night but we never felt unsafe and best of all the RNFE train from the airport stops only a few blocks away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Ebilinie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the EuroPark hotel in late March and I chose the EuroPark based on TripAdvisor comments. Honestly, I got much more than I expected. The hotel is perfectly located and within walking distance to all the major attractions, Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera, Casa Batllo, La Rambla, Palau de Musica Catalana and more. You're a short walk (about 5 minutes) to Passeig de Gracia that has great shopping and plenty of restaurants. We highly recommend La Rita restaurant - but get there early - around 8:30 - if you want to get a seat. The staff at the hotel was outstanding - in particular Marc at the front desk. He always had great suggestions for restaurants. All of the staff spoke excellent English. I was able to access wi-fi everywhere in the hotel. The hotel also has 3 pcs available for public use. The one in the main lobby is almost always in use, so use the 2 located on the the first floor. The rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished - the views are nothing to write home about, but they were interesting. As with a few of the other reviews, we did find it hard to cool down the room and the hallways were very, very warm. I would stay at this hotel again if I have the opportunity to visit Barcelona again. I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mawarjg
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our trip in Barcelona and we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel came highly recommended by my cousin's friend but truthfully, the 3* rating put me off for a while. I have been in 4* hotels which lacked amenities. Initially, I wanted to find a hotel in La Rambla, where all tourists seem to be. I feel I made an excellent decision by choosing Hotel Europark. the hotel exceeded my expectation. The check-in (and later, check-out) was a breeze. We had a triple room. The hotel and room. looked exactly in the photos - chic. The toiletries were more than I would get in a 5* hotel. Very clean. The big plus was free wi-fi. The only English speaking channel was Disney channel but with an excellent working free wi-fi, we can overlook the lack of English channel. My 4 year old daughter and I were jet-lagged and hungry on the first night there, there was limited room service to satify our hunger. And Passeig de Gracia is only 4 blocks away. It is a beautiful avenue with both Gaudi's Casa Ballto and Casa Mila and smart and trendy shops and restaurants. In our books, a better place to be than the heavily tourist congested La Rambla. The hotel helped to make our stay in Barcelona,EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and views”
Reviews.Author: Liljoey76
Reviews.Content: We experienced great service. We had a full morning of traveling and checked into the hotel earlier than 3 pm and they were able to get us a room right away instead of us having to store our luggage. I wanted to get a room that was quiet and we needed a larger bed or 2 singles, the front desk accomodated both of those needs without any run around. We stayed on the 8th floor with a view of Sagrada Familia. it was fantastic. The room was clean and spacious. It also had a mini bar refrigerator that we were able to use to put in items for breakfast and store wine/ beer. The bathroom was larger than expected, which was nice too. Being on the 8th floor also meant we were able to walk out to the roof top terrace and pool, which was nice. The hotel is located about 5 blocks from Passeig de Gracia which has a major Metro stop and by Block of Discord and Casa Mila. We used the Metro quite a bit when we got tired of walking. We ate in the hotel restaurant 1 night due to site seeing much of the day and being tired. it wasn't anything special and expensive. I believe the rooms had WiFi but we just used the free internet computers in the lobby or first floor. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. There is a market located about 1 block south west of the hotel (on the same street) that we bought fruit, juice and muffins at. Saved us some money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: efandb1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 4/10-4/14. Nice room,nice staff,weak buffet food.Located 5 minutes from L4 metro line which is two stops from Jaume1 stop and three stops from the Barceoneta stop. Jaume 1 is the old city stop where tours start in the Plaza Real.Barceloneta is the stop by the Marina and the Mediterranean Sea. Great seafood restaurants. Not a cheap city but not killer expensive. The hotel staff at all times were extremely helpful and cooperative.Very professional in all ways.Hotel is immaculately kept with very nice comfortable rooms. I would carefully consider whether I would get a room in the front, Arago is a very busy street.We had a side room.. no view but quiet. I do not think I would have a room with buffet inclusive again. I know you can do better eating in the many local coffee houses and restaurants in the area. Would we stay at the Europark again. Yes we would. It is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location with good value for money”
Reviews.Author: i-am-an-onion
Reviews.Content: My brother and I just spent 4 nights at Europark hotel. Our stay was very pleasant. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from Girona subway station. It's in a rather quiet neighborhood so the city noises didn't bother us at all. The staff at the front desk were very helpful as well. The room was bigger than we expected and the breakfast buffet was very nice. In conclusion, the hotel offers excellent value for money and we would definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, fantastic location, lovely rooms, patchy service”
Reviews.Author: bigdom76
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Barcelona and so we had no idea what to expect in terms of the hotel and it's location. Luckily, it is in a great situation close to Passeig de Gracia (5 minutes walk) and only 10 minutes from the stunning the Sagrada Familia. It is on a busy road, but even though our room was facing the traffic, the sound was mostly kept out. The room itself was lovely. Decorated in a monochromatic style, the room was a good size with very comfortable beds and a well-sized bathroom. It was very clean when we arrived and was thoroughly cleaned every day, as you'd expect. All rooms have a TV, a phone and the whole hotel has free wi-fi which seemed quite quick and reliable. We only ate in the restaurant on one occasion and we were the only diners! The food was fine, but we found it much more enjoyable to venture into town and find more of an atmosphere. Two places we enjoyed eating at were Divinus and Pomorada, both on the Passeig de Gracia. The breakfast buffet was excellent - lots of choice and always plenty of food too. The staff at breakfast were excellent and friendly too. Sadly, we found some of the other staff rather stand-offish and lacking in warmth. For example, when we checked out on our final morning, the manager was happy to take payment for the breakfasts and handed back the card without so much as a thankyou, enquiry as to how we enjoyed our stay or good wishes for our journey home. Though these things aren't vital, it did sour things slightly. Don't for one minute let this put you off staying at the hotel, though. It is a great place to base yourself in to get the most from Barcelona, a truly lovely city which I intend to revisit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cameronhotelman
Reviews.Content: Pros: Comfortable and stylish interior. Large and comfy beds. Free wi-fi and use of computers & printer. Reasonably priced minibar. Very near girona metro & a large supermarket. Cons: On a busy road, can be noisy. No English tv channels. Breakfast's hot selection was poor

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LouiseEastLothian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in early April and as it was our first time in Barcelona had been unsure if we`d chosen the right location, however it was perfect. We walked everywhere, only 10 minutes from Sagrada Familia and the same to Playa Catalunya and the Ramblas and even less to Gaudi`s La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. We had a room on the 7th floor at the side and whilst there was no view I think a room at the front would`ve been too noisy, the room was an excellent size, bigger than other city centre hotel rooms I`ve stayed in, and the bathroom was excellent with a very large shower. Only minor niggle was the heat in the hotel landings and the rooms themselves - not unbearable, and it was particularly hot outside, but perhaps it should be addressed. The breakfast was very good and the service excellent, no queues and the buffet was regularly replenished, a very nice room to eat and relax. The 8th floor terrace was a lovely bonus with comfy seating and a very small swimming pool - an excellent spot to unwind after a busy day sightseeing. Checking in and out was very efficient and all the reception staff knowledgeable and friendly, we were flying out on late evening flights and it was great to have a secure baggage room to leave our cases. We took the city tour bus on a 2 day ticket (30 euros) there are 2 routes of over 2 hours each and as you`re able to hop on and off wherever you want it was definitely the best option, buses leave Catalunya Square every 10 minutes. From April a lot of the popular attractions are open until 8pm which certainly helps to avoid some of the crowds/queues and if you can make the effort, as we did, the Sagrada Familia is possibly best visited around 9am before the coaches arrive! Definitely worth the effort as it`s quite astonishing inside. Barcelona is a lovely city for a short break and the Europark Hotel is an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location and great staff/service”
Reviews.Author: Shwe70
Reviews.Content: i searched high and low, and thank god i took some time and didn't go with the first hotel that came up. the Europark is within excellent distance of everything. just a v pleasant 20 min walk away from Catalunya Square, where you can start your bus tour via Bus Turistic (Europark give you a discount voucher). Bus Turistic do 3 city routes, red - south, blue - north, and green - beach area. Europark voucher gives you a couple of euros off this. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Barcelona North Bus Station (should you fly to Girona, bus to Blona North Bus Station return is just EUR21, and runs regularly-check thier website). back to the hotel...rooms are spotless, lots of attention to detail. free internet access (if you need that kind of thing there are PC's in lobby and on 1st floor). Breakfast was great. staff very friendly, and though may be a simple thing, they remember our beverage order from day one.....it's the small things really. i was on ground zero, but you must visit the 8th floor terrace. outdoor little terrace, with sunbeds and pool. at night, it great to look up to the stunnin Mount Tibedabo, and the cathedral up there, just a last sight before sinking into your comfortable bed in the europark. enjoy. i v.highly recommend, and can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for everything!!”
Reviews.Author: LynneT1095
Reviews.Content: Really modern hotel with excellent service. Check in & check out very simple and staff are really friendly. The room was amazing and very clean, we didn't have breakfast but it looked really nice with a good selection of hot & cold food. The location is right next to metro station & only 2 stops to Las Ramblas and very easy to use. Overall we had an excellent holiday & would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected. Would Recommend and Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: rbginnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Europark for 3 nights and enjoyed. The hotel is as portrayed in the pics. Although the rooms are tiny, I kind of expected that. Plus, I traveled alone so the size of the room didn't bother me. If I were with another person, I would've definitely requested a larger room. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Because I traveled alone, I kind of relied on them to help plan my trip and they accommodated every ridiculous request I had. Free wifi in the room worked without a problem! Plus, they have computers in the lobby and the 1st floor available for guests to use. The bathroom is great. Very clean, great water pressure and temperature! After walking around the city every day, I looked forward to returning to the hotel and taking a long hot shower before dinner. As other reviewers mentioned, the hallways are very warm. My room was also extremely warm. After having no success adjusting the temperature in my room, I finally called the receptionist and they sent someone up right away. Within minutes, my room was much cooler. My room didn't have much of a view. It faced another building, so that was a bit disappointing, but I didn't spend much time in my room so it wasn't too big of a deal. The rooftop pool and lounge area is very nice. I had a little time to kill before heading to the airport, so I hung out up there after I checked out. The location of the hotel was perfect! A short 5 blocks from the main street, Passeig de Gracia was very convenient. I was able to walk to all of the main attractions, but also catch the train if I wanted to go outside of Barcelona. There are also great restaurants and shopping within immediate walking distance of the hotel. As for Barcelona itself...what a wonderful city. Although everyone recommends you watch your purse because of pickpocketers, I never felt unsafe on Las Ramblas or the trains. Maybe it's the New Yorker in me. If you're into the beach, I highly recommend hopping on the train and going to Sitges instead of one of the local Barcelona beaches. Sitges is far superior. It's only about a 30 minute train ride outside of the city. I had the best time there!

Reviews.Title: “Unclean Bed.”
Reviews.Author: lizandjoe24
Reviews.Content: My husband & I visited Barcelona for a weekend and stayed at EuroPark Hotel. The hotel was very warm, esp in the hallways. It was a fairly mild weekend so this seemed odd. Most importantly though, the bed was full of hair. When I pulled back the comforter there were at least 5 hairs on the sheets. I'm not sure how they could have even changed the bed before we arrived. I immediately called down to reception and all the man said was, 'I'll send a cleaning lady up to take a look.' No apologies, nothing. Of course when the cleaning lady arrived we had to explain the situation in our broken Spanish. She changed the bed and there were no other complaints with the hotel throughout our stay, but if you ask me, it's a rather big one. I would at least expect an apology or some level of concern over such an incident from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NikoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Excellent . Very friendly staff. They help us with even "unreasonable" demands

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, safe location.”
Reviews.Author: drg33
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was quite pleased. I am a woman in my mid-30s, and was traveling alone, so safety was a priority. The location felt very safe, and I had no reservations about walking back to the hotel at night. It is an easy walk to many of sights, including Las Ramblas, Gracia, and the Gaudi sites. The hotel is slightly removed from the center of action, which I preferred, as I wanted peace and quite at the end of the day. There is a subway 1 block away, which was great. There are a lot of really nice restaurants within easy walking distance, and since they are not on the main drag, the prices and quality of the food are much better. My room was immaculate. It was not huge, but nice sized for Europe. I had a king sized bed with tons of pillows- it was fabulous. The bathroom was modern and the shower was better than the one I have at home. The free WiFi in the rooms worked really well. The staff were generally pleasant and spoke English quite well. I feel I got a lot of hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and room, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: psbradys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to through TA with discount. The week was very busy as a major tradeshow was in town so I was happy to get some discount. This hotel is located easy walking distance to many restaurants, Placa Catalunya, Ramblas, etc. Hotel has free WiFi in the rooms as well as computers in the lobby and restaurant floor. Definitely go with a Superior room to get more space and a spacious bathroom. There was even a small balcony, although the view was nothing to enjoy. We had a requested a quiet room and got one on the 7th floor back of the hotel. Indeed it was quiet. On the day I requested the room to be made up I got a great bowl of fruit and bottles of water. A very nice touch. The breakfast is ok...fairly standard European fare. Coffee is very good. But just a block away is a fabulous little coffee place and bakery called El Moli Vell. I found out later it is a small chain around the city. But it was probably one of the best cappucinos I have ever had and the danish and quiches was also great and reasonable prices. Also a block away is the groecery and open air markets, so you can get fresh fruits, bottles of water, snacks, wine and beer. The hotel restaurant offers lunch and dinner options, but no one seemed to be dining there. The bar was good and great selections for wine. They would prepare a tray to take up to the room. Hotel staff was very good and front desk personnel spoke English fluently. We would definitely stay here again if ever in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: doco
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel which looked exactly as it did in the photographs...wow!!!! was easy to find as got the train from the airport and it brought you out on the corner of the street..so very convenient. walked about 5 minutes and arrived at the hotel.the hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful..both my husband and myself thought it was more like a 5 star to look at...we paid for breakfast which was very nice and hads lots of choice....and if you're a big eater its excellent cos you can eat as much as you like..had cheese, ham bread,pastries,toast(which you did yourself) butter all different preserves..full english..bacon sausage etc..cereal, fruit, yoghurts,3 different fruit juices,tea, coffee ,milk...so plenty of choice! the breakfast staff all spoke good english and were all very nice.the hotel was spotless throughout and very boutique-like...(posh). our room was very spacious had wooden floor and a massive bed...the drapes were very thick and blocked the light out well..the lighting was very nice too...we had a full length mirror (great for us ladies) and a nice size flat screen tv...there were also 2 very nice comfy chairs in the room and a very spacious wardrobe..the safe was free,which is a bonus ..and the minibar was well priced..also if you took a kettle like us.. there was space in the minibar for milk ...we also had a nice balcony with chairs and table..we didnt use this as were out most of the time..it looked out onto a courtyard so not the best view..lol! the bathroom was also lovely with a large glass doored shower,toilet and sink...again plenty of mirrors and great lighting..also we got free shower gels, shampoo, razor ,sponge,tissues,soaps,toothbrush,shower cap,and shoe cleaning sponge..which was a nice touch! the towels were changed daily as were the sheets on the bed.the hotel was nicely situated away from the noisey part but close enough to walk ..about 15 minutes from the ramblas...there are restaurants nearby and coffee shops and bars..the hotel bar shuts a little early 10.30pm...but has a good range of drinks. ..we didnt eat in the hotel on an evening but the food did look very nice...we found the hotel very quiet..which was good after a busy day sightseeing...was able to get a nice sleep.. i forgot to mention it also had free hi speed internet...i would definately book this hotel again..we didnt want to come home...and i would be very happy to recommend it to anyone ..my hubby brought me here for my 40th birthday and i have to say its been one of my best birthdays ever..x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Well decorated, well equipped, great service.”
Reviews.Author: travellWith2Children
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Decoration is cool, bed is comfy, free internet, rich breakfast, great service. Really excellent, and not that pricy. Location is good, but not optimal. Walking distance to almost all attraction, but metro is near by anyway. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great place, I would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Dorsalfin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine and the staff were all fluent in English and ready to help out if asked. The hotel is on a busy street, being a native NY'er (the city) street traffic does not bother me. If I were to stay here again, I would ask for a room in the back. There is heavy traffic on the Via Arago, but oddly no one ever honks the horn, it's just the constant "whoosh" of street traffic all night long. Barcelona is a city in which your valuable have to be deeply hidden at all times. One of the people I was traveling with was pick pocketed on the train in from the airport; which sadly put a pall on the whole trip for him.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & great service for the price!”
Reviews.Author: hepshiba
Reviews.Content: Our standard room was small, but nicely laid out. It was spotlessly clean, with new furniture. The bathroom was lovely, with a big shower (also spotless). Service was excellent. Our room was at the back of the hotel, and very quiet despite being located next to the elevator. The free wi-fi was a great extra. The location was fabulous -- within walking distance of everything in the center city, if you like walking. Otherwise, it's conveniently located near two metro stops & the train to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ohsohappydays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europark for 5 nights. I choose the hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor. We were on a budget for spending money so some of my review relates to having a great time on a smaller budget. I am a really tactile person and this hotel really appeals to me, the weight of the doors, the quality of the fixtures and fittings in the bathroom, the quality of the laminate floor, the weight of the windows, heavy quality curtains and crisp soft sheets all contribute to hotels quality. You can really tell that the company have put a lot of care and attention and money into designing this hotel. Its defiantly worth paying for. The staff are as previous reviews said distant from you as a visitor unless you approach them, they are respectful and helpful when you need help. The quality of the maids cleaning was outstanding! Barcelona is a great place but sometimes we just wanted to sit and read so we made use of the room service. Ordering was really easy and the food arrived quickly and was really good quality. You can also order coffee's and drinks. There is a mini bar in the room which isnt too expensive (relative to drinks in bars water was 1.80, chocolate 2euro, mini bottle of cava 3.50) and handy if you need a quick drink, there is however a little shop just at the end of the block as you turn left out of the hotel which is very cheap for cans of drinks if you want a drink on your way to an attraction. Cans are 65cents. We walked everywhere from the euro park, to Sagrada Familia, the cathedral and Las Ramblas. It takes about 15mins to the square near the Cathedral which has the most wonderful atmosphere on an evening. We walked round and ate crepes and sweeties most nights. The selection of treats and food is wonderful. The square has side street that lead to las ramblas. If you stay here make sure you visit Dass cafe across the road, amazing coffee (Cafe con leche) and croissant! Coffee, orange juice and two croissants for 6 euros! I would return to the Europark and recommend it to anyone going for a city break in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant morning”
Reviews.Author: maplemountain
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Europark and I have to say that I'm not super happy with the level of customer service. Its a beautiful hotel with a good location but my interaction with one of the staff members has put a damper on the start to my holidays. I initially made my booking with the Europark for one person and two days ago called say my boyfriend would be joining me for the second night. Over the phone they said it was not a problem and that they would add 10 euros for the second person. When I arrived I again reminded them there would be 2 people the second night. The clerk said it was not a problem as the room was for two people. When I got in the room I noticed it had two single beds. I called the front desk and explained I needed a double bed. I was told they were all full and would have to pay the 40 euros extra for a superior room. I explained I had let them know beforehand there were two people and that it was a little frustrating just know they were letting me a double bed was not possible. The clerk said he would call me back. They called me back and said it was no problem they would give me a bed in the superior room - to pack up my things and move anytime in the morning I was ready. I packed up my things in the morning and went downstairs - the clerk was very rude - evidently knew nothing about the situation and insisted they could just push the two single beds together. I didn't want this as I hate sleeping between the crack of two beds - I find it uncomfortable. After insisting and insisting - they finally moved me to a normal double room. I appreciated the outcome but the whole process of getting there was super unpleasant and not the way I wanted to start my day.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: bobtheb22
Reviews.Content: We could not fault our stay,all receptionists spoke good English and were very helpful,Bedroom and bathroom were spotless.The beds were enormous and very comfortable. The bathroom was quite large and the shower was as good as we have ever seen in a hotel .There is a quite busy road outside (light sleepers might want to ask to sleep at the rear of the hotel ,but the surrounding area appeared very safe .There are plenty of restaurants in the area,but you can easily get into the centre if you want. We particularly recommend the tapas bar /restaurant on consell de cent (2 blocks ) it didn't seem to have a name but had a rising sun emblem. The hotel is easy to get to ,5 mins from passeig de gracia (trains and metro) one block from girona metro .Plaza de Catalunya is about 15 mins walk (airport bus ) las ramblas and the main tourist area start at this square .

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Gem”
Reviews.Author: nickgatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago. Rooms and bathroom were immaculate and it is literally right next to a metro station. You'd be mad to stay anywhere else for the money.

Reviews.Title: “great choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dephal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my 11-year-old. The room was a little on the small side but very comfortable, with a fair amount of storage and a surprisingly spacious bathroom. The design of the hotel is very stylish and the beds were comfortable. Ours was one of the standard room overlooking a sort of airshaft. So no view, but very quiet and without obnoxious early morning light. We found the location excellent for sightseeing, and the staff was helpful, especially when my luggage arrived a day later than I did. My only complaint was that the room was very warm (and I never did figure out the temp control). Free wifi too. An excellent value, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Modern Hotel worth a try”
Reviews.Author: weddingplanner87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last year. Was a short taxi ride from the airport which costs around 30 Euro. Arrived at the Europark Hotel around 10pm and were quickly checked in although just enough information was given (room number and directions to get there) no extra information was offered. We booked a superior room which was a good size and very clean with bath robes and slippers provided. The room also provided further infomation about the hotel (location of roof terrace and bar) and also had a printout of the weather during our stay which was a nice touch. The bathroom was a good size, huge power shower and little box of toiletries which was refilled everyday. The hotel is around a 10 mins walk from les rambles and around 30 mins walk from the marina, but there is plenty to see while walking. The only issue I need to point out is as we were traveling for my birthday, my partner contacted the hotel via email twice before we arrived to arrange a special treat to be put into the room (chocolates, wine etc) and was willing to pay on arrival, although he never received a reply and nothing was in our room on arrival. This little issue would of been a special touch if the hotel had been willing to help. Overall I would return to this hotel and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near everything!”
Reviews.Author: jenmac75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in January based on reviews from TripAdvisor. This hotel was great. It was one block away from a metro station, easy walking distance (10-15 min) to Sagrada Familia, Casa Mila, Casa Battlo and Las Ramblas. Room was clean, great size, no noise. Our room was not on the street, therefore no view but we were there for sleeping and showering after all. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lilainmelb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I stayed in during my 3 weeks in Spain. Our room had modern furnishings, was a good size and very comfortable. The ensuite was great! The staff were very helpful – they organised tours and car hire for us and recommended some great restaurants. The hotel is in a great location - we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and yet we didn’t feel like we were right in the middle of the city. When I return to Barcelona I would definitely stay here again. There's a pool on the roof which looked fantastic - it was too cold to try out while we were there, but if you're lucky enough to be there in Summer, I imagine it would be a fantastic end to a day of sightseeing! This hotel is excellent value for money and compares favorably with 4 and 5 star hotels we stayed at in Spain. The only down side to this hotel was the restaurant – put simply, the food wasn't good but there are plenty of fantastic restaurants near by!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not that much”
Reviews.Author: fabteixeira
Reviews.Content: Well furbished, clean and new. Accommodations are kind of small, I guess. Service is just fair. Food is bad, looks like they serve frozen food. Talking about location is a funny thing. It's not exactly near anything (but the Subway - or La Pedrera and Casa Batló in a not so short walking distance), but it's in the middle of the path for most everything in Barcelona. At first sight it seems like a superior hotel than it actually is.

Reviews.Title: “As a trained hotel manager - I would recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tetleyteacup
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel and was extremely happy with the service and quality of the rooms! In short, the price of €60 per night ( booked over Easyhotels) was excellent value! There was no breakfast included in this price - I would recommend that you visit the small cafe ( Cafe Dass ) directly opposite the hotel as the coffee is absolutely super and the cafe owner is friendly and helpful! We did try the hotel restaurant in the evening, however, the quality of the food could be better! For a drink the prices are reasonable! The only reason that I didn't give the hotel 5 * for cleanliness was because of water marks on the glass shower door ( this would have been admittedly difficult for the chambermaid to change as there was no way of drying the glass between the 2 panes of glass - badly designed!) Otherwise the cleanliness of the room came up to my exacting standards! The service was in general good, but not good enough for me to warrant 5*s. Although our room was at the front of the hotel, the traffic was not too bad after 10 PM. I would recommend anyone who tends to be a light sleeper takes ear plugs - just in case - but the street noise is no worse than any other city! All in all this hotel was an excellent experience !

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Cellsworth
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about the Europark in Barcelona was wonderful but one unusual thing was the number of electrical outlets. I've stayed in quite a few places all over Europe and the vast majority don't have enough electrical outlets. Between my wife and I we have 3 cameras, 2 phones, a laptop, an iPad and an iPod that have to be charged and other things that might need to be plugged in. In some hotels there aren't any free outlets and/or they are hard to access. Europark had plenty and they were all over the bedroom and bathroom. The room also had the most useful safe we've ever seen in a hotel room. Usually they're not big enough but this one was big enough to hold all of our electronics, extra camera lenses and our important documents. Europark is a couple of blocks away from the nearest metro stop. It's only one block away from a great market, Mercat de la Concepció, and a great food shop/restaurant, Mantequeria Ravell. It's only 0.4 miles from one of the great streets of Barcelona, Passeig de Gràcia, that has shops, places to eat and the Block of Discord (Illa de la Discòrdia) with it's Modernisme buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteVLondon
Reviews.Content: I must admit, me and my accompanying traveller (my sister) are not fussy at all. BUT we were completely amazed by this hotel. We were assigned the quietest room in the hotel, which was room 002. It's at the backside on the ground floor with no view at all (unless you consider a yellowish flat wall a view, in which case you'd be deligthed to get this room). We couldn't be bothered at all as our objective for our little get-away is to do lots of sightseeing and use the room solely for our night's rest. We found ourselves using the room more than we had anticipated as the shower was absolutely lovely and the beds were incredibly comfortable. Although free internet was available (3 stations and free WiFi), we have barely used it (only one occasion actually, to find out train times). And come on, why would you use it, when you're in such an amazing city in a very central location (near Passeig de Gracia) which should just encourage you to go out anyway. The service was great too. We got a bit tipsy one night on my sisters birthday when she decided she wanted cake after the kitchen for roomservice had closed. I went to the reception desk and did not really have to beg for it (after all, it's just slicing of one piece). We agreed to one (1) piece of cake and roomservice ended up bringing two! A hotel can make or break your trip. This hotel was such an amazing addition to our trip, it made things so much more comfortable. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable hotel with feel good factor.”
Reviews.Author: magrit3
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel within easy walking distance of the main tourist area. The bedroom booked on the internet was a standard room and was exactly as pictured. Very comfortabe and clean. Were not aware of any street noise. There was free wifi and room safe. The toiletries were replaced every day. The breakfasts had a good variety of choice. Evening snacks and room service were available but we did not try any of them. The bar prices were reasonable. There was a terrace top swiming pool with decking. Unfortunately being January we did not feel warm enough to enjoy this facility!

Reviews.Title: “Merits its high rating”
Reviews.Author: JordanRab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay immensely. When we had a problem, it was fixed quickly. When we had a question, it was answered competently. The service was great and the staff very pleasant, helpful and attentive. The Amsterdam bar, just down the street, is quite decent for an inexpensive meal of high quality. No doubt, next time we plan to be in Barcelona, we will consider the Europark Hotel first!

Reviews.Title: “Very good...but internet connection extremely slow/somewhat thin walls”
Reviews.Author: ranger22miami
Reviews.Content: We agree with the reviews...Value is excellent and location can't be beat! So glad we did not stay by the Rambla...That place is nasty! L'Eixample is the area to be! Forget about the 14 Euro breakfast...Walk a block to Mercado de la Concepcion and take your pick of the cafes inside...Awesome tortilla w/ pa amb tomaquet and coffee for less than 4 Euro! Supermarket downstairs and 24 hour flower market ?!?!?! Awesome! Internet was very slow and we had some noisy neighbors some of the nights which made me use earplugs. We asked for a back room because being right on Carrer D'Arago may make front rooms noisy. All in all, great value and location...Couldn't ask for more, except maybe more powerful WIFI...Would return again on a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Like other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Noodlesz
Reviews.Content: Convenient renfe train to passeig de gracia from airport. Check in slow only one person working Sunday evening but was fine. Room small and look over some roof on the side of the bldg. Saw a few hairs on the floor and bed spread when I walk in but otherwise appeared clean, but not spotless but any means. Room service 24 hrs w reasonable prices. Luggage storage allowed but a little weird because we had to put it into and remove from the luggage room ourselves. Cute modern little hotel and wouldn't mind staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend'”
Reviews.Author: Adibd
Reviews.Content: We stayed this weekend in the hotel, in a superior room. We didn't take the breakfast. The rooms are beautiful and clean, the lobby is inviting and the staff was very kind to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Highly recommended !”
Reviews.Author: David048
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently had the pleasure of spending 5 days in Barcelona staying at the Europark Hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind the level 10 minute walk to the heart of the city (la Rambla) It is possible to take that walk using major streets and even late at night, we didn't at any stage feel threatened. Our room and bathroom were very modern, spacious and really quiet (ours backed onto a central courtyard - nothing to look at, but great for decent nights sleep) The staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay and the buffet breakfast offered an excellent choice of options. All round we feel that the Europark Hotel would be hard be beat for those on a bubget, on a value for money basis.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and chic at a good price”
Reviews.Author: michaelb119
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. Close to pretty much everything without being in the center of it all means that you get a nice, quiet stay. I paid a little extra for the superior room and it was spacious and plush. The free wifi was a huge plus, but if you don't have a laptop they have computers easily accessible in the lobby and restaurant areas. The staff is efficient if not overly friendly and one improvement I would suggest is that there is someone at the reception desk at all times. There were a few times where there was no one to be found. Not a big deal, just an added touch that would be nice. But for the price, quality and location, I recommend the Europark very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & the added bonus of free wi-fi.”
Reviews.Author: nickc007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, very close to local Metro. A good 20 minutes walk to Las Ramblas, but thats not a bad thing as its quite chaotic around that area. Staff were helpful, rooms were furnished well and bed was huge, very comfy. There is a bar called the Daily Telegraph, come out of the hotel and go right, about 5 minutes walk. Next door is a Japanese restaurant, 14.50 euros eat as much. Dont let the dodgy view from the outside put you off, this restaurant was one of the best we have eatern in, fresh food cooked in front of you! Going back to Barcelona soon to watch some more football, it takes roughly 30 odd minutes to get to the ground from the hotel. Will use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT choice. You can't beat the value.”
Reviews.Author: loislanee
Reviews.Content: Thanks to good reviews for this hotel, I decided to book this hotel for the second half of my stay in Barcelona. The first days of the trip were business and I was in the 5-star W Hotel on the water. I knew that there would be an adjustment once I started paying the bill and moved to the more economical hotel across town. What I didn't expect was that I would have to adjust to feeling more comfortable and at home. Some of the reviewers complained about the service at this hotel. I had EXCELLENT service from the staff. I wanted a new room because I'd forgotten to book nonsmoking. Done. I forgot my electronic converter, and they gave me two. I needed directions several times a day. No problem, no bother. The room was spotless, the bed was fine, the view was okay and the location was really wonderful. Two minutes from the Gaudi cathedral, fifteen minutes walk to Las Ramblas, five minutes to the Metro, one minute to a great restaurant. Seriously, you can't beat this hotel for the money or the overall package. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring BCN”
Reviews.Author: AoSPR
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most of the reviews of Hotel Europark. It is a great value in an excellent location. Far away enough from the mobs of Las Ramblas but close enough if you still want to "been there done that". This hotel sits in a nice neighborhood a few blocks from Sagrada Familia on one side and Passeig de Gracia on the other. The La Concepcio Market is a few steps away. The hotel itself is new, clean, modern and the staff is efficient. The full breakfast rounds up the great value of the place. Our room did not have a great view to speak of but we didn't care. We wanted a nice place and a hot shower and that's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pick”
Reviews.Author: Saroo72000
Reviews.Content: The location was very good - a block from a metro station, or if you like walking - 20 minutes from the old town. There is a cute coffee shop BraCafe around the corner - perfect for breakfast and several realy smooth brazilian coffee cups - awesome service - Lorena was our star. The front desk recommended a superb and inexpensive place to eat 4 blocks away - La Rita. Ask the for it and definitely go. Rooms are on the smaller side - we didn't care since we didn't spend much time there. Also - only a few TV channels and only in Spanish/Catalan. It would have been nice to see some news, but hey, we were on vacation. The hotel could use some maintenance (shower doors, hangers, etc) but overall a nice and quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, BUT ...”
Reviews.Author: Avri45
Reviews.Content: I'v been staying for three nights with my wife. like all other reviews you will read here, every thing is correct (room is clean, modern, breakfest is very good) and so on. BUT for two night I was bited by bedbugs all over my body. I was able to smash some of the bedbugs but on the other night I was bited again. I left the hotel with a feeling that probably I will not get back again when I return to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debie13
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect!!! Beautifull and comfortable rooms, very nice breakfast, good location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BumbleBee023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in september 2010. Hotel was brilliant. It was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The hotel was about a 10/15 minute walk from the Ramblas. Can't wait to go back to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust6553
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. We had a room on the 8th floor near the pool. Although it was too cold to use it, we appreciated the deck overlooking the city, and the indoor/outdoor feel of the hallway on that floor. The room - the balcony was very nice though we faced other apartment buildings and their laundry. I liked the decor. The bathroom was big and comfortable. The food - the breakfast is a little expensive. If you are able to eat a lot and get your money's worth then it's worth it. My husband had a good deal of the bacon, etc. I cant eat much in the morning and it was wasted on me. We ordered room service one night and it was just okay. The bar - we stopped by the restaurant which turns into a bar later in the day for a pre-dinner drink on a couple of nights. The atmosphere was pretty dull. Bright lighting, etc. Didn't feel like a place we wanted to hang out. They should really turn the lights down and light some candles later in the day.The wine we ordered was quite cheap though. The gym - was nice but closed on sunday. The treadmill was broken the entire time we were there. THere was bottled water down there which we appreciated. Location - good spot near everything you want to see in Eixample. Close to the subway as well. We spent the first part of our time in Barcelona here and then moved to a hotel in the gothic quarter. I would recommend this strategy as each neighborhood felt distinctly different.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bittonboy
Reviews.Content: We chose the EuroPark Hotel after reading trip advisor reviews. We wanted somewhere that was within walking distance of the major sights. Previous reviews suggested that the beds were extremely comfortable, and that swung it for us!! The hotel decor is predominantly black and white - walls, sheets, wallpaper, tiles. The impression is of a hotel that has recently been updated. We didn't use the swimming pool on the eighth floor. We didn't eat in the hotel, except the free crisps in the mini-bar. We ate in different restaurants/cafes every day and were never dissapointed - all within walking distances. Because of the great location we were able to walk everywhere we wanted, and didn't use public transport once. All in all we were extremely happy with our stay here, but since we left for Barcelona some poor reviews have appeared on Trip Advisor for EuroPark Hotel. I'm afraid that we have to agree with the surly, unfriendly complaints with regard to the person that checked us in. There was no conversation whatsoever and certainly no eye-contact. This was the only time that we came across the individual concerned, and the younger chap that worked on reception was extremely friendly and helpful. Despite the hotel's assurances that this problem would be addressed, it obviously hasn't . It is a shame that such a rude person is allowed to meet and greet guests, but it wouldn't stop me staying at the hotel in future and I would still recommend it. For anyone wishing to buy a comfortable mattress, our mattress was a King-size FLEX Multielastic and I would definitely recommend it. A truly 5* mattress!!

Reviews.Title: “Its a pity..”
Reviews.Author: Luxuriousandmore
Reviews.Content: Because of our honeymoon I was looking for a nice hotel and I found Europark Hotel. I already stayed at their nice sisterhotel U232. I asked if it was possible tot have a special treatment because of the occasion. An upgrade or something would have been nice. Its a pity that the hotel in first place didn't do anything but giving their reservation website. They totally ignored my question! When I send them a second email with the same question they didn't offer anything but the promise to do their best to keep the best room in the same grade. But a promise isn't a quarantee I told them but no reaction at all after 3rd email, so now I have to look further for an hotell for an unforgettable honeymoontrip...

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel-exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: amidub
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect - away from las ramblas which we avoided because its tacky and rough! No point going there at all because its too commercialised! The room was a fine size, quiet and easy to sleep in and the beds were very comfortable. Modern with a great bathroom. Breakfast was very nice with good choices. Reception staff helpful and hotel is about a 10 min walk to Passeig De Gracia (kinda like the barcelona 5th avenue) with designer shops but also decent restaurants and bars. The end of the road leads onto the part of passeig de gracia that has 'gaudis house' so it was always nice to emerge onto that! The rooftop pool and terrace would be very nice during the summer!

Reviews.Title: “If you like a cold and aloof staff the stay at Europark”
Reviews.Author: 25dreamer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Europark during October 2010. The quality of the hotel was good, however the staff was not welcoming and friendly. As soon as we checked in we were treated very coldly. The staff member who serviced us lacked basic customer service skills. When we asked him about a form that we signed, he did not attempt to give us an answer. During our four day stay, the staff never greeted us as we entered and left the hotel. With the exception of one staff member, the staff was cold and aloof. The staff member who checked us out on October 24th at 7:00 am, never said thank you. He simply laid our receipt on the counter. We asked for an envelope for our receipt and he coldly placed it on the counter. He did not even place the receipt in the envelope. He watched as we folded it and placed the receipt in the envelope ourselves. We asked the same staff member for directions to a nearby metro stop and he gave us incorrect directions. We almost missed our train to Madrid because of his inadequacies. Overall, the quality of the hotel was good but we will never stay there again. On a scale of 1 to 10 we give this hotel a rating of 2 mainly because of the poor customer service we received from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Gill0528
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are spotless and beautifully furnished. The service was very good. There was a problem with our shower when we arrived but it was fixed straight away.the breakfast was plentiful including a hot selection. The location was maybe a bit out of the way but there was a metro station about 1000m away so this wasn't a problem. I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: phvenab
Reviews.Content: EuroPark Hotel is the best kept secret in Barcelona!! After spending numerous hours on the internet looking for accommodations for a Barcelona stay before taking a Mediterranean cruise, we chose EuroPark. We were a little nervous - prices were so reasonable and we wondered whether the depictions were accurate. Well . . . the hotel was all we wanted and more! Staff was great, rooms were superb, location was fantastic (a quiet off-the-beaten-path neigborhood close to everything)! The Metro, Las Ramblas, Familia Sagrada, grocery stores, wine shops are all close by. There is a great restaurant, La Rita, three blocks away. Be careful, or you will find yourself wanting to eat there everyday and not experience other great cusine of Barcelona. If I ever return, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Style and value”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSalsa
Reviews.Content: We loved our room at the Europark (we dubbed it the 'mancave'). Stylishly decorated (in a masculine black and cream) with good quality fittings (tv, lamps, linen etc) and a huge king bed. It had a handy open wardrobe system with plenty of hanging space and open shelves for suitcases and other travelling paraphenalia - everything could be kept neat and orderly but easily accessible. We had a superior room at the back of the property overlooking a large courtyard. The french doors out to our balcony were well soundproofed - once the heavy drapes were pulled at night, we didnt hear a sound. We had a fantastic night sleep every night during our 5 night stay. Our bathroom was big and beautiful and spotlessly clean. A minor quibble was the less-than-eco-friendly approach to toiletries. Each item seemed to be completely overpackaged (double plastic) and hard to unwrap and since our soap was removed everyday by cleaning staff (quite wasteful), every morning we had an irritating 5 minute battle to open another impossibly packaged bar of soap. The location of the hotel was great for us - 4 blocks from the main drag, in a residential area and near all the Gaudi buildings. Probably not a good location for party animals. Front desk staff were professional and helpful when required to help but not friendly. They rarely smiled or initiated a greeting and only reluctantly returned a "hola" if cornered. Cleaning staff were friendly and thorough. As we couldnt get a late checkout on our final day before our flight, we were very impressed with their huge luggage storage room which also had individual safes for valuables and nearby were a couple of big bathrooms for freshening up.
