We found this to be a great value hotel for the price and we would definitely stay at this hotel again if returning to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: CLRYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We were unsure what hotel to select for our recent trip to Barcelona, there was so much choice. Once again we selected a hotel from Trip Advisor's top 10 based on reviews given. We were delighted with our choice. The hotel was very modern, extremely clean, new bathroom facilities and a huge double bed. We decided to pay extra for breakfast and were very pleased we did so as it would have been a nuisance having to go out in search of food early on a morning. The breakfast was good value with plenty of choice including cooked breakfast, fresh fruits, cereals, yogurts, cakes and pastries. We would definitely have spent more if we had gone to a local cafe. The hotel is on a very busy road and we opted for a room overlooking the courtyard which again was a good tip from tripadvisor. The room was very quiet ensuring a good nights sleep. The bathroom was very new with powerful shower, excellent mirrors and an excellent hairdryer so no need for ladies to take their own. We walked everywhere and it took about 20 minutes to get to the top of La Rambles however people who find walking a problem may opt for a hotel closer to the centre. We would definitely recommend this hotel and are very glad we took tripadvisor's advice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BrisCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The lobby is clean & reception staff helpful. We had our room upgraded which was great. The room was very clean & quiet. The room service is great & reasonably priced. Breakfast was included in our room rate & included a wide variety of food. The hotel is located about 15 minutes walk to Las Ramblas & 5-10 minutes walk to the Sagrada Familia where you can also get the hop on, hop off bus. There are plenty of eateries around the hotel & a convenience store & pharmacy nearby. There is free internet available at reception & in the breakfast room. Fabulous hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: PeterCG
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after looking at TripAdvisor's list of top hotels in Barcelona and I'm glad to say that I found it deserved the compliments other reviewers have left. It is smart, new, clean and reasonably priced, and close enough (but not too close) to the grockle horror show that is the Ramblas, if that's what you are after. If you're looking for something more edifying, it's a short walk from the hotel to the Sagrada Familia and La Pedrera, and also walkable to Parc Guell. The hotel is on the corner of Carrer d'Arago and Carrer de Girona (I thought I had read somewhere that it was on C. de la Diputacio but this is incorrect). It is very close to Girona metro station but also walkable to the rail stations at Placa de Catalunya if you are heading out of town for the day. The Mercat de La Concepcio (turn right out of the hotel, about 100 metres away) has a big supermarket in case you need supplies. Having felt obliged to make some less than complimentary remarks about other hotels I have reviewed on TripAdvisor, I am glad to have found one I can recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing European Value!”
Reviews.Author: Michelly83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in September 2010 for 4 nights. I found the value of this hotel to be very good. The rooms are of a good size by european standards and the bed was a king! The bathroom was quite clean and the towels were of good quality. We stayed on the 6th floor facing the street and found there was no noise that would keep us up. I quite enjoyed the rooftop pool as it was still quite hot at that time of the year. We did not order breakfast as a part of our booking, however, we did go down one morning and were very impressed with what was available that we ended up eating it twice! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, mid distance to everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: eltel43
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel , which is very well located for most things Gaudi and the city centre etc. We were checked in very efficiently by a very informative receptionist and were in our room, which could be accessed by 2 lifts or stairs in minutes. The hotel itself is very modern with spacious rooms, complete with balcony and triple glazing. The one that we were allocated had a 6 foot bed which was very comfortable, writing desk, chairs and 2 built in wardrobes plus 2 drawer units, Sky T.V, aircon and plentiful lighting . The pillows could have been more substantial but there were plenty of them. The safe was free and below was a well stocked fridge with prices that were not out of the way. All doors were very thick and secure which must have added to the soundproofing as we never heard any noise from other guests arriving or leaving. The rooms were very clean as was all of the hotel , which employed an army of cleaners. The bathroom was a good size with walk in shower and a box of toiletries that were renewed each day comprising of soaps, gels, shampoos, comb, shower caps and even a razor. The large mirror was heated to prevent steaming up and hairdryer prominently positioned. Elsewhere in the hotel there was a small pool and sun loungers on the 8th floor. The restaurant and bar on the first, which we never frequented so cannot comment and a free internet service on the ground floor. As this hotel is situated on the Carrer d'arago that is 6 lanes wide you can expect a bit of traffic noise. We were at the front on the sixth floor and at home live where traffic does not pass by. Although we did hear some traffic noise through the night, it was not excessive. Request a rear facing room if you are a really light sleeper. Location On exiting the hotel if you turned left , walked for 2 blocks to Passiege de St John then left again for about 4 blocks to where Carrer de Mallorca and Avinguda Diagonal intersect, continue up Mallorca for 6 blocks you come to Sagrada Familia. Incidently! right on the corner of Mallorca is Marbello Cafe ( I think!) where they do an excellent freshly made English breakfast, fresh orange juice and coffee for 6 Euros. If leaving the hotel and taking a right. Within 1 block is an excellent market with fresh fruit, veg , meat and breads. Walk for 5 blocks you come to Passeig de Gracia, where immediately down to your left and across the street is Gaudi's house, also here is the Metro station. Tip. You can buy a T10 ticket for 8 euros, which entitles you to 10 trips, if there is a party of you, it can be used against each individual rather than buying seperate tickets at 1.40 euros each BEWARE Ensure you don't enter by the ticket gates to the railway as we did, you cannot swap over and it will cost you. The Metro entrance is marked but it is also hidden away to the right beyond the rail entrance. What we were informed by a ticket inspector was. On the metro, one trip means to a place and return. Where on the rail system one trip was only the one way. The next street down from Gracia, is La Ramblas, which stretches right down to the sea, it is a haven for pickpockets as is Sagrada Familia, thankfully the friendly locals went to great lengths to tell us this. Some guests in the hotel had not been so fortunate loosing passports, cards and money. Finally about 4 blocks down right from the hotel on D' Arago is a restaurant called La Rita, it opens at 20:30 hrs. The food is excellent and very reasonably priced hence the queues trying to get a table from 21:00 onwards ( they eat late in Barca. ) A typical 3 course set menu with a glass of wine and a bottle of water is 20 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: ginu28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Europark for two nights, before our Mediterranean cruise. If only for the bed, you have to book this hotel. It was such a pleasurable and restful sleep. Room is very clean. Location is convenient. Easy walk of 10 minutes to majior points of attraction. In the morning many charming places to have breackfast( if you will miss the one in the hotel) We had our breakfast included, and it was very generous and tasty meal. Nice tappas restaurants close by , in walking distance. Walked at night. Safe and quiet. In our room , we didn't hear street noise. It was very quiet. Staff is very knowlegeble. The only wish and recommendation to the staff: Please SMILE!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Tisen
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were high after all the fine reviews here on Tripadvisor, but we were still surprised that Europark was this good. The room (superior) was very nice with an enormous bed, decent size tv (with english language channels) and a nice bathroom. Everything felt new and clean. The minibar wasn't even overpriced, something you have learned to expect. The breakfast is the best I've had outside Scandinavia (where hotel breakfasts normally are amazing) and the pool area is really nice - even if we never took the time to use it. Sure, it takes a little time to walk down to the Ramblas, but it's not too far - and the taxi is only about 4-5 euros. If we go back to Barcelona is see no reason to stay anywhere else. 100% recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this!”
Reviews.Author: Merimaria
Reviews.Content: At first I tried to book a room for my vacation from Hotel U232, but cause they were already fullybooked I turned to another Nuñes y Navarro Hotels hotel in my price range. I just love their stylish, quality hotels. I absolutely felt in love with U232 during my previous visit in Barcelona, and the same thing happend again with Europark... It met all my expectations and even more, making my stay in Barcelona totally great! Booking the room via the hotel´s own web site went nice and smooth. I had tiny doubts how smooth everything would go when I eventually get to the hotel, bacause of some reviews here telling about their bookings turned out to be nonexisting upon arrival. My doubts were blown away when I recieved a friendly e-mail from the hotel couple of days before my trip reminding me about the booking and wishing me welcome. Such a small, but pleasent gesture. Checking in went ok. I had a room I requested and service was efficient with a hint of smile, but no frills. Though later on I got great service from the front desk, they were very helpful to me with all my questions and tiny troubles. They spoke very good english unlike the room service staff at the time called them... The room was absolutely lovely. Loved the style, loved the view, loved the small details in there. Our room was huge double room with twin beds and balcony. Flat screen tv, safe box, fridge, bathtube, two windows (one to the street Aragó and one to the inner court), black and white furnishing, lots of storage space... Everything was neat, clean and fresh. Air-conditioning worked totally fine, maybe some times too effectively. Only downside I can think would be the noice coming from the street. It didn´t bother me, but maybe for sensitive sleepers it may cause problems, especially if you have a room from bottom floors. There´s quite a heavy traffic on Carrer d´Aragó in the mornings and daytime and I could heard it pretty well to my 4th floor room. Definitely not a big problem, but if you mind that, maybe request a room from upper floors. Before exploring the neighbourhoods, I thought that the location might be a little far away from all the attractions, but it turned out to be just the opposite! Especially if you don´t mind walking a bit. By walk, it´s about 10mins to Sagrada Familía and 5mins more to the opposite direction to Passaig de Gracia with Casa Batllo and Casa Mila. Supermarket (Dia%) you can find on Carrer de Girona about 1,5 blocks from the hotel when walking towards Avinguda Diagonal. On your way there you´ll also pass a bakery and opposite the supermarket there´s a great shop of vegetables and fruits. Nearest metro stations are Verdaguer (L4 & L5) and Girona (L4). Girona is closer but I suggest not to change line from the others to L4 at Passaig de Gracia station cause otherwise you´ll end up walking an extremely long, hot and unpleasent tunnel connecting these lines to each others. But anyhow, the hotel is easy to reach from anywhere and the way to Placa de Catalunya and La Ramble is also walkable, about 20-30mins. Overall the accommodation experience here in Hotel Europark was totally recommendable, especially for everybody who likes to walk around the city, visit the sights nearby and appreciate unique looking hotels. And don´t forget to visit the roof top pool! Great view to the city and to Catalonian National Museum of Art and nice place to chill around!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sftekbear
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Europark. Clean rooms, friendly and knowledgeable staff, and close enough to all the top attractions while being outside all of the hectic, noisy tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Up to No. 8 on the Greatest Hits Chart”
Reviews.Author: Nixin_10
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was not my first choice of destination, but I was meeting up with a couple of cousins who I'd not seen in a while, so went purely because they were there. I thought that if I was going to go there, I might as well stay in a decent hotel, so booked myself into Hotel EuroPark, which did not disappoint. Extremely easy to get to from the airport, all you do is buy yourself a 10 journey T10 ("tay day-oo") 'targeta' at the train station, which is attached to the airport, jump on and stay on the train until it gets to Passeig de Gracia. Depending on where you exit, you might even get to see your first Gaudi building (Casa Batlló), which sits almost directly outside the tube station. From Passeig de Gracia it's a 10 min walk along Arago, or try hopping trains to Girona (Line 4) which is only 5 mins away. Upon arrival check-in was smooth - don't forget it's Europe, so they want to see your passport. My room was the smallest on my floor (I could see that from the fire escape floor plan) but as it was only me it felt perfectly snug. The rooms are very clean and I was delighted with the seriously strong power-shower! The mini-bar is reasonably priced and I was tempted to polish off the two mini-bottles of Cava for something ridiculous like €3! (The crisps were free). The bed was a double and the pillows perfectly plump. The aircon kept me cool during the day and I could open my massive window if I wanted fresh air. There's a proper hairdryer for the girls - it's slightly annoying as it's the type on which you have to keep holding down a little button to keep it going. This can sometimes mean stiff fingers, but a rubber band tied around the button helps with that. On my second day I was given a form warning me of a general strike in two days time and telling me about possible suspended services, which was extremely helpful. There's no iron in the room but if you need one just ring reception and it'll be delivered before you put the phone down. The hotel is very central and it's around a 10-15 min walk to Plaza Catalunya. Everything of interest is a 20 min walk from there. Or use your T10 (which can be used by more than 1 person at a time and all journeys within the first hour count as 1 journey. It works on all forms of transport except buses). Not only is EuroPark close to Casa Batlló, but Segrada Familia is less than a 10 min stroll, Sant Pere, La Ribera and Barri Gothic (all great for shopping, nightlife and restaurants) are 10 mins below you. La Ramblas is 5 mins away, the Arc de Triomf is about 15 mins and the park below it (highly recommended) is 20. Just jump on the tube at Girona to head straight to Barceloneta for cocktails and sundowners at one of the many Über chic restaurants along the beach front. A few doors from the hotel is a massive shopping center with a fresh food market and flower stalls etc. And along the side of the center in what looks like a small, sun-soaked alleyway are some authentic restaurants which are well worth a try. The hotel also features a swimming pool, a bar and a restaurant - non of which I sampled as I was too busy doing other stuff. Guests have free internet access (and wifi if I'm not mistaken) and daily Spanish newspapers can be found in the lounge by reception. I booked my trip with Expedia and got a great deal at £400 odd for my flights and hotel for a week. I highly recommend EuroPark to anyone who wants to treat themselves a little. P.S. My cousins stayed in the Hotel Barcelona Center, a 4 star hotel with a terrace and Jacuzzis, on the cnr of Mallorca and Balmes at a fraction of what my hotel room cost. Good places to eat are plenty, but I can highly recommend the following: Llan Tia c/ Brossoli 5 (just off Argenteria - nrst tube Jaume I) for an excellent 3-course dinner at a fixed price of €19.50 excl. wine. Drac Cafe in the Parc Ciutadella for inexpensive lunch in an atmospheric outdoor cafe. The Rose by the glass is excellent as is the potato Tortilla! I had the Tortilla, a glass of rose, coffee and two bottles of water for less than €15. Laie - el plaer de la cultura liberia. This is a bookshop with a restaurant upstairs. There's an excellent 3-course set lunch for around €13 or go a la carte for around €22 incl. a half bottle of wine. The cafe at the back of La Boqueria (forget the name but it's about the only one with chairs and tables which is still part of the market.) for the biggest mussels I've ever seen and oh so fresh! My hotel experience changed the way I think of Barcelona and I cannot recommend the entire experience highly enough. Although a week may be a tad too long. Barcelona can easily be done in three to four days max.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & good value”
Reviews.Author: coolnatkat
Reviews.Content: + Clean + great staff + good use of space + location is okay, close to metro, neighborhood seems safe but the street can be a little loud in the morning. It may be too far from the action for some people + good hairdryer (it may seem strange but most of the other hotels we stayed in in Spain had terrible hairdryers) + good value - small rooms/ no storage space -internet was very weak - pool was tiny and so cold Overall, we were very happy with the hotel. If it was an option, I would have given 4.5 stars because it wasn't perfect but I feel it was great for the price and location

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL I'VE BEEN TO”
Reviews.Author: culturevultureontour
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on the back of the reviews on trip advisor and it certainly lived up to my expectations. The staff all spoke excellent English (which saved me having to embarrass myself with my terrible Spanish!), the hotel was very clean and excellently decorated and the swimming pool area was a lovely addition. The location is perfect - within a 5 minute walking distance to the metro yet in a fairly quiet area of Barcelona. However, we didn't use the metro once - the weather was so nice, we chose to walk to the Ramblas each day, which took around 30 mins. I have visited many hotels in Europe and beyond and this is by far the best. So much so, this is the only one that I've reviewed! I would gladly stay again tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible first impression of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl081
Reviews.Content: After a 24 hour trip to Barcelona on train then bus due to a train strike in France, we were greeted by a man who had no record of our reservation, even though we had received a confirmation 4 days prior. Too bad for us they were all booked for our stay except one night. Leaving us completely exhausted and in need to find a new hotel in a foreign city after being so very careful with our travel plans. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Prashan_raj
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is convenient, the metro is only two blocks away, one of the main streets in Barca is three to four blocks away. The rates are good. The staff is friendly. The breakfast is a full English and it sets you up for the day. Free Internet in the lobby and the breakfast room. It does not hurt that the hotel is also in that beautiful town of Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - would thoroughly recommend !”
Reviews.Author: Andy_79
Reviews.Content: Am newly back from a fantastic trip to Barcelona and we were lucky enough to have based ourselves at the Europark. My girlfriend and I spotted a great deal for 5 nights at the hotel, and after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, we decided to book it. We were definately far from disappointed. On entry to the hotel, we weren't greeted overly warmly, and actually thought we had come into contact with a member of the hotel's staff who was criticised by a reviewer on here. As it happened, although he wasn't overly outgoing or friendly, he was more than happy to provide us with suggestions and recommendations for eating out and things to do and see in the city. We took the lift up to our room on the 6th floor and entered the room to find a very modern, sleek and boutique design. We had been left a welcome note with some almond sweets which were encased in a beautiful little bag. A bathrobe and slippers for each of us was also laid out on the bed. The room had a 37" (or thereabouts) wall-mounted tv which we used after a long day of walking. It also had a balcony which we used to relax and enjoy a glass of Cava in the evenings. The bed, as many have described on here, was huge; really wide, and the pillows were lovely and soft, as well !! The bahroom was modern, clean and stylish, and housed a box of complimentary toilitries, so fear not if you happen to forget your shaving kit or shampoo ! I could continue by writing more about this great hotel. We thought it was superb, and both agreed that our room was worthy of at least a 4-star status !! The staff were helpful and friendly, and the free internet was something that you don't come across too often, and provided good use for both my girlfriend and myself during our visit. Overall, I would very much recommend staying here. It is located well enough to be quiet in the area at night when you need that much-needed rest. So, give it a go. Just don't forget to try some of the sweets that they have at reception while you're there. I got pretty addicted to the red ones during my stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: TartanLad48
Reviews.Content: Also stayed at Europark for 6 nights. Was a little concerned about location as it seemed a little out on map but could not have been more wrong. Superb place perfect spot. Metros close by, 2 stops to heart of Gothic area, but out of it in evening which I preferred. Good selection of restaurants and bars all round. Hotel very clean and cool, rooms a little small but clean and quiet air con. Speaker in bathrooom for TV quite useful. Free GOOD wi-fi. A couple of minor negatives on terrace pool. No drinks an offer, a small bar up there would be a goldmine, there was 6 to 10 hot people up there most late afternoons and the offer of some cooling drinks would surely have been taken up. Also whatever possessed them to paint pool black? I know it goes with general theme of hotel but it doesn't work. All those looking at photos who have not been rest assured it is a clean cool pool not the dirty swamp it looks like. Minor and cosmetic points on the whole 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lovro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights and used it to relax and rest while exploring Barcelona all day long. And it was just right - comfortable beds, big bathroom, and a pool and a sun deck on the roof, above all the street noise, great for a nap. We got an excellent price for this type of hotel, it's close to an underground station, and a couple of cafes across the street where you can grab a quick breakfast or some tapas. We also ordered food from the hotel and it was very good! We ordered late at night and the room service staff that was on duty did not speak English, but we managed somehow. The only problem - noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dontlosemyluggage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend 5 days holiday in Barcelona and we stayed at the Hotel Europark. We traveled to Barcelona from Madrid via AVE train and took a taxi from train station to Europark, the taxi fare was less than $15euros. During our stay we used 2 hotel services; laundry and room service. Laundry cost was fair and quite fast service however the room service food was pretty bad (we're too tired and decided to stay in for the night). The hotel does offer iron and iron board upon request. The superior room (209) is fairly comfortable, there are several things the hotel should fix and address; there is a hole on the wall near the bed, the door dead bolt slot is cracked, the shower holder is loose so when you turn it on it spray all over, and the bed cover/blanket should be replace as it looks worn out. All issues seems to be some what minor but they are also easy fix to provide the right impression. The room does have adjoining room doors which means you can hear next door a bit. The hotel location is not bad, 10 minutes taxi ride from train station, about 20 minutes taxi ride to airport, and less than 10 minutes walk to Passeig de Gracia. Overall the hotel was fine and we paid about $140 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel apart from its location.”
Reviews.Author: streakybird
Reviews.Content: Well obviously judging from previous comments, I knew this hotel was going to be worth visiting, and it really didn't disappoint. We were immediately offered the larger of the rooms with the most enormous bed I have ever seen. The rooms were spectacularly clean and gorgeous design. The bathroom was lovely and every day they refreshed the box of amenities which was truly generous. Unfortunately I didn't have breakfast as im a huge fan of the spanish culture and ate out on every occasion. I was there for 3 nights and every night I slept perfectly and was never disturbed from any traffic noise, having said that, with the door open it is VERY loud in the mornings, I had the large room with a balcony at the front of the hotel. My only gripe would be its location. I am not in any way a lazy person and walk forever, but its location isn't as good as expected. I spent most of the holiday quite far down by the beach areas and if you are intending to walk back, then expect for it to take a good 40 min or so, otherwise if you are taking the metro, there's a lot of chop and changing between different lines and this can put a damper on the evening every time. Having said that, it is near the passag to gracias and that is about a 5 min walk away. If your looking for a more central hotel then this really isn't for you, however if your not fussed and prefer to be further north, then this is perfect. You are not going to find a more cleaner hotel room, its is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jmus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Europark for 7 nights. Check was efficient and friendly. We booked a basic double room and were impressed- we had an enormous king size and the room was very clean, spacious and well designed. We had the breakfast 2 days and thought the choice was impressive for the price, but chose to have breakfast at the cafe opposite the other days. The hotel is a little way out of the action which might be off putting for some but for us it was definately a bonus, it is in a quiet and very safe mostly residential area, but only a 10 minute walk from Passeig de Gracia and close to Girona metro station so easy to get to the harbour and beach. We also enjoyed the rooftop pool- it can get crowded as people come back from their days out, but it is still great to unwind and cool off. Overall I cannot recommend it highly enough, certainly deserving of more than 3*!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANAZELDA
Reviews.Content: 6 days in Barcelona with our 2 girls. Was meant to be wonderful but began like a nightmare. I booked through HOTEL.com and required 2 communicating rooms (one for us + one for the children) on the patio to be quiet. I would have never booked this hotel without these requests satisfied and HOTEL.com confirmed that they would meet my requirements. Arriving in the hotel on a saturday afternoon, we were delighted to hear that we had 2 separated rooms on the noisy avenue. HOTEL.COM did not communicate my requests. You try then to reach HOTEL.com customer service and it is a nightmare. 2 hours later, you still are on the phone transferred from a department to another and I would still be if EUROPARK HOTEL did not find a solution. Special thanks to Edgar. We had 2 close rooms for one night on the noisy avenue and then 2 communicating rooms on the patio. The hotel is very clean, very quiet (good soundproof), the swimming pool is indeed very small but it is so nice to be able to refresh after one day visiting. The reception is very helpful. We had a price with breakfast included and the breakfast is really good (fresh and diversified). It is much better if you ask for a room in the patio. The room is large and very comfortable. The air conditionning can be a little bit noisy like in many hotels : it was August, 32° in the day and at night we did not need it whereas it is difficult for me to put up with hot weather. As for the location, it is about 10 mn walk from PASSEIG DE GRACIA and same from SAGRADA FAMILIA with underground at 100m : the only restriction is the underground is not on a central line and you have to walk a lot in the underground to join the central line.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JoS74
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed at the Europark for a week and had an amazing time. We did stay in an upgraded room with a terrace so it was slightly bigger than a standard room but for the extra money it was well worth it in my view. The rooms were very comfortable and the pillows were so lovely i wanted to take them home! We both slept very well indeed. The one thing that i found very refreshing was that the items in the mini bar were only very slightly (pence) more expernsive than the supermarket so it was extremely good value and very handy! The room service food was also very nice as well. The location of the hotel is very good and in a lovely area. It does mean that you need to get familiar with the metro which is a very short walk away but this is extremely efficient and also good value. The supermarket is very close by aswell. Some people may prefer to be more central but i found it a real blessing to be at the Europark because the very centre of Barcelona is noisy and quite chaotic at times. I wouldn`t recommend the hotel for people with young children however but for anyone else it was very relaxing, friendly and could easily be regarded as a four star rather than three! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “End of Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: littlear
Reviews.Content: We give this hotel the highest compliments. The facilities, staff, and room were above first rate. The bathroom and amenities were sublime. The computers were easy to use, and there were enough for the guests. The knowledge of the staff for restaurants, La Rita, and Citrus (that is our favorite) was perfect. Directions/where to go, etc. was always perfect. It was our 40th anniversary trip, and the end of 2 weeks. We had been on a cruise for 10 days, and this was the most wonderful ending. The breakfast buffet was also generous with good food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - style, location, service and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: BKP-Sydney
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for Barcelona stay on the basis of other reviews and was not disappointed in any way. This relatively new hotel has style and a great location for the traveler who has only a few days to "do" the city. Had read of sullen front desk service but I have nothing but compliments. The concierge staff were professional, friendly and competent. Booked direct and was happy with the value received. Did follow a recommendation for our room not to face main street because of traffic (loud motorbikes in the night always - especially as it was World Cup time). Many key areas and attractions within reasonable walking distance. Again followed others who said get 10 trip metro passes if there a few days and the city sightseeing bus for two days gives a great overview of all of importance in the city, with time to pick your own priorities. Take time in the old quarter, tapas at Taller de Tapas in Comtal street and if you can locate an old church nearby in same, hidden inside a courtyard, street, it has occasional guitar concerts in a small chapel. The Carmen performance by Ksenia Axelroud and Joan Benejam was unforgettable. Lovely city and friendly population.

Reviews.Title: “Extravangt quallity hotel”
Reviews.Author: loek111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really amazing. It's perfectly situated, near metro and train station. You can even walk to the city center if you wish to. Banks and supermarkets are close by as well. The hotel is really neat! Very stylish. The rooms are big enough, clean, and modern. A nice bathroom. Downstairs there is a free Internet possibility. And the breakfast is tasty, enough choice. Did I already mention the swimming pool at the roof? Don't expect you can have a sporty day in pool, but it's great to relax after visiting the city, it's really stylish, you can use one of the beds or sofa's to enjoy your perfect holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in great location to metro and main streets without the noise”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetterz77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at EuroPark Hotel quite late at night and it was quite easy to find via the metro from the airport with one change at Passieg de Gracia to Girona on the yellow line and a short walk to Caller D'Arago. The rooms are a decent size for two people with modern features. Be sure to ask how to access the english tv channels if you need them as all are in Spanish or dubbed in Spanish. The only downside which didn't end up affecting us hugely was our room was behind the lift. The first night was fine as it was quite late by the time we went to bed but the 2nd night there seemed to be a bit more action and noise from slightly drunk revellers coming back. Other than that it was fine. Everyday we returned to nice airconditioned room and the staff were very helpful and a good bonus with free wi-fi all through the hotel. There's also a pool on the roof with lots of chairs to sunbake or sit in the shade - was quite busy while we were there and felt like we were in Ibiza with the house music that was playing! The cost of the room wasn't as inexpensive as we'd hoped but after looking for hotels in Barcelona and the amount of complaints regarding the noise in hotels on the Ramblas it was an easy choice. It's a little further out of the main streets but doesn't take much time at all to walk to the Passieg de Gracia or you've always got the option of the metro. Overall we had a very pleasant stay at EuroPark and highly recommend it. If you want fabulous Japanese just across the road is a restaurant called Nihon Sakari and it's the best Japanese I have had in a long time. The owner is a very attentive, welcoming sweet guy who understands english so no problems. There's also no real need to pay 13 euro for breakfast if your satisfied with a ham and cheese baguette and a decent coffee con leche (flat white/latte) which cost us about 4 euro each at the cafe next to the Japanese restaurant. I'd definitely advise the Barcelona card for travelling on the metro more for simplicity of moving on and off the metro as often as you like and even though it is pretty cheap to travel it would save you some cash. We got a 3 day pass for 33 euro and it got us anywhere and everywhere we wanted to be. The metro is also a fantastic way to get around and beats any public transport I'm used to in Sydney! Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “realy very good”
Reviews.Author: Jaggery
Reviews.Content: We read the revirws on this hotel and we very pleased with it. We chose the superior room overlooking the back of the hotel. OK the view is not very intresting, just the back of other flats and offices. But you get a balcony and..............absolutly no traffic noise. The room was large, king size bed, good cupboard space and modern fittings. The same went for the bathroom and everything was neat and clean. We chose to pay extra for the breakfast which was well worth it . Yes i know that you can go out for breakfast. But by the time you have left the hotel,walked down the street, found a table,got the menu ordered,waited.....waited got your food ,is it realy worth it when you can have a big buffet selection of hot and cold foods with fruit ,pasteries ,breads yogourts. This sort of breakfast sets you up for the rest of the day ,so go for it. The location of the hotel is within easy walking distance of the train station and it is v easy to catch the train from the airport . I would strongly recommend prebooking the Barcelona travel card online which you then pick up from the airport. It can be used on bus's ,trains,subways and gets discounts at various places. It just makes getting around so much quicker as once you have this ticket you do not have to work out paymets on any of the services that you use. For eating out try Teller Tapas on Rambla Catalunya www.tallerdetapas.com . Very good selection of food ,large portions ,good service, and it is about a 10 min walk from the hotel. So yes I highly recommend this hotel and would have been happy to have stayed longer than the 3 nights that we did as we did not have time to try the roof top pool and it was just a very cool and easy place to stay

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripswitht
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the staff was very helpful and spoke english. they provided us with a room in the back since our stay was for a few days and they didnt want us to hear the noise of the busy street infront of the hotel. Our room was perfect size infact I was expecting something smaller but we had lots of space. Internet access was a nice touch. Breakfast in the morning was great; plenty of variety and very fresh! Pool on the 8th floor seemed small at first but it was just right to cool off (very hot in July). My husband and I enjoy walking and this hotel was in the perfect location to walk to all the hotspots and tourist attractions. We reccommend this hotel and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Off2Vaca
Reviews.Content: We had been given an upgrade upon arrival and that was a fun and suprising start to our vacation. The room was on the 10th floor and had an amazing view of the city. Be sure to close your blinds/curtains as many of the housing across the street can see right in. The room was quite large and bathroom was very spacious. I found the bed to be a bit too hard for my taste but the pillows made up for it. The hotel is slightly out of the busy Las Ramblas path, but we found this to be a plus. There are a bunch of small restaurants/bars, gellato places, banks and mini-marts within a few blocks of the hotel. Easy walk to many of the attractions. The front desk provided us with a map (with the hotel address) that we found very helpful. Especially when we needed a cab back and a driver didn't know the hotel by name. Not sure if all rooms have, but in order to turn the lights on, we had to put our room card into a slot by the door. Had room service for dinner one evening and was quite prompt and very good. The brownie was amazing. The mini bar was also quite reasonable. Felt very safe however didn't venture out too much after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: dav-han
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel perfect for a city break in Barcelona. Good location which wasn't too long a walk to any of the main attractions of the city and very close to the Girona and Passieg de Gracia metro stops aswell. Rooms were tastefully decorated and spacious with all of the amenties that we needed; fridge, tv, ample storage and comfortable beds. The bathroom was modern and clean, it even had a switch which enabled the sound from the tv to be played in there, genious! Staff were friendly and helpful and our room was cleaned beautifully each day. The rooftop pool and terrace area were perfect for relaxing after a day of walking round a busy city. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “What a ripper”
Reviews.Author: Gazmol
Reviews.Content: The first leg of a three month trip to europe, this place was perfect. Helpful staff. A little bit away from the Ramblas and old city, but still an easy 10min walk to get there. Very clean and comfortable. Great having 3 computers with unlimited internet access. Great breakfast. Nice pool. It is a great little hotel, not pretentious, modern and easy. Ideal for business, but great for any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Europark”
Reviews.Author: Luisito2
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our seven night stay at this very clean and efficient hotel. We stayed in a Topview Room, which wasn't that large, but big enough with a small lovely terrace overlooking the courtyard. The location was perfect - close enough to the sights, but away from the hustle and bustle. The staff were very helpful - we especially liked Andrey. As others have mentioned, the small wading pool was perfect after long hot days walking throughout the city; the wifi and available computers were great and the breakfast was enough to get us going in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Onalin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior room for three nights, on the sixth floor facing the courtyard. Pros: - Beautiful design (I had been concerned that the black and white colour scheme as shown on the website would be a bit overbearing, but it was in fact lovely). Spacious room with a cute little terrace, also decent wardrobe space and writing desk. - Very clean, both when we arrived and throughout our stay - Absolutely MASSIVE and very comfortable bed! I think the technical term is 'ginormous'. And it was a proper king-sized bed, not two beds pushed together. - Very effective air con. - Very quiet room. We stayed in room 610, which has a bit of space between the door to the hallway and the bed. Maybe in other rooms you might hear noise from the hallway, but our room was very quiet: we slept like logs. - The blackout curtains were so effective that we actually had to open them a crack, as the total darkness was a bit disconcerting! But, if you want a great sleep on your holiday, Europark was perfect: cool, dark and quiet. - Lovely bathroom with large sink, lots of room for toilet bags etc, strong water pressure in the shower, and loads of amenities, which were replenished each day whether we used them or not. - The ROOFTOP POOL! Yes, it's small and shallow as other people have mentioned, but my god, what more do you want after a hot day wandering around Barca than to have a quick dip in a cool pool as the sun sets, and dry off on one of the outdoor couches, propped up by pillows? If you can't tell, I really LOVED the roof terrace and used it every day! - Free wi-fi, which helped with planning other parts of our stay. Cons (and they are few): - The location. Not bad in itself, but not really where the main action is. I did check the location when booking the hotel, but on my next trip to Barcelona I think I'd like to stay somewhere a bit closer, maybe in El Born. HOWEVER it was easy to get to from the airport (a short walk from Passeig de la Gracia stop, which is on the airport line), and there was a great little supermarket just up the road. - The room service menu was pretty poor. Looked like frozen/convenience food mostly. - There was one guy on reception who was just plain rude. I live in England, I am used to surly service, but he just seems to hate his job, people, and probably life in general. It's a shame because the rest of the staff were great, and we had a really wonderful stay, but the way you're greeted when you enter a hotel is very important. In all (apart from Mr Grumpy on reception), Europark is a great place to stay, and very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: bristol059
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Location was great, 5 minutes walk from main street with cafes and bars and 10 + minutes to Las Ramblas. Near metro and buses. Hotel was very clean, staff helpful, free internet access,air conditioning was great as it was very hot. We were on 8th floor just beside pool which although small was just what was needed after a day sightseeing, good to cool off. Supermarket and fruit market along the street from hotel so that you can buy bits and pieces and put in fridge. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A definite to come back to!”
Reviews.Author: whatdafuk
Reviews.Content: What a plesant surprise, a hotel selected online that went above expectations. Very clean, comfortable, and being a designer, was done with flair. Great bathroom. We did book a superior room with balcony and breakfast. That was a good choice as breakfasts in hotels are ridiculously expensive. We choose a room in the "courtyard" (that's a stretch) as we wanted quiet. We felt safe and comfotable in this convienient location, easy walk to many sites. The reception staff was great. Special thanks to Ellias and Sebastian, they were very helpful. yes i want to return there soon. BTW I can be critical and expect clean comfort and srvice. i was pleased! VJD Fort Lauderdale

Reviews.Title: “You'll Like This One”
Reviews.Author: janesak
Reviews.Content: EuroPark Hotel was a two night stay as part of a cruise package that we purchased. Expecting a lower class hotel, EuroPark proved to be anything but. The hotel was stylish, very clean, staff was friendly and could all speak English. Breakfast was excellent (the coffee was the best I had in my three week European stay) and there was free WiFi. Our room was on the first level and we had a huge deck off the room. The location is close to many sites and very close to the Metro. It would be the first place I would book when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and comfortable in good location”
Reviews.Author: Pagey54
Reviews.Content: Stopped 4 nights and found little fault. It is in a good and safe location for the the attractions, shopping, restuarants and transportation systems if required. A 10/15 minute safe walk to Place De Catalunya. As arrived late got a taxi from the airport which was an extortionate Euro 45 but the train from 4 blocks away at Passeig De Gracia going back was only a few euros each and very safe and easy even with a suitcase. Staff were okay, efficient, never rude, nor were we ever pressured by the cleaners. The rooms were a fair size and spotlessly clean and well stocked daily with toiletries including soap, toothbrush and paste, razor and foam, shampoo etc. Our room over looked courtyards at the back and was peaceful - the front faces out to a busy street. Breakfast was ample and pretty decent with fruit juice, fruit, breads, cooked, cold meat/cheeses, yoghurts and pastries if not a little over priced for what it was. WIFI is available and so is free use of some communal PCs in the lobby and bar area. If was to criticise only would say we never got the promised slippers and robes (although did not really need them), there is no coffee/tea making facilities although a reasonably stocked and priced minibar in a small fridge, and the mattress was not the most comfortable we have ever slept on. Worthy of the TA ranking.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JakaJani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and found it to be an ideal place to stay while we were in Barcelona. We had a TOP View room(904) which was spacious enough, very comfortable, great view at the hills...everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Close to many sites and very clean”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTravelerGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean. Our room was fairly large considering European rooms are generally small. We had twin beds, not as comfortable as we would have liked. The bathroom was also large. The decor was mostly black and white stripes, lots of glass and steel, and an odd shaped desk chair made of plastic. The major complaint is the internet connection, there was almost none. One day we had no service at all. They do have two computers in a common area and two more near the restaurant, but our personal computer connection was almost 0. The check in went fast, although the desk staff are not friendly at all. I don't think they ever smile. They certainly do not make you feel welcome. The ladies in the restaurant are great. They made wonderful food and were so nice and friendly. We did have breakfast here, and it was wonderful. A wide variety of foods hot and cold. The price per person was a little high at 13 euros. We might stay here again while in Barcelona, but we will check out some other hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: LindaLarini
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfortable beds, nice bathroom...more 4-star than 3-star

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: sarirosman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Europark Hotel for 3 or 4 days at the end of May. Because we asked for a quiet room in the back and they didn't have one they upgraded us to a room near the top with a bigger balcony. Everyone we met there was very pleasant. The room was clean. Enjoyed using wifi there in the room. Perfect location as we love to walk. Could easily walk to the Ramble or Familia Sagrida. I'm glad I found this hotel through tripadviser. I would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but service level under average.”
Reviews.Author: PeerNoir
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona, and we chose Europark based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and the fact that it was only €110/night. We stayed for 10 nights in a Superior Room on the 7th floor, with a cozy balcony facing the courtyard. Very quiet! I recommend you do not request a room facing the Aragó Street as it is quite noisy. As we checked in, we encountered the first example of poor service. The clerk hardly spoke any English, but that was not the problem. His attitude was like he didn't care, and rolled his eyes sarcastically when discovering we was to stay for 10 nights. In addition he took a long phone call in the middle of us checking in. He didn't tell us the check out time, or anything else of interest, rather than just handing us the key cards. We chose a non-smoking room, although we both smoke. Entering the room, we saw there was a clean ashtray on the balcony table. I rang the reception and asked politely if it was alright if we smoked on the balcony (it IS outside and it had obviously been used to that purpose before). The clerk answered "oh well, i guess you can" and sounded like he was doing us a BIG favour, which is funny, since it is the customers who pays his wages. Just to finish the negatives: No one in the reception ever smiles, the cleaners make a fair amount of noise in the morning, and don't EVER order room service...say no more. Over to the good stuff: The room: Spotless clean. It had a nice, fresh scent, and AC you could adjust to temperature. The room had everything one could ask for, even of 4-star hotels. Safe, hairdryer, bath amenities, bath robes, slippers, 32" TV, fridge with extra room for a couple of your own water bottles, etc. Only Spanish and Catalan channels, but TV is not important when you're in Barcelona in June! There is free wi-fi througout the hotel, but due to the iPhone's bad antenna, we could only get a signal in the bathroom half of our room. No biggie. The "pool": On the 8th floor, there is a sun deck and a small pool, brilliant for cooling off. It is no more than 80cm deep, but it's perfect for soothing a sunburned body. One can see from the pictures that this is what you get, so I don't get the one who complains about this. Location: To us, this was probably the best thing about the hotel. The neighbourhood is quiet and safe, but there are plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars around for your lunchtime meal and breakfasts. Being Gaudi fans, the hotel could not be situated better - right in the middle of Casa Batllo + La Pedrera and La Sagrada Familia. It's a 10 min walk to either of them. Las Ramblas is 15-20 mins, but if you take the Metro (Girona station is literally around the corner from the hotel) and exits at Urquinaona (2 stops), you can walk to the rambla/el raval/barrio gotico in 3 minutes. Brilliant. A couple of tips: Some reviewers have recommended La Rita. This was the worst place we ate in Barcelona! Greasy, cheesy food, pretend gourmet. Go for De Tapa Madre for tapas, Patagonia for steaks, Bar Lobo for breakfast and lunches, Carmelita for dinner and Zoo Bar for Mojitos!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Pro89
Reviews.Content: Booked via Expedia, and was excited about the number of sports facilities near the hotel. Unfortunately, when I reached Europark, I realised that pretty much none of the promised facilities were there, meaning no tennis courts, swimming pool, skating rink etc. We felt conned by Europark and Expedia, but negatives aside, this hotel was much better than its 3 star billing. The rooms were quite small, but everything about them were great, comfy beds, nice television and gorgeous bathroom. There were several negatives however: 1. The cleaning ladies are quite rude and will continually bother you in the morning until you leave for them to clean. During one morning they walked in my room without knocking three times whilst I was getting dressed. 2. The pool is about one metre in depth and is more of a paddling pool then one for swimming. 3. The location of the hotel is a bit of a trek from La Rambla, which meant getting back and forth via the metro became tedious very quickly. 4. The 'welcome gift on arrival' offered by Europark via websites, such as Expedia did not exist. Having said all this, if the hotel was cheaper, I'd be more than happy to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Punching above it's weight - and that's not a bad thing!”
Reviews.Author: mat_in_london
Reviews.Content: We stayed at EuroPark Hotel for a 3 night break in May. We booked the hotel based on the positive reviews we'd read and I am pleased to say they're not wrong. I thought the hotel was easily a 4 star, but was later told it's only a 3 star. Don't let that put you off though - this is better than some higher rated places I have stayed. The hotel is on Carrer d'Araga, which is quite central. It's almost halfway between the Sagrada Familia and Plaza Catalunya. The hotel has free wifi, a rooftop pool, 24hr room service and air con throughout. There is also a "business centre" (1 public access PC in the lobby, another 2 in the restaurant). We ate at the restaurant one night and the food was good and reasonably priced. A taxi from the airport to the hotel was €30 in mid morning, a taxi to the airport in the early afternoon was €20. There is a small supermarket called OpenCor just down the street selling everything from Xbox games to icecreams to toothpaste (come out of the hotel, turn right, walk about 2 blocks and it's opposite a church on the opposite side of the road from the hotel). We bought drinks and snacks from here and kept them in our in-room fridge. The surrounding area was safe and quiet. It is about a 10 min walk to Passeig de Gracia, which is one of the main shopping streets with lots of restaurants as well. Gaudi's "Dragon House" is there as well. Overall, this was a great hotel at a great price - recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: HL2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my fiance and was pleasantly surprised, the hotel was very chic and the room we stayed in was immaculate with a fantastic power shower in the bathroom. The rooftop pool looked lovely but as we visited in the freezing cold I didn't get the chance to try it. The hotel's location is really good, within walking distance to La Sagrada Famillia and is situated in the smart residential l'exemplia district. There are fabulous shops in the vicinity such as Valentino! As the hotel is just down the street from the nearest metro station it is an ideal base to explore Barcelona. The front desk were helpful in suggesting places to visit and providing directions and maps. We really enjoyed our stay here and cannot wait to return, the only negative that I could think of is that the hotel is quite pricy to eat in- (Though that said I ordered the most fabulous cake via room service!) However, there are plenty of nearby places to eat and drink in style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: VacationOslo
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room and the check in was efficient. Helpful staff. Nice room in chic design. Large bathroom with shower. I did not have breakfast at the hotel, but there are several nice cafe's serving breakfast nearby. The hotel is close to metro station Girone, (line 4) which takes you to Barceloneta (the beach) very fast. It's a 20 min walk to Placa Catalonia where the airport bus arrives/leaves. The hotel has a roof pool. The hotel has free wifi, and there is also a PC in the reception free to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for a Weekend Jaunt”
Reviews.Author: Jon5440
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in May 2010 and really enjoyed it. Very easy to get to from the airport (train to Gracia stop) and even closer to the Girona metro stop for easy transfer to everywhere in the city. Plus, a pleasant and easy walk to many of Gaudi's famous sites, as well as the top of Las Ramblas. The hotel desk staff were a bit indifferent, but with some prompting they did at least make a dinner reservation for us at a restauant of our choosing one night. Our room (702) was pretty large, comfortable, very clean, and looked out on an interesting (although quite noisy) street. If street noise bothers you, be sure to request a room facing the courtyard side. The bathroom was great and the power shower (no tub) was fantastic. There was even a flat screen tv with both a set of local and international stations. Although who has time for TV in Barcelona!! Also appreciated the fact there was one computer terminal off the lobby for guest use and it even had a printer, which was very handy. One evening we got some drinks at the bar and went up to the rooftop pool deck to enjoy the sunset and Barcelona's rooftops (you can't see anything noteworthy, but it was nice). We didn't try the small plunge pool, but it looked like it would be a good way to cool off as the hot summer approaches. We really appreciated being off the main tourist drags, and found the restaurants on the top side of Las Ramblas (above Plaza Catalunya) to be better. Also loved eating in the beachside restaurants in Puerto Olympico and in Barceloneta. Overall, a great long weekend destination and a good value from one of what appears to be a great small chain of Barcelona hotels. Would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem !”
Reviews.Author: bearsofpancakelane
Reviews.Content: What a breath of fresh air this hotel is. Rooms are so very clean, comfy and well decorated. The rooftop pool is a delight after a day of sightseeing. Its located close enough to walk but away from the hustle and bustle in a safe and smart area.The price of the food and drinks was very reasonable and as a result we spent money in the hotel, coffees, sandwiches etc which we might otherwise have gone elsewhere for as hotels are usually so overpriced!The most important quality were the staff, whoever is running this hotel is doing an excellent job, the staff went out of their way to be so very helpful, always with a smile and a with a can do attitiude. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: hobbelvorster
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. It was everything we hoped for and more. We booked superior rooms including breakfast. The rooms where beautiful, clean, modern and big. We where a group of 9 persons and booked 5 rooms, all rooms where good, but some were bigger than the other ones. I had a room on the back of the building with a balcony (with table and two chairs) and a large bathroom with a bath (room 408). Others had a room on the front of the hotel with a small balcony and more noise. Breakfast was good! Big variety of food: fruit, bread, scrambled egg, yoghurt, muffins, donuts, bacon, juices, etc. Only negative thing is that I had asked for adjoining rooms (booked already in oktober 2009) but we got spread all over the building. * swimming pool on the room is very small, but the seats are great! Nice place to relax for a bit *

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ilokid
Reviews.Content: For a 3-day visit to Barcelona, the Europark Hotel can not be bettered. Good location, personable and friendly staff, room and associated facilities made resting and sleeping a pleasure. In all, superb value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: alexanderphd
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days/nights at this hotel in May 2010. The more popular sights of Barcelona are within close distance, if you don't mind doing a little walking. We walked 10-15 miles per day, as Barcelona is such a walkable city. You can view my trip report at : http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g187497-i44-k3644929-Trip_Report_Just_Back_From_10_Days_in_Barcelona-Barcelona_Catalonia.html Anyhow, the staff at this hotel was friendly and accommodating and they spoke/understood basic English. Our room was streetside, but it is very noisy by day. Ask for an interior room. Avoid the second floor, however, as the restaurant is located there and I can imagine it can get noisy. There is a nice outdoor pool and sitting area. The pool isn't large enough to do actual swimming, unless you're a child. Even if the temperatures are a bit cool, it's nice to sit outside and enjoy a snack or glass of wine. The rooms are small, but I gather this is typical for Europe. The Internet is free and it worked well. The bed was comfortable and the shower was very roomy. There are several restaurants in the area, and the Gracia District to the north of the hotel is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ssuzie6
Reviews.Content: Fantstic hotel, very clean and friendly. Excellent breakfast. Only down point, we were on ground floor and could hear metro in morning, only very slight but I'm very light sleeper, so woken in morning which didn't bother me. Otherwise very quiet. Def recommend. Location good for city sites and excellent placed for BCN, Renef and Metro

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected delight”
Reviews.Author: JamesBond_Halifax
Reviews.Content: I first arrived at this hotel late at night and checked in. Had mixed opinions from the start and was unsure about the location and the staff was unfriendly. However, the next day brought a better opinion. Staff was very helpful and the location was very close and convenient to city center. It was a 20 minute walk to Olympic port and downtown but the walk was nice and great to get to see some of the city. Rooms were a little small but clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Reccomended. Good value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Vidar1
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. Modern design. Good location, 15 minutes walk to Placa Catalunya, close to the great Metro system in Barcelona. Did not eat their expencive breakfast, so can´t comment on that. Lots of good places nearby to eat good and less expensive breakfast. The staff seemed tired and uninterested in talking with us, but as we had no problems that was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected delight”
Reviews.Author: hippylou
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for 3 nights in Feb. I was a little apprehensive when booking but was extremely pleased on arrival. The hotel appears to have been very recently renovated and was therefore very clean and modern. The rooms were spacious, modern and cleaned thoroughly every day. The location is good, around a 15min walk to the ramblas. The hotel is on a busy road but this didnt seem to keep us awake at night, very quiet. I imagine Europark would be great in the summer as the roof top pool is beautiful (but freezing in feb as by partner found out - would not recommend doing that!) Breakfast was good, a good selection, however the bar staff are fairly slow but get to you eventually. I would not recommend eating in the restaurant outside of breakfast time however as the food was fairly unimpressive. All in all a great hotel for a city break!

Reviews.Title: “Serious secutiry issues!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerMay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a major let down for my fiance and I during our recent trip to Barcelona. It's average location, lacking housekeeping service (is it really that hard to knock before you enter someones room??) and noisy rooms were nothing compared to the unbelievable lack of assistance or concern when my Fiance lost his wallet, out of his back pocket, in the hotel breakfast restaurant!!! You understand that pick pocketing is riff in the busy squares and streets of the city but you do hope for some refuge in your hotel. If you are thinking of staying here, don't do it. The Gallery Hotel looked nice which was close by, I would try that.....

Reviews.Title: “really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: citygirl035
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found it to be an ideal place to stay while we were in Barcelona. Loved the room decor, bathroom was a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. We were on the street side of the hotel and found it to be very quiet too. The hotel offers a good buffet breakfast and free access to the internet. We found staff to be friendly, especially the housekeepers, although front desk staff could be a little aloof. The hotel is in the Eixample neighborhood and a nice walk to several nearby Gaudi buildings - Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera and the Casa Battlo. I liked that we were outside the central tourist area. The only downside is that you'll need to search a bit if you want to find a place to eat at night that is closer than Passeig de Gracia (more options surround you during the day). However, one of our favorite nearby restaurants was Bar Mut and is off the nearby Avenue Diagonal. Regardless, it is easy enough to get to different parts of the city - you can follow Passeig de Gracia down to the Barri Gotic, or walk over to the Ramblas, etc - and the Metro is also close. I'm really pleased we found this hotel and would easily stay again if we're ever back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel a little off the city center”
Reviews.Author: JoannaHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Europark for five nights in April. I booked the hotel after going through dozens of hotels at TripAdvisor and was very pleased with it. We had a superior double room which was spacious enough but not huge, and very comfortable. Our room faced the inner courtyard and was very qiuet - although you could hear some noise from the adjacent room and hallway. The hotel is quite recently renovated so the rooms are in good shape. I'm not a big fan of black-and-white interiors but here it didn't feel cold at all, probably because the white was off-white. The room was perfectly cleaned every day. Breakfast was decent but not great - although the Spanish don't seem to be much of a breakfast people in general. Location was good, near Sagrada Famiglia, but a bit far from the center after walking the whole day. There's a subway station within 100 m which was great, although the line didn't take you to Plaza Catalunya. Near the subway there's also a big supermarket where you could buy some wine and snacks and of course anything else. The small sun deck at the roof was a nice extra - it gave great views to the surrounding hills. Cava in minibar was decently priced (3 euros for a small bottle). + all-in-all a good hotel where just about everything works + good breakfast in Spanish standards + comfortable beds + black-out curtains were awesome + quiet + good service + good location + subway station near + lots of restaurants nearby + sundeck on the roof - low water pressure in the shower - no view from our room (3rd floor) - if you get a room on floors 8 to 10 facing the courtyard, you'll get a great view at the hills - the "balcony" is just a narrow strip outside the room - nearest subway line doesn't go to Plaza Catalunya - you could hear some noise from other rooms and hallway

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the perfect break”
Reviews.Author: bowie59
Reviews.Content: Having spent four nights in the Europark Hotel I can definitely recommend it. The decor of the hotel is modern and stylish. The rooms are very comfortable with everything you need, including beautiful spacious bathroom, flat screen tv, and beds which are extremely comfortable. Breakfast was more than sufficient with lots of dishes to choose from, both hot and cold. There are computers for guests use also which is very handy. This hotel is not in the centre of Barcelona as such but this is no bad thing as the Ramblas area is very crowded and busy and we were glad to return to the Europark for some peace and quiet. There is a metro station close by but we walked into the centre it takes about 15 to 20 minutes. There are some nice restaurants within walking distance of the hotel which the reception staff can direct you to. To summarise, I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone travelling to Barcelona and I would stay there again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Europark was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TooDutch
Reviews.Content: We were incredibly exhausted from our trip to Barcelona but the hotel staff made us feel welcome right away. We got a free upgrade to a superior room. The beds were apart and I dont like sleeping on seperate beds, so the friendly spanish staff fixed the problem by putting a kingsize sheet over the two beds. I had a horrible backpain and I called for a massage, that was absolutely great. The hotel is clean, pretty and in a great location. The rooms are kinda small, but we could live with that. Definitely a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Europark Barcelona was great for our 3 nights stay!”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights break and it was great. We would recommend this hotel for a short break to explore the city and we can confidently say that 3 days is just right to see everything. Very modern and great service. Romms a little on the small size but that´s what you get in the city.We chose this hotel mainly due its location and we were not disappointed. We were both happy with the choice and we recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfortable and efficient - and good value”
Reviews.Author: happytripperDorset
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here late March. Smart and comfortable rooms and public areas, good breakfasts and helpful and friendly staff. A little out from the main city centre - in the business district - but convenient for tour and other buses. good value for money. Slight downside is that the traffic on the road outside is noisy until late into the night - enen from eight floors up. Next time I'd ask for a rear room. Bus Touristic strongly recommended. travelled via Girona airport. Be aware that getting on to the airport bus can be a real 'bunfight' - allow for the possibility of not getting on a couple!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, great service, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: AsherKaye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights with my uncle during a vacation. The rooms were extremely comfortable and homely, and the people behind the desk were quite nice and helpful. I would recommend this to anyone staying in the Barcelona area, as the location is right downtown, although a half hour to forty minute walk from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ru553
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days in March 2010 and can say that all the positive reviews are justified. The room was immaculately clean and the staff were polite and friendly. This is definately a good four star hotel. If you are travelling from the airport there is a good tube system, which will take you to about 100 yard of the hotel. I took a taxi and it cost me 40 Euros one way so beware. Take a tube to Girona station (yellow line) there are a few ways to get there making one change but the whole journey should take about 20 minutes. My only slight niggles were that the room had a fire detector with flashing leds, which can be a little annoying if you have an early night and also although my room was nice and quiet, I couldn't get onto the free Wifi because of a weak signal. The hotel is in a good location for seeing the sights of Barcelona and is only a short walk to the tube station from where you can access most of the city. You can get a tube pass for a few days so that you can jump on and off at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: randybarlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March. Cleanest hotel I think I ever stayed at and I travel worldwide. Very modern decor. Good location to get to most interesting sights and restaurants in Barcelona. I asked in advance for chilled Champagne for my wife's birthday and it was delivered without any problems. Would recommend this hotel for either leisure or business. Free WiFi throughout the hotel was a big plus as well. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super Dooper”
Reviews.Author: kingoftherodeo
Reviews.Content: Although I scoured TripAdvisor for weeks prior to our trip, this hotel was recommended to me by a friend. It was such an overwhelming process trying to find the right hotel... so many options. Are the pictures deceiving? Are the other reviews accurate? Is it the right location? Is the staff helpful? I found myself becoming way too stressed out and staying up way too late trying to get it right. Eventually I just decided to book the Hotel Europark. My fiancee and I arrived in Barcelona at 9:00AM after an 8 hour flight out of NY. We jumped into a cab and headed straight over to the hotel. The hotel staff let us check in right away at around 10:30AM... this was awfully nice of them being that the normal check-in time is 3:00PM. We headed upstairs and crossed our fingers before opening the door to our room. We were so relieved when we walked in. A big room, a big bathroom, a balcony, and best of all it was CLEAN. Looked just like the photos. The hotel was only a block or so away from the metro station (Girona), which will pretty much take you anywhere in the city and La Rambla is only about a 10-15 minute walk on foot. The hotel neighborhood was very quiet at night and we always felt very safe. The staff was always nice and very helpful. Loved, Loved, Loved Hotel Europark. I would recommend this hotel to everyone... even my grandparents :)

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in fantastic location - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ct_roy_nyc
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a long weekend in March and we stayed in Hotel Europark for 3 nights. The rooms are a reasonable size - the double bed was absolutely massive (both width and height) which was a very pleasant surprise because we like our space :) We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. As it was March we weren't able to enjoy the roof top pool and veranda but I could imagine this being really pleasant in summer :) The location is perfect for those who enjoy to walk around cities they visit. The walk to La Ramblas for example is about 10-15 mins through the nicest Barcelona neighbourhood - and only 5 mins from a few metro stations if you don't want to walk - but in my view - Barcelona is a great walking city if you stay in Hotel Europark. Overall we found the hotel to be excellent value and would definitely stay there again next time we visit Barcelona. p.s. We also found Barcelona to be incredibly tourist friendly and didn't experience issues with pickpockets that you hear so much about the city. Just take the usual sensible precautions and you'll have a really great time!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europark review”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Red_Devil
Reviews.Content: On arrival we found the receptionist to be a bit frosty. We were allocated room 407. There wasn't much of a view, actually just a wall, but it was in a quieter location round the back of the hotel which was nice. The blackout curtains were a good idea and helped you sleep in, although you do get the odd shudder from the Metro every now and again, but not to the point where it keeps you awake. The bedroom was of a fair size and very clean and modern. We ordered room service once and found it to be very poor and overpriced, with a small choice of food. There is a mini bar that is re-stocked every day, but keep an eye on how much you spend as it's not cheap and there is a little shop just round the corner from the hotel which sells the same things at half the price, snacks, water, beer etc. The hotel had a pool on the top floor, which we ventured up to look at, it looked quite nice but was very small. There is a bar in the hotel. When we were there it was dead and there was no one in it, we gave it a go though and found it was reasonable. We enjoyed the location, as it was away from the centre and Las Ramblas but easy enough to get to on the nearby Metro.

Reviews.Title: “How can you make rooms so small”
Reviews.Author: ribbonman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decorated in a very ideosyncratic style, quite charming and elegant in a overstated way. It is a little out of the mainstream, perhaps 10 blocks to Plaza Catalunya through an area deserted after 8.00pm. The service is excellent if a little chilly. The only irritating feature is the room size..how can one make rooms that are so small as to be impractical for anything but sleeping prone alone. Excellent bathrooms however!

Reviews.Title: “Cool decor and really clean”
Reviews.Author: the irish view
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and were really happy with our choice. Location is very good...really close to Girona metro station and fairly close to Passeig de Gracia station. The area is quiet and felt safe. Of course there are many hotels in more central, touristy areas but if you want a good night's sleep sometimes those areas are not the best. Loved the decor in the rooms...it felt luxurious and was not what one would expect in a 3-star hotel. The quality of the decor was excellent too...heavy doors, good quality tiles etc. The cleaning staff do a brilliant job here. Our room was not just clean, it was spotless. Good selection of toiletries supplied. I should mention the fact that a disposable razor and shaving foam is supplied as part of the pack. Since the introduction of the regulations for liquids etc. in carry-on luggage, my husband has found it to be a nuisance having to go shopping for razors and shaving foam while on a mini-break.....so well done to whoever thought of this issue in the Europark.
