We slept well each night...our room faced the inner courtyard so we did not hear any traffic noise. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Breakfast was above average for a hotel of this standard....not amazing but certainly caters for all tastes. Something to note if you are considering this hotel is that the bar closes at 10.30 pm. This did not bother us as we like to stay out for the evening and just return to our hotel to sleep but if you like having a night-cap in the bar before bed you would need to gat back to the hotel quite early. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would stay there ourselves if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: andyb949
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the EuroPark Hotel based on the excellent reviews at TripAdvisor, and wasn't disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, just a five minute walk from Passeig de Gracia and the city's main shopping street, with La Ramblas and the Sagrada Familia also both within walking distance, although there are metro stations very near if you prefer. Despite being on a main road itself, the hotel's location was quiet, and the whole area very safe. It's a 3-star hotel, and the facilities matched that: there was free wi-fi and some nice toiletries but little in the way of extras. I would have liked coffee making facilities in my room. My twin room was large enough, although as a side room the view from my window was of the wall of the building next door. It did ensure it was quiet at least! Service was fine throughout my stay. The hotel had a reasonable selection of meals, and mostly well priced, although you will need a big appetite to get your money's-worth from an expensive breakfast. Overall I would say this hotel offers one of the better 3-star experiences. It's very good value and in a really handy location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickJK
Reviews.Content: Our plan had been to spend just a single night at the Europark prior to boarding a cruise. Unfortunately due to illness we were unable to embark the ship and ended up needing to book in for a further 3 nights. Staff were incredibly helpful and when we arrived back from our abortive trip to the Port they readily agreed to give us the same rate we had booked several months back on the internet. Rooms are very comfortable and modern and I would say that comments other reviewers have been made regarding road noise are valid and the need to take heed will depend on whether you are a light sleeper. On our first night we had asked for a quiet room which was exactly what we got - Room 611 at the back of the hotel. On our return we were in Room 104 on the side of the hotel and noise level was noticeably higher but did not keep us awake. Staff are very helpful and everything we needed at reception was readily accomodated with good English spoken. Away from the front desk the staff command of English is less, but you just need to show a little patience in making your needs understood. Small bar is very competitively priced but would benefit from a few more settee type seats and a later closing time than 22.30 but these are very minor points overall. We ate breakfast on the first morning at the inclusive rate and this was very enjoyable and more than enough to set one up for the day. On the other days we ate, as have others, at a little cafe just a couple of doors along the road. This works out cheaper, around 6/7 euros per head if you want a light breakfast but the hotel is competitive if you want a full meal, mindful that hot and cold food, fresh orange juice and coffee etc. are all available for you to help yourself to as much as you want. Location is excellent with cafes. restaurants and a large indoor market very close by. It is a two minute walk to Girona metro station on Line 4 and a 10 minute walk (5 blocks) will take you to Passage de Gracia on Line 3 where you can also pick up the train to the airport. Surprisingly one or two travellers have commented on the distance to the beach...this is not an obvious choice of beach hotel! However the metro will take you there, and the many seafood restaurants, in no more than 10 minutes. Line 4 from Girona and get off at either Barcolenetta or Citadella Villa Olympica. Finally, a number of people have mentioned the nearby Restaurant Rita which also has a number of separate reviews (mixed) elsewhere on Trip Advisor. Our own experience was that although the least expensive restaurant in which we ate the menu choices were a bit hit and miss and would not feel able to give this a strong recommendation. In summary Hotel Europark is an excellent choice in a safe and convenient location and we would stay there again with absolutely no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: vonspark
Reviews.Content: Nice room, clean, very friendly and helpfull staff, friendly area (we had heard about crime in Barcelona, but in this area we felt completely safe), walking distance to the most we wanted to do and see. A bit noisy because of the road outside our window, but other than that it was perfect. The breakfast at the hotel was very good too. All in all it is definitely a place we'll stay if we visit Barcelona agian!

Reviews.Title: “Very highly recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sws82
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights and felt more comfortable than I ever have in a hotel. The hotel appears to be pretty recently built as everything is next to new, and absolutely spotless! The staff were very friendly, most of them spoke very good english. The area it's in is quiet but at the same time it's on a main road and only 10 mins walk to the city centre or 2 min to the nearest metro station ( girona). I heard alot of things about crime and pick pockets but we didn't witness any or expect to. We felt very safe. Overall thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a posh part of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ShepsterLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, rooms were clean and recently decorated, our room faced away from the main road and was very quiet. The staff were pleasant and very helpful when the hairdryer broke in our room, they rushed up a spare in five minutes and were very apologetic. We did not have the breakfast so are unable to comment, just wish it had been warm enough to use the roof top pool as it was a very pretty (if small) area. The hotel is located in the l'exiample neighborhood which is really easy to navigate and is well linked to the rest of the city with public transport near the hotel location. The Sagrada Família is a ten minute walk away and there is a indoor market a few doors down which is great to get olives, fresh bread, wine etc.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located excellent hotel, just a bit noisy (maybe just our room)”
Reviews.Author: chies1
Reviews.Content: First I will explain why I rate this hotel "excellent". My wife and I took a bus from Toulouse which ended up arriving Barcelona at 5AM. So we got to the hotel at 530AM. That's like 8 hours earlier than the normal check-in time. However Europark gave us a room right away without any charge so we can get some sleep. This is what I call excellent service. Other than that, we like the hotel's location. it's a just a 3-4 mins walk from the metro, and from there you can easily go to anywhere. I like the hotel decoration and everything is very well design. My only complain is the noise, which might be a problem only to us. Our room is uniquely located on the first floor right next to the kitchen, and i can hear all the noise and the talking from there. Also our room has a door to the next room--those that are normally locked. From that door we again can hear everything next door from our bed. Taking shower, blow drying hair, everything. I have a feeling that maybe our neighbor opened the door at his/her side. However, I will not go ahead and say this hotel is noisy. Maybe they have to give us a room that they usually try not to give their customer since we arrive at 6 in the morning. And for us, since we were able to get some good sleep in the morning instead of hanging around at the street for hours (things in barcelona opens at around 10), what we gain offset the shortcoming of the hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Picalili84
Reviews.Content: We were really chuffed with this hotel. Amazing decor and really spacious rooms. Lovely little rooftop pool. When we arrived at the hotel there was a slight discrepancy between the type of room we had requested, and what we had been allocated (we'd requested a non-smoking double, but were given a smoking twin - on booking the hotel it did state that requests could not always be guaranteed). However, the lovely staff were very accomodating and immediately allocated another room. I'm a bit of a clean freak, but this hotel was spotlessly clean. All fixtures and fittings were in excellent condition. The location was great, a little bit of a walk to the beach (about 30 mins) but what you gain in having a quiet nights sleep from less traffic noise, you lose in physical distance. We would defnitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona, and without doubt would stay in this hotel again! Definitely a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Made our weekend”
Reviews.Author: wildcrewe
Reviews.Content: What can i say that hasn't already been mentioned. The hospitality is amazing, the staff members are extremely helpful, polite, friendly and professional with great service at all times. Perfect location idealy situated for a central base. We booked for breakfast & couldn't fault it english or continental. Nothing was to much trouble for any of the staff. Spotlessly clean, never slept in a bed so big & the decor was excellent. Would love to return when slighly warmer to give the swimming pool a go.

Reviews.Title: “a high standard hotel in every aspect that makes you feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: DemiC
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Europark Hotel and absolutely loved it. The hospitality is amazing, the staff members are extremely helpful, polite, friendly and professional with great service at all times. Our room was amazing, very modern, spacious and comfortable. The hotel was always very clean and tidy, our stay was including breakfast which was of great standard as well. The location of the hotel was perfect, very close to Catalunya and La Ramblas (within walking distance) and at the same time you could also enjoy peace and quiet. The hotel was definately value for money in every way, it was actually very good value for the price we paid. We loved everything about Europark hotel and especially the staff members, they were so friendly, helpful, polite, professional and they made us feel like we were right at home. My friend and I are actually planning on visiting Barcelona again and we'll definately be staying at Europark Hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!! 10 out of 10!!”
Reviews.Author: HOLABALU
Reviews.Content: Could not believe how nice this hotel was, considering the price we paid (not very much). It's very modern, spotless, in a great location, and the staff are polite, friendly and professional. We emailed the hotel and requested a quiet room in the hotel, we were on the 6th floor, at the back of the hotel, very peaceful. The front of the hotel overlooks a road that's busy with traffic, not so much people walking by. We got the train from the airport, and got off at 'Passeig de Gracia', it cost us around THREE euros each!! When you come up the steps, go back on yourself and take your first right. Burberry is on the corner of the road you need to walk down. Stay on that road, and the hotel is on the left, about 5-7 min walk away. If you want to get off a the station nearest to the hotel - 'Girona', be warned that you will have two changes to make with the trains, so it's more hassle! If you decide to get a transfer from the airport, it will cost you around £25-30 at the very least. A cab will be more. The 'only' downside, was that our room wasn't ready when we arrived around 12pm. I'm unsure as to the usual check in times, but our flight was very early in the morning, and we wanted to just relax for half and hour or so. Having said that, they allowed us to leave our luggage in a room, and we just went on a little walk to pass the time. When i return to Barcelona, without a doubt, i would stay in this hotel again. It's fantastic value for money, and most definately deserves higher stars!! We loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, fashionable hotel, great service, well situated, great value,”
Reviews.Author: mmorg767
Reviews.Content: Well situated. Subway only a block away. About 4 block walk to Block of Discord. About 15 minute walk to Sagranda Familia. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Room was very comfortable. Easy access to the internet. Staff was very polite and helpful. Great value. Would definitely stay here again if returned to Barcelona. Suggest Restaurant Rita, only few blocks away, for fixed price dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, absoultely made our holiday”
Reviews.Author: kay181
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europark was fantastic. Location was excellent. Was out of the way enough to be in a safe comfortable area, but near enough to metro and some sights to not feel out of the way. Rooms are a good size, v clean and very stylish. Mini bar is reasonably priced and bathroom is lovely with large shower. Unfortunatly on our stay my partner got food poisoning, (from east mids airport, not spain!) I was left alone for the whole first day and the hotel was welcoming and comfortable enough for me to drink and eat on my own. The bar was v well priced, 2 euro for a white wine! Food was nice and the internet was free so I could complain to friends back home about our luck! Breakfast was nice, lots of choice and good coffee. Room was at the front of the hotel and I could hear the traffic but it didnt keep me awake at all. If you're a light sleeper request a room at the back, however I always thought I was a light sleeper and I had no problems at all! I fyou do stay here there is a lovely bar called Amsterdam two mins down the road, same side, looks a bit shbby from outside but is lovely inside, well priced and quirkey decor. Further down is a restaurant called La Rita, absolutely beautiful food, packed with locals, good sign! We both had starters mains and a caraffe of sangria, came to only 40 euro! Lots of nice places near hotel, definatley worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice contemporary hotel near many attractions”
Reviews.Author: chappyOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with easy access to the city's many attractions. Walking distance to several of the plazas with a nice grocery store 1 block away. Metro (subway) access close by to get to the beach or other attractions. Great city with lots to see. Staff very nice and helpful and always had someone at the front desk who spoke english. Clean comfortable room, great bathroom, nice rooftop pool. Did not try the restaurant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Chrisg1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early December and really pleased with our choice. Had read the previous advice and asked to be allocated a room round the back rather than overlooking the busy main road. Were given room 607 which met our needs in every way. The beds were great (if perhaps a little hard for some). Perhaps the room was a little smaller than average but we only used it for short late afternoon rests and for sleeping so it was certainly adequate for our needs. TV choice is limited if you are English speaking but again I didn’t come to Barcelona to watch TV. It has been mentioned that the check in staff are not very cheerful. They certainly don’t go overboard with the welcome but frankly I do get a little fed up with the “gushing” corporate welcomes and fixed smiles you get from many hotels these days especially when you are tired form travelling for a long time. They were efficient and polite and booked us in without fuss letting us check in early. That’s really all I ask. They also arrived within 3 minutes to reset my room safe when I had managed to mess it up so they were all right by me. The breakfast (included in our rate) was very good really and set us up well for the days site seeing. Whether I’d pay the daily rate for it is questionable with so many decent little cafes in the area and a great market just up the road. The hotel is a good 15 minutes walk form Catelunya which suited us just fine. All in all I would be more than happy to return as I reckon this hotel provided good value for money. Would recommend the restaurant Rita just up the road for a fun pretty good value meal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Seira14
Reviews.Content: Not surprised why it is among the 10 best hotels in BCN..Lived up to my expectations, Perfect location, rooms, staffs, service, more perfect than a 3star...Absolutely loved our stay at this Hotel..The room was spotless clean when we checked in and even when we returned back to the hotel during our 3night stays..Internet & Satellite Tv is free of charge. I didnt have breakfast at the Hotel so cant comment..The Girona Metro station is located within 3 mins of walking distance which was very convenient, would recommend to take the T10 Tickets if u wanna go around. The sightseeing is definitely recommended.. I preferred restaurants in Passeig de Gracia than in La Rambla, which had better service and even the breakfast was very cheap and good. U can get really good breakfast for 2 person for less than 12euro,in some places in Passeig de Gracia..Loved the Tapas and adored the Seafood.. Would not hesitate to stay again in Europark, its Value for Money, loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaniAlawadhi
Reviews.Content: everyting about the hotel was great, the staff were friendly, the location of the hotel is great just 2 min walking from Girona Metro station which is very important in Barcelona. Internet is free in the rooms plus a pc is available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: cep19
Reviews.Content: Just had a night at the hotel based on what I read here. Contemporary decor great and we were luckily upgraded to a superior room. Requested a quiet room and thankfully were at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard - not 'a view' to write home about though. Could still hear the traffic but had come prepared with earplugs, very glad we weren't in a room at the front being a light sleeper. Even though our room wasn't next to the lifts, you could still hear them going up and down which may annoy some guests. Also, loads of guests were hanging out of windows into a small featureless inner atrium smoking so quite a bit of noise from that. Location good as only a few blocks to Passeig de Gracia etc and felt safe walking around the area. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, quiet, professional; our oasis.”
Reviews.Author: bighassle
Reviews.Content: EuroPark was a last-minute contender when my friend and I were looking at hotels, and I'm really glad we went with it. I had read a number of reviews that said Barcelona was loud, so we asked for a quiet room in back. While we did not have a view (and were fine with this, since there is a roof deck), the room (and especially the blackout curtains) allowed for quiet and much-needed sleep. We only heard any noise at all once the weekend hit, and that was minimal. The hotel is in a fairly upscale part of the Eixample neighborhood, just a few blocks away from being in a heavily commercial area, so it was semi-residential as well with pretty, quiet blocks that were fun to explore. The EuroPark was about a 15-minute walk from everything we wanted to do, including Barcelona's most famous Gaudi attraction, the Sagrada Familia, in one direction and the Gothic Quarter in another. There is also a Metro station (the Girona stop) a block or two away. Food-wise, there is a nice supermarket on the next block and a good little place practically downstairs with sidewalk tables where we grabbed cheap breakfasts and coffee in the mornings. The hotel staff recommended great nearby restaurants whenever we asked, including La Rita down the street, which we ate at twice. I would not go with the hotel's food, however, unless you are really lazy. We took a look at their restaurant's offerings one morning and it was not worth the money. We did order room service once (a moment of laziness) and it was terrible, but thankfully cheap. I don't stay at hotels for the food though. The room itself was on the small side but modern and clean (everything about the EuroPark feels very new) with ample closet/drawer space for two people, plus a mini-bar and in-room safe. We loved the bathroom, especially the shower. If you ask for two beds, you will get two small beds pushed together, which we were fine with (see my photos). The rooftop deck is very nice but with fairly limited views, though we enjoyed a few uncrowded sunsets up there. There is a pool, but it's very small and not really for swimming, just to sit in and cool off. Also, there are three computers in the hotel (one in the lobby, two in the 1st floor restaurant) to use the Internet. Television options are limited/dull -- I didn't see any way to order movies, for instance. Finally, the hotel staff was very helpful and professional, though perhaps a bit cold. Housekeeping never intruded and always left the room perfect. Overall, this hotel became "our oasis," as my friend called it a few times after long nights out. I suppose some would find the EuroPark bland or boring, and I do admit it did not give us much of a sense of Barcelona/Spanish flavor. But a clean, quiet place to sleep always trumps flavor in my book.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,good value for money”
Reviews.Author: biaantonini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Europark for 6 nights in November. The room at the backyard was very quiet,a bit small but nice.The free WI-FI was ok, but there was no clock nor coffee making facilities in the room. The staff on the front desk on the day we arrived ,after a 15 hours flight ,could certanly have been more polite and helpful.Breakfast was good, exception for the fruits. After reading the other reviews I would have expected more,but anyway it was a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: GeirJ
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a weekend. Staff was very helpful. Very good, and high room standard. The hotel had a location near too everything.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in the centre of bustling Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: NimesViki
Reviews.Content: Very suprised at the high quality of this hotel for the price I paid. Beautifully decorated in black and white with bedrooms, (I was given a small suite), in the same style. Unusual gifts of sponge, shampoos, combs, razor, you name it, presented in an individual box every single day, Details such as this plus the enormous fluffy cotton towelling bathrobe really make the difference. Restaurant very good also and the breakfasts were copious but slightly expensive at euros 14 but you certainly don't need a lunch afterwards! Staff bi and tri-lingual and very efficient and courteous. Centrally placed for either visiting places to the east or the west on leaving the hotel. Parking also with reduced rates for hotel guests - quite important and worth having.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent centrally-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: SANTravelers
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in Barcelona. It’s a few blocks walking to Passeig de Gracia and a little further to Las Ramblas, with their shops and great architecture and in the other direction a bit further walk to Gaudi’s Sagrada Familia Church. We came here after Florence and Lisbon where we stayed at good hotels (see our reviews of the Hotel River in Florence and the Marques de Pombal in Lisbon on TripAdvisor) but in some ways this was the best. The place is immaculate, has very modern deigned rooms and bathrooms, free wifi throughout the hotel (WHY are U.S. hotels so greedy with their overpriced wifi connections!!!!), as well as several free use computers at various spots in the hotel, and the usual standard European free breakfast with ham, cheese, yoghurt (most European hotels should be able to do better than with the omnipresent Nestle’s yoghurt’s though), cereal, eggs, good pastries, etc. The first room they gave us was very nice and with a balcony but right on the noisy street. We asked to change rooms and they put us at the back of the same floor and it was quiet as can be, even though no view except the backs of other buildings with laundry hanging over their balconies (we MUCH preferred the quiet, laundry and all, to the noisy street room). The rooms have adequate lighting, lots of sockets (scarce in many hotels around the world), a nice desk and large-screen tv, safe, open closets and shelves, refrigerator, safe. The reception staff, although not warm and friendly, was otherwise very responsive. And when we told them we were leaving early in the morning of our check-out day before regular breakfast time, they had a very nice "picnic" package for us to take on the plane with us. All in all the hotel was just about perfect with only two minor flaws: they don’t sell stamps for your postcards, nor did the reception desk staff offer to post the cards for us and put the postage on the bill; the other is if you like to cuddle your partner it’s harder on their beds because there are no queen beds, just two singles pushed together. Otherwise, great hotel and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail makes this a Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg080
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Quiet, friendly staff, rooms clean and modern. Great attention to detail makes all the difference, air-conditioning quiet and efficient, excellent location (not too close to tourist areas but close enough to walk or hop on the subway - 2 stops and you're in the thick of things). Room service prices reasonable (relative to prices you'll pay on the street). I've travelled extensively and stayed in some very good hotels - and would put Hotel Europark up there with the good ones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: amcan42
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, my wife and I were highly pleased with this hotel. Our room was somewhat small but comfortable, and the bathroom was large and updated. The room was very quiet - we didn't hear neighbours or traffic noise. The wi-fi worked well. The staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel is in a rather bland streetscape but is a five minute walk from a grand boulevard with a cluster of late 19th-century art nouveau buildings. And you can walk to the Placa de Catalyuna in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault”
Reviews.Author: BishopSuzywong
Reviews.Content: had 3 nights with friends at hotel. lovely and clean. room was well equipped hairdrier minibar and lovely bathroom. we had room at back of hotel with balcony. reception staff very helpful and friendly. could not comment on breakfast as we went round corner thought breakfast in hotel was expensive. lovely city we will go again. hotel is about 15min walk from la rambla. recommend open top bus if you have not been before. some drinks are expensive but food wasnt too bad and weather was good.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean well-kept hotel near many shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: jholelover
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel and we are very picky. The rooms were very clean and stylish, if a bit small. The balcony was great on the ninth floor. One floor down was a small pool and sunning area. The breakfast, included in our room price, was very good. The staff was very helpful in recommending sites to visit, and very polite and courteous, professional. I would highly recommend staying here. I loved barcelona and with my camera and web design skills put together a website of my stay at http://barcelonafunguide.com

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: TheWelsh
Reviews.Content: Found this as per the Trip Advisor reviews. Clean, efficient and convenient. Our room was on the 5th floor and overlooking the main street (Arago) - we were surprised at the level of street noise but after some tapas and red wine it wasn't a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Europark”
Reviews.Author: luv2globetrot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and found it to be a very comfortable, convenient place to stay. The room had free, fast wi-fi which is a high priority for us. (Not just in the lobby). The staff spoke English and was helpful with requests we had. They looked up the train schedule to Girona for us and they even placed a local phone call for us to find out some information we needed. The room was spacious with a king sized, fairly comfortable bed. I do wish they had a chest of drawers for unpacking. There were only 2 small drawers and some shelves and a hanging area for clothes. The bathroom was well equipped and clean with a great shower, plenty of hot water with good water pressure. There is a safe and a refrigerator in the room, but no clock. We had a room on the 8th floor with a view of Sagrada Familia. The room was quiet and there were blackout curtains (great for sleeping in). We did not have the breakfast. But as others have said there is a market a block away. It opens at 8am and closed fairly early in the evening, not sure what time but it wasn't open late a night. As many others have said, the location is in a relatively quiet area (Exiample) but just a few blocks from the Girona Metro stop and a 10 minute walk to the Passeig de Gracia Metro stop. By the way, the Metro in Barcelona is the best metro we've ever encountered in all of our travels to many major cities! It is cheap ($1 per ride compared to $2.25 in NYC), extremely reliable and we never waited more than 4 minutes for any train. There is even a timer letting you know when the next train will arrive and it was ALWAYS accurate (or quicker!). We found the T10 ticket to be the best bargain. 7.70Euros for 10 rides and both you and any one you're traveling with can use it at the same time. Buy it in any train station and at the airport. We never felt unsafe in this neighborhood even late at night. If we went back to Barcelona we may stay in a busier area in Barrio Gotic or Barceloneta just because there would be more to do at night very near the hotel, but if you want a little quieter area, than this is for you! We would have loved to have stayed at one of the chains others hotels (Jazz Hotel) but it didn't fit into our budget. The Europark was a good value. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Griff1966
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 4 nights in Barcelona. The hotel was great, Fantastic location - not too far away from anywhere. Metro stn within a couple of minutes walk. Rooms were clean, and the showeres were fantastic. Staff were really helpfull. On one occasion our room safe wouldn't open, they were up in the room to re-set the safe in less than five minutes. Front receptionist were great in giving out directions. The only bad thing I can really say about the hotel is the price of the breakfast. We did go on the first day but after seeing what was on offer for the price we left. Just round the corner is a little cafe where we ate our breakfast every day, also there is an indoor market withing a couple of minutes walk. But overall an really good hotel, in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet, Central Location & Designer Feel - Could not Fault”
Reviews.Author: StuartSussex
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very hard to fault, even for someone who travels a fair bit & is getting more and more picky. Location is excellent in the heart of the Eixample area. Its in a reasonably quiet location. But its only one block to Girona Metro station (Yellow Line 4), which in turn is 1 stop (15 mins walk) down to Urquinaona station near the central Catalunya Square. The Metro seemed very safe even at night. Just away from the hotel we found lots of local places for good cheap breakfast & a good late bar (the Daily Telegraph) on Carrer de Pao Claris, the street just before the main boulevard (Carrer de Gracia). Head right out of the hotel for 10 minutes, then you'll see it by the Guinness sign where the road branches right. The hotel is very designer with flat screens on the wall, good free wi-fi, a comfortable bed and a well stocked black and white style bathroom. Really excellent. There is also a large safety deposit box in the room, though I personally never felt that in danger of being robbed at all. Your main problem will be waking up. Rooms at the back especially are silent, with blackout curtains, so it could be any time in the room! A nice problem to have when on holiday. If I went again to Barcelona, I would go out of my way to stay at this hotel again. It really was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “comfy & pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: karwalkers
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable in this Europark hotel. The bed was comfy, the shower was good, etc. The breakfast was very good, in a room with a view! The staff is very accommodating - when I called the front desk to ask where I could get a pool towel, they sent a housekeeper up within minutes with 2 towels. (We tried out the pool, late one afternoon, at which time it's on the shady side of the roof & it was pretty chilly up there! Plus, the pool is very shallow - good for a quick dip.) Front desk reliably called a cab to get us to the airport. The only negative is the location. Were we to return to Barcelona, which we hope to do!, we'd like to stay a little closer to Passeig de Gracia / La Rambla (definitely not on La Rambla!). While we were close to Sagrada Familia, that's a one-day sight to see. More of the "action" is west of this hotel. It's in a residential neighborhood, which means that coming back late at night, the streets are empty & quiet. Probably NOT a hazard, & we certainly had NO problems, but it could be uncomfortable for some people. It's a l-o-n-g walk down to the beach, about 40 minutes. Overall, though, this is a good place to stay, near metro stations if you want to go that way, and comfortable amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookmama22
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from 3 nights-really enjoyed the hotel, very lovely and comfortable, good location-would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DomfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Massive very comfortable double bed, high quality rooms, excellent staff. Really well sound-proofed (would not know on a busy road). Aircon prooved vital on hot nights. Fabulous fill your boots breakfast buffet. Close to Girona tube/metro. Kept luggage until late into the evening prior to taxi to airport. Only criticism - pool was tiny, but I imagine merely used to cool off. Helpful to have 3 pcs available (2 on 1st floor, 1 in lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in an okay location”
Reviews.Author: DeFlooda
Reviews.Content: The room was nice - big, clean and comfortable and the airconditioning was much appreciated since we were there in august. Pool on the roof was nice after a day of sightseeing - even though it's very small and only about 2 feet deep, you can cool off and relax up there and it wasn't crowded. Free computer/internet in the lobby was great. Service was ok - felt like we were annoying the front desk with our handful of questions The hotel is a bit out of the way - there are metro stops nearby so it's easy to get down to the Barri Gotic and Las Ramblas, but it was pretty quiet and desolate at night. I wasn't comfortable walking around once it got dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: BigBree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europark for a week in August; the weather was extremely steamy, so the highly functioning AC at the Europark was by far our favorite/most vital amenity. Rooms are spotlessly clean and decorated in a trendy fashion. While not enormous, the rooms are extremely functional and well designed. The soundproofing is exceptional, something to look for in a bustling city like Barcelona. We never heard any other guests. Breakfast, while a nice amenity, is nothing exceptional. There are numerous cafes around the hotel that can take care of your AM needs. Staff is fairly helpful and efficient, though unobtrusive. Location is good -- only a block or two to the Girona metro and a 5-10 minute walk to the bustling Paseo de la Gracia. High speed internet was a great amenity -- bring your laptop (all rooms have a laptop sized safe). Although there are a few computers for guest access, all seemed to be occupied at all times with people checking their facebook accounts. Go figure. As a random side note, I hated the shampoo. If you're a hair snob, bring your own. If you're looking for a place to eat nearby, we'd recommend La Rita on Calle Aragon. Great value for money and very nice (very popular among the neighborhood locals). Avoid the tourist traps on Paseo de la Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location & Great City”
Reviews.Author: BettyFred
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night break at the Europark Hotel. We are two girls in our early twenties, and we were looking for a relaxing hotel that was still close enough to the main city. LOCATION was perfect for what we were looking for, only a 5min stroll to Rambla de Catalunya, which turned out to be our favourite part of the city. We were still easy walking distance from La Ramblas and Gothic quarter etc. but taxis were also very cheap (never paid more than 7euro to return back in the evening). The hotel is in a slightly quieter area but we never felt unsafe walking around and we slept well as there was not as much noise. The hotel is also 2mins away from a supermarket, which is great for water etc, as the mini-bar/hotel bar was quite expensive. SERVICE at the hotel wasn't particularly great, whilst most staff (bar,maids,reception) were polite and helpful, it often took a while to find them and the service at the bar during the day was very slow. We also encountered one very rude member of reception staff when checking out, but overall it was pretty average for a 3 star hotel. ROOM/DECOR was really nice and modern, extremely clean and well maintained. All public areas of the hotel eg.pool/toilets, were of the same high standard and we really couldn't fault anything in this area. LIKED MOST- Location, cleanliness and decor, coffee,good sized bathroom with plenty of mirrors and lights and an excellent shower! Pool (small,cold & shallow-but needed after a long hot day walking around Barcelona) DISLIKED- Slow service, expensive breakfast (definitely worth eating elsewhere, loads of nice little places nearby) expensive bottled water, no view or balcony from our room. Overall, great hotel in a great location and would definitely reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fairy2009
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Hotel Europark, we stayed in Barcelona for 7 nights and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. The room was very clean and spacious with a very comfortable bed and a modern decor. The hotel is close to a metro station and a 20 min walk away from La Rambla and about 10 min walk from the Sagrada Familia. The room had a mini bar, air con, large TV, balcony and the bathroom was very clean with a good shower. On the 8th floor there is a small pool and loungers which is a nice place to relax after exploring the city. If we return to Barcelona in the future we would definatly stay at the Hotel Europark again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, just a little too far out of the action. But good value.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: This was surprisely nice. We stayed in the Top View room, which was great. We had our own balacony. The pool was great and the hotel is very trendy and clean. However, it is a little out of the action and we spent about 20 euros on cabs everyday. So try and get a good deal on the room to make up for the cab costs. Also, the service is not that great, particularly on the front desk. We encountered a very rude man when we checked out. So go with low expectations and don't let it bother you as the hotel is very nice, clean and very well renovated. I would definately recommend though at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: oranisobel
Reviews.Content: We spent our first three nights in Spain here and were very pleased. The room was a good size, clean and very comfortable. The hotel is pretty chic, with a great pool deck on looking out on the city. The location is good (easy to access from the airport), but just a bit removed from the chaos of the center of the city. Our only complaint is that the "queen" bed was actually two single beds pushed together, but this seems to be a common thing in European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - But.......”
Reviews.Author: lizh30
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Europark Hotel for 3 nights, we got a very good deal for 3 nights and were absolutely delighted with the standard of accommodation. Having travelled frequently on business throughout Europe this was almost the best hotel I have stayed in (we stayed here for leisure). The room was great, lovely balcony and air-con and good facilities. The room servicing was excellent and we have to say that overall the facilities, accommodation and atmosphere are brilliant. Here comes the 'But.....' we had an unfortunate incident by way of a bottle of red wine leaking from our daypack - not an evening of revelry but something that happened at 11.00am this morning as we were packing for check out. We mopped up the damage in the room, noticing that there was some staining on the duvet but deciding that mopping that up with the pristine white towels was not the best strategy. We then checked out but when we returned some 3 hours later for our left luggage we were presented with a 150€ bill for 'damaged duvet and mattress'. To say we were astounded is an understatement - whilst we acccepted responsibility for the problem, we struggled to see the justification of the cost. A long and rather heated debate ensued, during which we were threatened by the staff calling the police - not necessary, and very heavy handed - to the result that we paid up. This hotel is lovely and the accommodation is great but we were very shocked that a slip-up/accident resulted in such heavy handed treatment (we later felt tempted to claim ownership of the said mattress and duvet cover we had apparently paid for). Is it a case of lets sting these tourists? - I hope not because this tainted an otherwise perfect stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jetman79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for 3 nights before and 3 nights after after a cruise. This hotel looked nice online and was even better in person. It was clean and staff was very friendly. Only encountered one cleaning lady who didn't speak english. Roof top pool although shallow was perfect for cooling off. They need a few more chairs though. It was close enough to walk to pretty much anywhere you want to go but far enough away from the crowds. Plenty of shops and restarants in the area. Free wirless internet was sometimes slow but did the trick. Don't bother with the hotel breakfast. Its to expensive and there are plenty of others places to eat in the area. Overall this hotel met all my expecations and more. Note:Beware of pickpockets in the crowded areas.My wallet was stolen in la ramblas the first day there. The hop on hop off bus is a great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, clean, well-priced hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: P_Larua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our kids, aged 20 and 18, in mid July. The lobby and rooms were modern and stylish and clean. The kids had a corner room which was quite large, ours was slightly smaller but still of ample size with good storage in the wardrobe. Big flat screen tellys with Spanish and English channels. The rooms were clean and cool and well maintained throughout our stay. The staff were courteous and efficient. We ate breakfast at the hotel only on the last day and though it is a bit pricey at 13 euro per person, there was a huge selection of cold and cooked foods including eggs and bacon. We all ate our fill and definitely got our money's worth. The location is about a 10 minute walk to Placa de Catalunya so not dead central but an easy walk. Very close to Casa Battlo and Passig de Gracia, an amazing street for shopping. The pool on the roof, though small, was a real treat and the wide cushioned benches make a comfortable place to have your siesta. There is even some shade on the roof if you prefer not to bake in the sun. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small, elegant, centrally located and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Transcending
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located near downtown shopping and transit and has the elegant aura of a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price / value”
Reviews.Author: K8th
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms with classy design, roof terrace with a (small and ice-cold, but still) swimming pool, very friendly staff... I would certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, Great Location & Excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: GillyBEngland
Reviews.Content: A great city hotel which is close enough to las ramblas to walk within a few minutes but far enough to avoid the hustle and bustle if wanted. Spotlessly clean hotel, lovely roof terrace and pool area Close to Metro station for easy access of city and surrounding areas Having travelled extensively I found this excellant value for money and would definately stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel in the center of Barca”
Reviews.Author: papillion8123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable. Nice situation. Very close to shopping area. 20 min by foot to Rambla. Personnel on the reception speak English and ready to help with all the questions. There is a great view on the night city from the terrace on the 8-th floor (swimmig pool situated). The supermarket and market are situated on the same street. There are not many restaraunts on this street, but you can walk 10-15 minutes to te main area with food or you can eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 3 night stay at the Europark. The hotel is in a great location. Out of the hustle and bustle of the tourism areas, but close enough to enjoy a pleasent walk to them. 1 min away from tube station! within easy walking distance of sagrada familia. Very modern rooms and cool pool area. very clean. friendly staff. would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: pinkturquoise
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this Hotel after we finished our Cruise. The room was the best one we'd stayed in, the staff were helpful, everything was handy. There is free Internet service which was great to keep in touch with home. It is only a 15minute walk to Passieg De Gracia which takes you to Catalunya Place and La Ramblas, there is a supermarket in the next block, a pharmacy round the corner (and a great hairdresser - Abel) and if you want to have breakfast al fresco there are two great eateries just around the corner and across the road on the corner. I would stay here again if I went back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChcgStar
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early for a one night stay after a cruise. We were checked in right away and in our room by 930AM. THe hotel was clean,room was clean and roomy compared to the hotel we stayed at pre-cruise. I was totally happy with the hotel and the front desk was VERY helpful! I would stay there again and again !!! Hotel was close to Las Rambla-a short walk! If you are looking for a good restaurant in Las Rambla don't pass up "Taxidermist" food is excellent and so is the sangria!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: milkmanYotvata
Reviews.Content: we arrived to the Europark hotel late at night.we got one of the suits in the hotel. It was graet.the hotel location is about 15 minuts walk from the Rambla.there is metro near by.very clean and very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bondigirl-sydney
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. The location is ideal, not right in the centre of the action but not too far away either and the hotel is in a very safe residential area. We walked to most places on foot and when we were in a hurry we took a taxi which never amounted to more than 5 Euros. The rooms are very clean and modern. My favourite part of the hotel was the roof-top pool which was great to unwind after a day on your feet. Recommended by other reviewers on TA, we went to the restaurant La Rita - delicious food and excellent value but they do fill up out so make sure to make a reservation (you are given an option of 2 sittings). We took the metro from Girona station, around the corner from the hotel, to Park Guell and airport and it was very easy (you can buy 10 trips on the one ticket very cheaply and several people can use the one ticket). Most of the staff were very helpful although on the last day did come across a grumpy staff member at the front desk. Overall thought the hotel was very good value and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: pinkluvinbiatch
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, just 15 minute walk from La Ramblas. We had a balcony as requested however it faced the main road which was very noisy at night with motobikes and ambulances flying up and down. Mini bar was fully stocked and reasonably priced for Barcelona. Towels were changed daily and room was spotless and could not fault it. Booked welcome gift via Expedia but this was not recieved. Buffet breakfast is charged approx £30 for two breakfasts (very expensive) the food was cold even though it was supposed to be hot... The roof terrace with pool was fantastic overlooking the city and again very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Europark and great location”
Reviews.Author: Oscar2010
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Location was excellent near Passeig De Gracia. For the most part, front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They especially appreciated it when we spoke in Spanish. Clean, chic, had adjoining rooms with my friend and her baby which was perfect. Only thing missing - they NEED A GYM!! Then it will be truly competitive with similiar properties in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, good value.”
Reviews.Author: envejeciendo
Reviews.Content: This is a small clean hotel located to a walking distance of Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera etc. Funny enough, there is a nice and clean market close by (50 mts) coming out to your right where you can meet the real Simpsons’s Moe. He is a lookalike who owns a coffee bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: china_traveler07
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - modern, clean, and recently renovated. Great location for exploring Barcelona (5-10 min walk to Passeig de Gracia, 10-15 min walk to La Rambla, close to the metro for other sights). It is located on a busy street in a nice, quiet, safe residential area (L'Eixample). It is a bit of a walk to La Rambla, so if you like to be in the heart of the action, I would stay on La Rambla. If you're like me (i.e., actually like the option of leaving the party), this is a great hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: key-eat
Reviews.Content: this is an amazing hotel not 2 be missed ! for the price we paid this hotel ticked all the boxes ! would defo come back again ! barcelona is a beautiful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “excellent , very clean and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: weegemBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend at this hotel, and it was extremely quiet and comfortable. The huge bed was really comfy and spotlessly clean as was the whole room. the bathroom was large and well equipped, including toiletries which was renewed every morning. Did not eat in hotel, so cannot comment. 10-15 walk to ramblas but this was fine as weather was sunny. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What you lose in location, you gain in value.”
Reviews.Author: Deartje
Reviews.Content: This sleek designer hotel is clean, modern and almost all functional -- however one of two elevators was inoperative. My window faced another ugly city building wall so I kept my drapes closed while I was there. The room decor was in dark colors but there was adequate room lighting to make up for it and the room was very quiet at night. The location was a bit of a walk from the main street frequented by tourists, but I felt this was an asset as the local restaurants and bars were cheaper. And while I did not use the Metro, there was a station about a block away from the hotel. Taxi's are easy to hail from the street right in front of the hotel as well. Overall, I would not mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel - very good value.”
Reviews.Author: lilybriscoe
Reviews.Content: Europark is a clean, modern, and well located hotel. Interior decor is fashionable and lots of stripes. The hotel has FREE WI-FI which adds value, in my opinion. Sagrada Familia is close by and Passeig de Gracia - a main drag in Barcelona and a central metro stop, is about 6 blocks away. Notably, being just a few blocks away from the main drag makes a notable difference in the quality of hotel that you get for you money. The front desk staff was polite and effectively communicated with us in English. We purchased the breakfast plan with our room - the dining room was nice and the breakfast was varied and generous. The breakfast room staff was friendly. The room we had was a bit small (we are budget conscious so we took one of the less expensive rooms), but the bathroom was large and modern -- enclosed shower and great water pressure. Has air conditioning that seemed effective -- but it was not warm in Barcelona when we visited so I can't say for sure about that. The hotel faces a very busy street, but the windows are thick so when they are closed you don't hear anything. When the windows are open, you do hear the whoosh of traffic, but there is very little horn honking in Barcelona and the traffic dies down around midnight. However, I live in New York City, so I may be less sensitive to traffic noise than others. I am a clean freak, and I was very impressed by the cleanliness of rooms and the hotel overall. It is sort of no frills in terms of service -- you transport your own luggage but the hotel has elevators so this isn't much of a problem. Also, no one orients you to the room -- there are printed instructions in the room regarding safe, phone, etc. Our air conditioning didn't work at first, but someone came by and fixed that. Hand towels are changed daily, but fresh bath towels are on request. There is a small pool on the roof with a nice view of city. There weren't many Americans in the hotel -- mainly Dutch and French tourists, but everyone used either English or Spanish to communicate with the staff. Overall, this is a really nice hotel and a very good value for the money. Once again, Trip Advisor turned came through for us -- based on the reviews I read before booking, I had an accurate sense of what to expect!

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel for a great value”
Reviews.Author: Zanobi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January for a little vacation with my boyfriend. I had found a special fare on the Europark website for a minimum of 3 nights at 60 euro a night. Considering that for two people that's almost as much as you would pay for a hostel, I was quite impressed. The hotel is really modern and has this great sleek black and white striped theme. The staff was very welcoming and even allowed us to pay early due to some credit card issues. Upon booking I had requested a room with a balcony and that's what we got. It looked out onto this large street, not too noisy and with a sun screen so it wasn't too bright in the morning. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. Also easily accessible to the metro and free wifi. Only negatives? The elevators were broken so we had to use the service elevators. It was only a problem when they were cleaning the rooms. Favorites? The free champagne included in the package I booked which arrived shortly after we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tixiebella
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend break at the beginning of Feb 09. The hotel is modern and clean and in a great central location to allow you to walk on foot to all attractions of the city. Mini Bar in the room, the only drawback is there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast is nice with more than enough selection of fruit, cakes, cereals & cooked breakfast. We had a great stay at this hotel and would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Residential Area”
Reviews.Author: cazpom
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Europark Hotel. As others mentioned, it is walking distance (20 minutes) from Plaza Catalunya and only a few blocks away from all the Gaudi architecture. It is, however, detached from the touristy areas. I thought that this was an advantage since I actually felt that I was living there; while i was walking around the neighborhood and going into cafes, I rarely saw any other tourists so you get a very authentic feel of the city. I loved it and appreciated the experience! My friend, on the other hand, did not enjoy it as much as I did. She does admittedly prefer the night life more than I do, and the hotel is a bit of trek from the busy hot spots of the city. And, be prepared to do a lot of walking... Still, I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: albertasky
Reviews.Content: The Euro Park in Barcelona is a great find. Within walking distance to all sites, local market and great restaurants close by. The staff were friendly and rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: ScottDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Europark has a great location in the Eixample district -- just outside the hustle and bustle but within easy walking distance to the main drags of Barcelona, or one block to a subway stop that can take you anywhere else. It's also one block from the Concepcio market, which has numerous fresh meat & produce stands, a supermarket and an electronics store. The hotel itself is beautifully renovated, and I found my room and bed exceptionally comfortable and nice. Usually this would cost a fair amount, but I got an incredible deal on six nights there (granted, in the offseason). With a relatively small but excellent, multilingual staff, it seemed, their prices can probably undercut some of the competition. The complimentary newspapers and Guia del Ocio are a nice touch. There was still renovation work going on during my visit, mainly on the two guest elevators, so guests and staff had to share the freight elevator. But it wasn't a problem, and the lift happened to be one of the nicest freight elevators I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: allup01
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a couple of days stay in Barcelona. The Europark Hotel is a very modern hotel which has obviously just been renovated. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is outstanding. It is only 15 minutes away from the city centre at the most. There are many restaurants nearby, although most are closed over the Christmas period. I would totally recomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: UKAmericano
Reviews.Content: Chose this centrally located hotel based on the positive reviews on this site. The comments were spot on! One street away from a market, 10 min walk east to Sagrada Familia Cathedral and 15 min walk southwest to Placa de Catalunya. Good breakfast buffet, although the eggs were usually cold. So-so view from the rooftop pool. Friendly, English-speaking front-desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa097
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europark for 4 nights in August '08. We booked two rooms, a double and a single as there were three of us. The rooms were clean, spacious and very comfortable. An unexpected bonus was that the rooms had adjoining doors which was very convenient and made it feel as if we had one massive room. The rooms had everything you could ask for of a 3* hotel and more. Modern design, large comfortable beds, very good air con, large powerful shower, a free safe and minibar which was handy for keeping our own drinks cold. The location was in the more residential Eixample area but it was only a fifteen minute walk to Las Ramblas in one direction and La Sagrada Familia in the other. The Placa de Catalunya was also only about fifteen minutes walk away which is where we got off and on the A1 airport bus, this is a quick, easy and cheap way to get to and from the airport. You will wait no longer than ten minutes for a bus in either direction. There is no need to get a taxi. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke very good English. Checking in and out was quick and easy. They were happy to keep our bags in a cupboard behind reception most of the day as we had a late flight home. I would recommend this hotel to any one going to Barcelona. It is probably the best hotel experience i have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: micdro
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days at the EuroPark hotel, Barcelona. The hotel is perfect, the staff is very nice. We asked for a room with balcony, and that exactly what we have got. Breakfast is lovely with cheeses, eggs, fruit, pastries etc. The pool is lovely but only 80cm deep! Overall I would say this is probably a 3 stars hotel better than a lot of 4 stars hotels I've met in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Defo recommend”
Reviews.Author: Binnie32
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I have just come back from a spur of the moment 4 day break in BCN. We usually stay at Hotel Jazz which is owned by same chain but they were full so we booked here instead. The hotel has been recently refurbished to a high standard. Contemporary, cool & comfortable. The rooms are fairly good size with good AC which is a necessity in summer. Reception staff were friendly & helpful booking restaurants for us when requested. Bathrooms don't have bath however do have large shower and good hairdryer. Iron & board is available on request and there is a safe in room. Sat TV with usual news channels but no MTV. Hotel is located in Eixample district which is mostly residential but has a nice feel to it and you will stumble across funky restaurants & cafes whilst wondering around. It's a 10/15 min walk to Placa Cataluyna and Las Ramblas. This was our 6th visit to BCN and I'm glad we stayed in this hotel as although it's not quite as central as we usually stay, it's good to stay somewhere different to allow you to explore and discover new shops, restaurants, etc. Rooftop pool is fairly small but what is to be expected for a city centre pool! It does the job of cooling you off whilst sunbathing/chilling in the sun listening to music on the BOSE speakers they have outside playing 'lounge' music. I would definately recommend staying in this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaizerSoze43
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in the Europark Hotel from the 11th of July 2008 to the 13th of July 2008. It was a last minute booking that was made due to the terrible weather in Dublin. We arrived at 11:00 am on Friday morning and we were checked in and in our rooms within 5 mins. It will cost approx €20.00 by taxi from Barcelona airport (approx 10 mins) to the Europark hotel.. We stayed in a double room and it was perfect. Modern design, spotless and everything you would need from hairdryers etc to a well stocked mini bar. The room we stayed in had not got a scenic view. It basically looked onto the back of other buildings, but we weren't they to look out the window. The staff were excellent. The room was kept spotless. Unlike a lot of places when you travel abroad, the breakfast was excellent. The was so much to choose from. Everything you could have from back home and everything you would find in a Spanish breakfast. The Europark hotel is located approx 5-10 mins walk (depending on age etc) from the main designer shopping street and also from the top of Las Ramblas. It is only 5 mins walk from the Sagrila Familla (not sure of correct spelling) and all the restaurants, shops, bars in that area. You can walk to the beach (which is brilliant) but its much easier just to take a 5 min cab ride. The taxis are cheaper in Barcelona than Dublin. Actually, everything is cheaper in Barcelona than Dublin. We had to check out at 12:00 on our last day and even though out flight home wasn't until 10:30pm were were allowed to use any of the facilities within the hotel. We made the most of this by lounging by the roof top pool having ice cold beers delivered up to us!! The pool area is small but it is decked out well. We had the whole area to ourselves as the hotel didn't seem to be busy. The pool is only waist deep but it was ideal in my opinion. The roof top was a lovely place to relax and catch the last of the sun. We stayed in the Hotel Rialto before when in Barcelona and while it has a more central location (just off Las Ramblas) it didnt come near the Europark for quality. I would use the Europark Hotel and would recommend it for couples in the 20 - 40 age group.

Reviews.Title: “Without any doubt a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: minosrex
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July 2008. I was attracted by the modern design, the rooftop pool and the moderate price. On average I stay in hotels throughout Europe around 15 times a year, and this is one of the best ones I've visited. The design and finition of the place are flawless (not like other Spanish boutique hotels where things look good but fall apart when you touch them). The interplay of black and white colours, the nice floors, flatscreen TV, good bathrooms (with a system to transfer TV sound to them) and sturdy doors all contributed to a really nice atmosphere. As some people have criticised, the rooftop pool is quite shallow but it is clearly meant for relaxing, not for swimming, and that is exactly why I wanted it! Too bad there's no bar next to it. Breakfast is expensive as always so I'd rather have croissants and pastries in one of the many places around. Service in general was extremely friendly, and the laundry service was fast and perfect. Finally, location is quite good: not in the old town but close to different metro stations (Gracia, Girona and others). At night, a taxi from the seaside will cost no more than 5-7 euros. Passeig de Gracia, and the delightful Cerveceria Catalana are within walking distance. In short, I really felt well-treated at this hotel, and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “room only perfect deal but dont expect too much else”
Reviews.Author: MaryLouStockport
Reviews.Content: i stayed here as a birthday treat - did a deal via Opodo where one night was free and flight times excellent. i was a single traveller and was given a fairly spacious double room at the front with an excellent shower and bathroom - fresh clean towels everyday because i left card on door requesting room service - location location location with this place; just round corner from Place de Gracia main aeroport A1 bus stop plus tourist bus plus nearby train station and just near to Casa Battlo. i had hand baggage only so no probs just walking down from bus (4euro fare). DONT bother with the first floor bar for drink or breakfast - soulless and expensive with no service. there are great nearby cafe's and restaurants selling good value fresh daily food (even sunday morning breakfast) and friendly but not over friendly service. (for dinner try Madrid : Barcelona or of course queue at La Rita) couple of bars / restaurants on Catalunya from where you could watch beautiful people right near to Casa Battlo and you could get decent glass of wine plus water for under 5 euro's (Tenorimilo Brasserie i think the best one was called - Browns further down nice but tres expensive) but the best thing about Europark is down stairs public batchroom just behind reception has a full shower in it so my bags were kept under the concierge eye for the last day as i wasnt travelling till 8pm and then i could clean up properly for flight home - as of course i had had to check out of my room usual a.m. would definitely go back as great location and good value if you get a deal

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry60
Reviews.Content: I checked the reviews on this website before I booked and found them informative. I was looking for ages trying to find a central hotel in Barcelona not too far from the city centre but just away from the noise, and this hotel was great for that. Getting to the hotel from the airport was so easy, we caught a bus outside (A1) going to the city cente which cost just over three euros and took about 20 minutes. We then had a short walk to our hotel. On arrival we were greeted by the receptionist who booked us in with no hassel. Our room was 409 which was at the back of the hotel Overlooking some building work next door, but not a problem. The room was very retro with all the furniture in black and white. The room was very spacious with a flat screen tv. hair dryer, a safe and a mini bar. Ideal for what we wanted. We found the hotel staff always helpful and willing to offer advice if you were stuck for directions. We took the option to get our breakfasts at the local cafe which was great as we sat and watched the world go by and relaxed in the sun and cheap er than the hotel. To get to Catalunya it took us abourt 10/15 minutes walking which was a great place to start your day to either catch the bus touristic which cost 26 euros for 2 days an ideal way of seeing the sights of Barcelona. You will be able to pick up a route map at various places in the city, but as a rough guide: Blue Route: Covers the South and West of the City, visiting the Old Town, the Olympic area, the Port, the Zoo and Estació Sants. Red Route: This route takes you on a tour of the North and the further Western part of the city including Sagrada Familia, FC Barcelona, Palau Reial and lots more. Forum Route: This route covers the East of the city around the Olympic Port, the beach, a beautiful park and the Forum. There are plenty of sights to see we just liked to walk and just see the sights randomly. We especially liked the cable car ride, the walk around the marina, The ramblas, the Gaudi masterpieces around the city and just taking in the general atmosphere. We had no trouble with pick pockets etc but you have to be sensible when you are out and just keep your valubles at the hotel and just take out what you need. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed Barcelona and would go back again. And stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fine for a base in the centre”
Reviews.Author: GirlwiththeMousyHair
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a fabulous bank holiday weekend in Barcelona. We booked europark because it was cheap (we booked very late) and central...takes about 10 - 15mins to walk to Las Ramblas, the same to Sagrada Familia in the opposite directions, 10mins to Bari Gothic, about 40 mins to Parc Guell (yes, we walked EVERYWHERE!) we just wanted somewhere to provide a good base and that's what Europark did - the room was smallish but the bed was a decent size, as was the bathroom (good power shower and comfortable mattress), we were on a side street so very quiet...the neighbourhood feels very safe to walk around in. It was very clean and the staff were very friendly...letting me stumble on practising my spanish and catalan when their english was perfect! we didn't eat there or use the bar so i can't comment on that. Only two downsides were there is no natural light so we easily slept right through the 1st morning and on our second night we found 3 baby cockroaches running around on the floor!! not a romantic hotel or one where you'd spend lots of time - but if you're going to barcelona to spend it in a hotel, you are in the wrong city!!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked EuroPark--absolutely recommend”
Reviews.Author: kloot
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modest and simple but it's very clean and located in quiet area that's convenient for walking and experiencing Barcelona. I found the majority of the staff to be VERY kind and helpful, though they do appreciate it if you attempt to speak Spanish and are a reasonable person. We had a lovely terrace that was a great place to decamp nightly and relax before dinner and enjoy the sunsets. I don't know how one can complain about that and I personally noticed that some of the guests seemed rude and demanding of the hotel employees--which angered me more! The man at the desk was fab as my friend NEVER received her luggage and he went to great lengths to assist us in making calls and attempt to negotiate with the airport bureaucracy. There is a very convenient internet/tv room that you can use for free and have coffee and a drink. We never ate the breakfast--as it seemed too pricey--but the lady made us coffee every morning and was absolutely lovely. They are doing construction to expand the hotel and modernize and I have a feeling that once that happens price will go up considerably but otherwise, I would recommend this place for sure! And, don't stay near the ramblas--it's so touristy, noisy and full of drunken, shady characters. I really love the city--it's ideal for folks who like to walk and experience amazing architecture, art, design as well as a seaside location. Also, I'm a New Yorker and definitely found that you have to be careful. My friend had her wallet stolen on the way home at the airport...so heed the warnings!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ruth&rich
Reviews.Content: OK, so the hotel staff dont act like you're their best mate but why should they? We found the staff to be pleasent enough (maybe this was because we tried to learn a little Catalan!) The lady who served us at the bar was very nice and even gave us a bit of help with pronounciation! The hotel was always clean. The location is ideal. The area felt very safe. Overall our stay was very good and we have recommended this hotel to friends and family who are considering a visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the draw”
Reviews.Author: Globe_trotter_SF_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days last week. This isn't a place you stay for luxury. You stay because of the central location. In fact, the location couldn't be better. It's so close to Passeig de Gracia, and the metro stations. The other travelers at this hotel complained of street noise- what do you expect, you're in a major city! I had a single room facing the courtyard, so I wasn't subject to too much noise. The only noise I encountered was the sound of people slamming their doors and the loud American family staying next door (I'm an American and this is a plea to other American travelers- PLEASE do not embarass the rest of us, who are respectful, sophisticated travelers. I thought it was an entire group of students traveling. Much to my shock, it was one family of four making all that obnoxious noise. Unbelievable!) Anyway, there's a great market virtually next door (Mercat de la Conceptio) and a few coffee bars, and a lovely bakery. Skip breakfast at the hotel and go to the bakery or a coffee shop nearby. I agree with other travelers- La Rita restaurant (2 blocks away) is an absolute MUST. My only regret is that I went there my last night and didn't have an opportunity to go back multiple times; but, it was a great meal to end my great trip. The prices were shockingly low- I couldn't believe the quality of the food you got for such low prices. I've been to many 4 star restaurants that cost far, far more and I haven't enjoyed many of the meals as much as this little gem of a restaurant. Don't bother asking the front desk anything. They act like you ask for their kidney when you're only asking them a simple question. The front desk is cold, rude and utterly unhelpful. I may stay here again, just because of the central location, but the rooms are very small, and my experience with the front desk sort of tainted my experience.
